I have nothing but compliments for this product.

Reviews.Title: Flat Screen TV
Reviews.Author: Val
Reviews.Content: The size of the TV is perfect for the entertainment center.  It has great resolution and changing channels is quicker than on other TVs that I have seen.  I didn't know anything about this brand untill I started looking.  A great product.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, couldn't hold a WiFi signal
Reviews.Author: Carrington
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my mom's Christmas present. Easy to set up, looked great. However, it wouldn't stay on the WiFi connection for 10 minutes before interrupting viewing. Plugged our Roku into it, no problems whatsoever. Was placed 15 yards max from the router. We have WiFi signals from an Apple time capsule and whatever they sell you with Uverse. Neither worked with any consistency.Boxed it back up. Hopefully Vizio will sort this out, as it seems to be a firmware (software?) issue, but we weren't going to wait on that. Great TV if you just want to pay extra for nonfunctioning smart features.

Reviews.Title: Fonts not appropriate for size of TV
Reviews.Author: Megan
Reviews.Content: The fonts in the settings and most of the apps are not readable on this size of television. There is a "white light" fuzzy lettering on black issue. You have to be up close to see them. Normal television lettering such as commercials and the news are fine. It's just in the settings and apps.The remote is so bad, it's embarrassing. I'm not sure it's that easy to change remotes for this television, because I couldn't get other device remotes working with this. They easily hook up with Bravia. The support site has all the codes you should need, but even after a call to support (really nice, helpful support), I couldn't get other remotes to work with this television. They are selling a Vizio Universal Remote that is just as bad looking a this one. This one is like Taiwan, 1973.Sound and picture are really  pretty good, it's not a Bravia, but it's not the same price either.App navigation is not that great either, but it's OK. Like software, some TV's have better software features and navigation. If you are buying this for the apps, like YouTube and Netflix, you should choose something else. This is a second television for apps and DLNA (no cable), so I didn't want to spend much....in hindsight, I would have spent more. Not sure how LG apps are, but Bravia's are definitely better than this.If you're not buying this television for the apps, buy their lower model without the apps, and the picture and sound will most probably be quite acceptable as well. The remote is probably just as ugly...

Reviews.Title: Great for an inexpensive TV
Reviews.Author: Phoenix AZ
Reviews.Content: This TV is not flashy looking and has a bulky/cheap feel to it, but it is extremely light and has some great features for a lower end TV.  It only has 2 HDMI inputs so I ended up using the Component video input for my media player to avoid constantly swapping cables.  The built in WiFi worked fine for me although since it is only about 10 ft from my router I decided to run an Ethernet cable for a better connection.  I use Hulu and Amazon Instant Video regularly with no issues.  My biggest complaint is the lack of support for playing MP4 files from my DLNA NAS.  The product description say DLNA is supported and didn't mention which file types were supported (at least not that I saw).  It will play AVI files at least.  Another reviewer mentioned it will play MP4 files from a USB attached device which seems odd.  Another issue is that I use the 23" model in this product line for my computer monitor in the same room.  I hadn't really considered the fact that they would also use the same remote on the same frequency... oops, I had to cover the sensor on my monitor with electrical tape.  Overall it was a great purchase for the price as a secondary TV.  We bought a larger model in this product line for my mother-in-law for her birthday as well.

Reviews.Title: major short coming in Internet usage
Reviews.Author: Billerica50
Reviews.Content: I just installed this TV and I found one major issue.  All web based applications are opened in 25% of the screen making it very difficult to read anything unless very close to the set.  There is a blue button on the remote that is supposed to expand the web window to full screen , but it does not work.  I called support and after much back and forth they first said not all applications will expand, when I asked for any application that would expand, they went off line then came back and said they did not know of any.  In applications like Netflicks, after a movie is selected for play it does expand, but using anything like face book, or news feeds etc. all stay scrunched on the left.Visio support blamed the issue on Yahoo, saying they just did the hardware, Yahoo did the FW/SW.  I reminded them Yahoo did this work under contract to them and on their behalf.  It is a Visio's user manual that defined the operation of the blue button which does not work.  Support even said there are lots of buttons on remotes that do not function.  I reminded them that this blue button was the only one that did not work even though their manual specifically explained what it does.  What is even worse is that support said this used to work on older models.  Given it's critical importance to a smaller screen set, I can't believe they would allow such a change.  FINALLY they agreed to escalate the issue to engineering, stay tuned.

Reviews.Title: Vizio rocks!
Reviews.Author: Frank Thomas
Reviews.Content: One word for this TV. Fantastic! Out of the box and running in no time. The base attaches easily, the one-time setup for wi-fi is simple. I've had it for a little over a week now, and love the picture quality and screen size. And the price was right. I passed on the third-party warranty; sounded bogus from the reviews I read.

Reviews.Title: Very good value
Reviews.Author: Jody Mandel
Reviews.Content: The wifi set up was great.  The tv found y network immediately.The rest of the setup was easy.The picture is very good.I would recommend this tv.It has a narrower frame than some other TVA this size, so it is mostly tv.  You get a lot of tv in a small space.

Reviews.Title: Amazing, beautiful, right-out-of-the-box picture!  Network capability a boon, too
Reviews.Author: William W. Davis "famousdavis"
Reviews.Content: QUICK SUMMARY:  This is my first Vizio anything.  I was surprised by the lightweight build of this HDTV, but very pleasantly surprised at how beautifully it renders a picture, even right out-of-the-box.  I haven't fiddled with any of the color adjustments because to me, the picture is pretty darn good as-is.  The Internet applications (Netflix, Amazon Prime) work as expected, although I used a wired connection rather than WiFi because the WiFi signal seemed poor.  Recommended!BACKGROUND:  My six-year-old Samsung 37" TV died, and I wanted a new TV for the upcoming 2014 Olympics.  Frustrated by a Samsung product that was used very lightly over the last six years and that I paid over $1000 for that TV, I opted to try another brand.  I thought about getting an LG, but I read a user review about a horrible LG product failure and subsequent warranty experience, so I moved to try Vizio instead (I understand that every brand has 5-star and 1-star experiences alike, including Vizio).  In my home, I hook-up the TV to my stereo for sound, so I don't care about the sound from the TV itself.  I don't use cable or satellite, but I do watch HD sports programs over-the-air.  My family likes streaming movies from Netflix and Amazon Prime, so the "smart" part of the TV was an important feature (good-bye Roku, you served us fairly well....).WHAT I LIKE:- Gorgeous picture, right out of the box.  Blacks are black/very dark, whites are brilliant white, color depth is great, contrast was great.- The viewing angles are all very good for where we have the TV placed; they are notably better than our six-year-old Samsung TV this TV is replacing.- The "smart" TV functions work well, are fairly easy to use (searching is a little difficult given the remote control's lack of a QWERTY keyboard).  We've streamed Netflix and Amazon Prime movies without a problem using those built-in apps.- It was very light to pick-up and move around- The slender, 42" diagonal profile barely fits into my existing entertainment armoire (where six years ago, only a 37" TV would fit because of the bulkier designs back then)- It has 3 HDMI inputs, which for my needs, is sufficient- It has component input for our Wii- It has an RCA audio output for easy connection to our stereo (an optical audio output, too, for when we upgrade our home sound system)WHAT COULD BE BETTER:- I miss the swivel base of our old Samsung TV; this base doesn't swivel, but it's easy enough to reposition if you need to (tip: place felt underneath the TV stand to make it easier to move- The Wifi signal it received from our router seemed weaker than what our Roku could obtain, so I switched it to a wired connection instead- The remote control doesn't have back-lit keysCONCLUSION:  Visually, I'm very pleased with this TV.  I bought a 4-year Square Trade warranty, though, so I don't have to buy another TV anytime soon.  Recommended!

Reviews.Title: Get 'Smart' about the missing qwerty remote before you buy
Reviews.Author: Librarius42
Reviews.Content: I bought the 24" version (VIZIO E-Series E241i-A1) of this TV, and while it is good value for the money, there are some serious drawbacks you need to be aware of. First, the sound quality is pitiful. The speakers are smaller than most tweeters, and the sound they produce is hollow and tinny. There is no bass volume whatsoever. If you want full sound, plan to hook up a receiver or a set of computer speakers and make sure they have an optical connector for digital sound. Secondly, there is both missing information and misinformation on the Amazon page regarding the remote control. The remote control has NO qwerty keyboard. This was a big deal for me. I bought this TV specifically to use Netflix, and guess what? When I tried to login to my Netflix account I could input my user name, but I couldn't input my password because there was no on-screen keyboard. I was dead in the water.When I contacted tech support on the Vizio website, they repeated said that an on-screen keyboard would pop up. It didn't. When I asked if there was a qwerty remote I could buy, they said "There is NO qwerty remote for this TV." I was about ready to send the TV back when I decided to try one more time. Being a puzzle solver, I went back to the Netflix screen and reversed the sequence. I put the password in first and the user name second. It worked. I got an on-screen keyboard both times. Lastly, there ARE qwerty remote controls offered on Amazon for this TV. So my question to Vizio is why on earth would you offer an 'smart' internet ready TV with loads of APPs that require qwerty input, but not include a qwerty remote? That is just plain cheap and dumb marketing. And why would you deny that such remotes exist when they are for sale on Amazon? Wake up! You not only lose a star from me, but probably a lot of return customers.

Reviews.Title: Good picture, terrible DLNA and slow interface
Reviews.Author: D. Sauer "Unix Geek"
Reviews.Content: So, to start off, the picture is very good.  The anti-glare treatment on the screen works pretty well, and the off-angle viewing is very good both to the sides and vertically (important if you're, say, mounting this for view in a bedroom where you may be either standing up or laying down while watching).  I also liked the way that the stand attaches and removes, as it doesn't leave a stupid piece sticking out on a wall mount (the necessary allen wrench for attaching/removing the base was included, too).  It's got a nice downward-angled attachment for the power cord and the jacks on the back orient plugs parallel to the wall, so you can mount this quite close to a wall.  The frame also looked nice, though it felt pretty cheap / flimsy.  But how often do you handle a TV? :)However, the primary reason to get a "smart" TV is, IMHO, for the smartness.  And this TV is not very smart.  First, to connect this thing to a network, you must agree to some asinine Yahoo! Internet applications terms of service.  How the heck is Yahoo! even relevant anymore?  Whatever.  I had no intention of using Internet apps; I only wanted to view content from my own local network.  But you can't set up the IP address or otherwise connect it to a network until you agree to the click-through agreement.  Fine, I finally gave in and agreed.  Then, once you've done that, you're greeted with a *very* slow to respond set of apps.  Each app takes a fairly long time to load, and there are some pretty useless things on there.  Again, as I mentioned, I only wanted DLNA support to play videos and music from my existing media center network (XBMC on Ubuntu Linux, for the curious).  This POS not only takes *forever* to load the list of content (like, minutes), navigation is terrible.  No artwork is displayed, and, the best part, nearly no formats are supported.  Most all of my video is in mp4 format, which pretty much everything supports.  Not this - everything comes back "this format is not supported".  Go to Vizio's web site to find out what's supported, and all they have is a page saying that some formats may not be supported.  There's no list of what is or is not supported, just "some".  Ugh.  Look around online at formus, and people are talking about how bad Viso'z DLNA support is.  Granted, it did stream mp3s ok, but again without album art (all of my mp3s are tagged with id3v1 and 2 tags, with embedded album art) - and it was really slow to start playing them (over a nearly idle "wireless n" network).  Also, it does not broadcast on the network as a DLNA display device, so you can't do things like have your phone auto-discover the TV and play back to it.  It's a very, *very* minimal DLNA device with a sketchy implmentation of what they actually did finish (e.g, UTF support is broken, certain headers cause the TV to crash, etc).For what it's worth, I also used the Amazon instant video app.  While that app technically works, it also doesn't work well.  It does not provide access to your "watchlist", so you have to search for things you marked on something like a Roku or a better device.  There's no indication of video quality or now long it'll take to initially buffer, so if you're on a slow link, you just watch a wait cursor for however long it takes to get a video started.  It takes longer than necessary to navigate through available videos.  In summary, the Vizio Amazon app is unsurprisingly as poorly designed and unresponsive as the Vizio DLNA support.I returned the item indicating that it did not match the description on the page.  The product description says it's a DLNA-compatible smart TV, but that's like saying a child's tricycle is a car on the basis that it has more than two tires.  I bought a Samsung UN32EH5300 to replace it.  Sure, the Samsung was $100 more, but everything actually works on the Samsung.  Even the VESA mount is better; the Vizio mount used some really tiny metric bolts which were a different length on the top and the bottom, while the Samsung uses much more substantial bolts.  The Samsung's DLNA support is also way better; much faster loading (on the same network) and a better interface.  Also, there was no stupid clickthrough privacy agreement on the Samsung. :)With all that said, if you just want in inexpensive 32" LCD, the Vizio is not bad; it has a really good picture, and the remote isn't enormous.  But if you actually intend to use the "smart" features at all -- especially DLNA -- keep looking; I suggest the Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Perfect For Me
Reviews.Author: Anne Heath
Reviews.Content: The TV was delivered in less than 48 hours, with not a scratch. Initial hook up with my basic cable DVR had a minor glitch. I had to run the channel scan 4 times to get the "signal". To be honest I did call Vizio support. Very nice and polite young man calmed me down and said run the scan again (4th time) Bam! sound and vision have arrived. Tech support is I think in the USA, which is great. I have a bit of a hearing problem and if the person has an accent I have a hard time understanding directions. Ok  I am going to get a new cable box with a HDMI connection because I want HD. But the regular picture is really good. As mentioned I don't hear well and the sound on the TV was just fine for me at level 22. I'm very happy with the TV. Can't beat it for the price and of course Amazon is super with delivery time and tracking info. Happy Mothers Day To Me

Reviews.Title: Incredible Vizio led tv
Reviews.Author: Brian J. Topping
Reviews.Content: , The first tv arrived with a cracked screen. Amazon was understanding and fast in having me return it and without hesitation sent a replacement immediately. The tv is astonishing. Beautiful, clear, vibrant colors, incredible detailed images, fast 120Hz recovery speed. Fast Wi-Fi and component set up. A pure bargain. Don't buy anything more expensive in this size. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and great price!
Reviews.Author: Lesley Taylor
Reviews.Content: We love it. It's a fantastic TV--the picture quality is just as good, if not better, than some other big name TVs but without the inflated price. The sound is actually good too. We did not need to buy a separate sound bar. We have Netflix, so I love the idea of being able to watch streaming movies to this TV without the Wii attached to it. Also, the super slim frame is killer. This was a great buy!!! We are very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV, nothing spectacular
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Stewart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in the market for a new TV and looking to replace a 32" VIZIO LCD that we had in the bedroom that was slowly dying ( we did have it for about 7 years, so I felt that was fairly acceptable for a TV I spent $300 and change on ). I wanted something that supported DLNA as I have a media server with rips of our DVDs & Blu-ray purchases.Overall the TV is very nice.  The presets aren't too bad, and once you turn off the adaptive backlight control the picture can be really nice.  The one place where this panel can struggle is in really dark scenes, where even with all the noise & artifact reduction set to the max, you'll still see the noise in the background.  It's definitely more noticeable compared to the Samsung 47" LCD we have in the living room.  It doesn't make it unwatchable and after about 2 weeks with the TV I am noticing it less, but likely only because I'm getting used to it.  In bright colorful scenes, this TV is absolutely gorgeous and you'll be pleased to have it, when watching dark shows like The Following, there will be scenes that are hit or miss.  Sound is actually pretty decent for these super thin TVs coming out now.  There does seem to be MORE sound directed BEHIND the television than in front, but it seems to direct it in front fairly well.  A sound bar would likely be a worthy investment for this TV ( or most ANY thin TVs now ), but it's not required ( just makes sure it's not against a shared wall if you're watching TV really loudly :) ).The three places where this TV kind of falls short are: DLNA Video format support, overall interface & the remote.  I think most everyone here has touched on the interface so I won't go too much into it, but it is slow & clunky to deal with.  Sometimes it is so slow it's difficult to know if it responded to your last input.  DLNA video support is very limited.  MP4 playback is non-existent, MKV also fails, and very few AVis actually play.  I updated my twonky server ( runs on a WD MyBook Live ) and it finally started to play some of the AVIs better.  I then updated the firmware on the TV and I had Amazon streaming too which is nice, but the UI is far from ideal.Finally, the remote.  The remote is terribly weak, where it has to be pointed DIRECTLY at the lower left corner of the TV for the commands to register, and if there's even the slightest blockage forget anything working.Overall, I don't reget the purchase, and getting it for $479 + tax is definitely a steal for a "Smart" TV of this size.  While it's not perfect it will more than suffice for watching TV before bed.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy
Reviews.Author: hen803
Reviews.Content: When I first started looking for a tv for my bedroom, I wasn't considering a smart tv. After researching several tvs that were not smart tvs I came across a review of the Vizio 32" smart tv. The price was just a little more and after considering everthing it made sense to purchase the Vizio smart tv. Tv was delivered 3 days earlier than estimated.  Set up was a breeze. Picture is ok, sometimes the picture is a little dark and colors are a little washed out. Adjusting the picture and color was easy. I'm satisfied with my purchase. I also purchased a blue ray player but I haven't tried it yet. I exect the picture playing videos to be find. Yes I would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Crappy built in wifi
Reviews.Author: j.harvey
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for the wifi smart features. The built in wifi on this TV SUCKS! It will not stream anything without cutting in and out. We have Roku's on other TVs that are further from the wireless router and they will stream just fine without lagging. We have a dual band N router, and road runner extreme internet through Time Warner. This TV should have no problems streaming netflix or Hulu.Don't waste your money. Spend the extra money and get a nicer Smart TV or just get a Roku. I now have to buy a Roku to add to this not so smart TV.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture quality
Reviews.Author: Jessica McLellan
Reviews.Content: This TV is a phenomenal deal. It arrived at my house the DAY after I ordered it via amazon prime. The TV itself was packaged nicely in the Vizio box, which was inside another large shipping box.I found the instructions for setup very easy to understand and do. I assembled the entire TV myself, although honestly there wasn't that much to do--just attach the base. I am quite small, so if I can physically set this up on my own, virtually anyone can. I find the base very sturdy and it looks sleek. The TV itself is very thin and looks so modern. The finish is glossy. The tech side of set up was just as easy, following the instructions included. I connected to my wifi network with no problem.Netflix and Amazon instant video work seamlessly for me. This was one of the main reasons I wanted this TV. I had been using a Roku for years and occasionally Amazon instant video on my computer. The SmartTV function is great, and I love that all my TV features are so effortlessly worked in to one remote control.The picture is absolutely stunning. My friend has a Samsung plasma television and says my picture quality is lightyears better. And, the LED means no glare if you have many windows in your home that stream in sunlight.If you're trying to decide whether to go with the 120Hz feature or save some money by going 60Hz, I definitely recommend the 120Hz as this TV has. I can tell a noticeable difference in how clean and clear motion seems on the TV. If you watch a lot of sports, it is extremely apparent just how little motion blur there is. It's something I didn't really notice before with my old TV, but now that I have it I can see a visible difference. It just looks so great.I found this TV to be quite a good deal. I have been using it for 2 months now with no problems. I will be sticking with Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: DuctTape
Reviews.Content: Ok, I may not get out much. And with this TV I don't think I'm going out much either.Maybe 20 minutes opening box to getting mounted on the (existing) wall bracket to getting set up and on. And I am blow away. First movie playing was Transformers, which I wouldn't normally watch if it was free. I found I couldn't turn away! It was the Kramer of experiences for me.The colors were incredible. I didn't know eyes could be so blue. The depth just jumped. My wife kept asking if I had made a mistake and bought 3D. Some folks complained about the sound. We have a small bedroom and the sound was booming.Look, I'm sure there are better and newer and certainly bigger. We got the 42". But for the mid $400s, delivered next day by Amazon, I am one totally happy camper.If that isn't a lot of money to you, just spring for it. If you really labor over your bucks, feel comfortable with this purchase. Zero buyers remorse. Plenty of happiness and excitement.Five Stars. And then some.

Reviews.Title: Wake up Vizio
Reviews.Author: Mark M.
Reviews.Content: If it would have come with a qwerty remote it would have got five stars. Very nice  television (hint Vizio)

Reviews.Title: Good Price and Features, But Picture Quality is Lacking
Reviews.Author: Tim Brennan "TWeederTool"
Reviews.Content: I bought this because we have a 1-year old Vizio 42" Smart TV that we are quite happy with.The picture quality of this model (E390i-A1) leaves something to be desired. The initial picture was not as sharp as our other Vizio and it seemed kind of dim. I tried numerous picture setting changes without much luck. I went online and found a post from someone who had purchased the calibration discs for this model, he then reposted the various setting for brightness, contrast, color, etc. I tried entering those settings, which helped a little, but the picture still wasn't near as good as our 42" Vizio.Next I called Vizio Tech Support. They were helpful, and walked me through several setting adjustments. It's still a little better, but not as good as our other set. I would have thought that this smaller set (39" vs 42") would have a crisper picture since they were both 1080p and 120 Hz refresh rate, but it isn't. It's acceptable, just not great.The remote isn't great either. It would be nice if the keys had backlighting, especially since this TV is for our bedroom and the lights are typically off when we are watching. The buttons are also quite close together, which makes it hard to hit the right button, especially if its dark.I do like the wi-fi feature and internet apps. I like the dedicated buttons on the remote for Netflix and Amazon Video (because I subscribe to them both), but there is also a dedicated button for "M-Go". I wasn't familiar with M-Go, but did some checking. It's a pay-as-you-go video rental service. Their selection is not very good and their rental pricing was not very attractive. Unless something changes with M-Go, I don't think it will be around very long. Maybe that button can be reprogrammed in the future if M-Go goes belly up.The initial set-up for was pretty easy and I didn't need to try to run an ethernet cable to the device because of the built in wi-fi, which made set up simple.Maybe I just got a bit of a lemon. Like I said, it's ok, just not great.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money...love the connection to wireless
Reviews.Author: Michelle Ross
Reviews.Content: Great picture and sound for the money and love not having to use any other connections to get to Netflix

Reviews.Title: RECOMMENDED SETTINGS and other thoughts
Reviews.Author: Vltrn
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for a few weeks now, using it as a 2nd set in the bedroom.  So far I have been very satisfied, but it took me quite a while to get picture settings the way I wanted.  You can find my settings below.Pros:- great value for a smart TV- Very good picture, once you correct the terrible out-of-the-box settings (see below)- Easy to use interface for changing settings, browsing apps, etc.  I didn't have to hunt for anything.Cons:- Mine has 2 dead pixels (yes they are dead, not stuck).  I can only notice them close up though, and I know it's not enough to get a warranty replacement.- Audio is rather low quality compared to other TVs of this size.  I didn't really expect much in this department though.- Included stand angles the TV upward (it leans back).  I have mine wall mounted, but unless you are going to be sitting at or above eye level this may be an issue.RECOMMENDED SETTINGS:I came up with these settings through a combination of those posted by C|NET reviews of similar (but not the same) models, and also by using the AVS HD 709 calibration disc.  Currently there is no review of this actual model range that has calibration settings listed, but I was able to get things to look naturalFirmware Version 2.05.2---Picture settings menu---Picture Mode: MovieBacklight: 59Brightness: 49Contrast: 50Color: 50Tint: 0Sharpness: 6---Size & Position submenu---[no change]---Color Temperature submenu---Colour temperature: CustomRed Gain: 58Green Gain: 48Blue gain: 41Red offset: 50Green offset: 49Blue offset: 50--Advanced Picture submenu---Noise Reduction: OffMPEG NR: OffColor Enhancement: OffAdaptive Luma: OffFilm Mode: AutoBacklight Control: OffSo far I've been very happy using it to watch Blu-Rays, Netflix, and cable tv.  Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Best value-added purchase I've made for a TV in a long time :)
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Worked straight out of the box.  Connected wirelessly to my WEP-enabled router.  Didn't pick up the WPA2-enabled router - not a biggie.Room doesn't have cable outlet (not a problem since I don't subscribe to cable), so wifi internet is a must-have.  Previously I had a Roku connected to the smaller, older TV.  This VIZIO with built-in internet capability replaces two items now.The Amazon and Netflix setup was simple and we were watching movies in no time.Haven't tried the "free" digital on-air signals since I won't invest in one of those signal converters.Purchased this using my Amazon Prime account so I got a discount on shipping and having this delivered in 2 days was very nice.The paperwork states lifetime tech support so that's good to have.  The price is very good and I'd recommend this item.If I run into any issues I'll come back and update this review.

Reviews.Title: Not a stable stand
Reviews.Author: honesty counts
Reviews.Content: Sorry but I had to send this back.  The back piece would not attach correctly, and, it seemed to be very unstable when I put in deeper screws that held it in more securely.  For me, this was a deal breaker, because the warranty did not cover accidental coverage and it seemed highly plausible that this TV would eventually fall over at some point.

Reviews.Title: Great deal on a quality television
Reviews.Author: S. Ullrich
Reviews.Content: First one was dead on arrival with a broken screen but Amazon sent another one immediately and provided me with free return shipping.  The second unit arrived overnight.  It was very easy to set up and configure for network access, picture size/quality, apps, etc.  The picture is great.  The built in speakers, like nearly all flat screens, point down and don't fill a room with theater quality sound but they do provide a very clean/clear sound.  I don't bother to turn on the home theater system for news, etc... and have forgotten about turning it on for programs I'm watching until I'm halfway through them.  Quick access to Amazon Instant Video, Pandora, Facebook, etc. through the apps buttons.  Great deal on a quality television.

Reviews.Title: Plenty of features along with excellent picture quality make this a very good value.
Reviews.Author: G
Reviews.Content: A fantastic HDTV at a very good price. The set seems smaller that 39", but its just the way it appears. I love the very low profile, small frame around the outer edges. The picture is bright and incredibly detailed. It's nice to have Netflix and Amazon apps built into it. The outer box shows a Youtube app, unfortunately it doesn't have one built in. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: So far very happy
Reviews.Author: Justin D. Cofer
Reviews.Content: Very light, pretty easy set-up and very good picture. great for wall mount. Very happy for the price and I Will rereview it in a month.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful 1080p screen
Reviews.Author: William Robertson II "WRob"
Reviews.Content: I got this TV refurbished on the cheap a few months ago, and I love it. It's 1080p, so the clarity is fantastic, the refresh rate leaves nothing to be desired, and the internet connectivity and apps (although not TOO terribly useful) are fun and occasionally handy.Picture quality is great, dynamic contrast is solid, colors look good, and sound is...well, it's built-in, so it won't "wow" you, but it's fine. It has two NICs, so it can connect wirelessly or over Ethernet, which is nice. All the inputs are listed above, and they're easily accessible...for the most part. I found that connecting coaxial input was a bit difficult, but it's a one-time thing, anyway.I don't use the internet apps much, but I do sometimes use YouTube, which makes for a very nice viewing experience. I would complain about the inefficiency of using the remote to search for videos, but it's trivial enough to use another device (e.g. a smartphone) to control your TV (if you don't know how, the YouTube app on the TV gives instructions and even a useful QR code).Fantastic buy, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: A good, but not perfect TV
Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: The first TV I ordered had a problem. Every so often when I turned it on, the image would flicker, regardless of what input it was on. I returned it and very promptly received a new one. I am really impressed with it.Pros:Great picture. I'm no expert, but things looks great.Good sound. I'm used to HDTVs sounding awful, but this one had pretty good speakers.Internet features. I honestly don't use these, but I can see them being useful to someone.Value. This is a great TV for the price point.Cons:The only problem I have so far is that every so often, I'll try to turn it on, and it just won't. I end up having to unplug it and plug it back in. This is a pretty rare problem.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: A. Beverley
Reviews.Content: Love the tv! The slim border really makes the picture look great. The image quality is something you would expect in a higher priced item. The Netflix button is also awesome/ convienant. Great buy- already recommended this tv to my parents.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice.
Reviews.Author: D Hurley
Reviews.Content: My eyesight is failing and for the first time in a long while I can sit in my chair and see any writing they have on the screen. It arrived before the estimated date, was easy to unpack, everything was there, was easy to set up for cable and everything works fine.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E-Series E241i-A1 24-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED Smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: Real Dreams
Reviews.Content: Loving this tv.I relocated into a smaller place and have internet.The WIFI and this tv are about 10 feet away from each other.With the APPS on the tv in addition to the veryverynice picturequality, I am in techno video heaven !I mean I can bring up the YOUTUBE APP and launch the appand search for anything thats on you tube !You Tube alone and the tv picture quality would do  it 4 me,but you add in AMAZON PRIME VIDEOS, etc !!!!! incredible.Thank You to all involved, really, I am enjoying this tv.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E-Series E241i-A1 24-inch 1080p LED Smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: kenhigdon
Reviews.Content: Shipped quicker than stated and arrived in good shape.  Was easy to attach stand (I needed it to stand on a shelf instead of a wall mount) TV was easy to setup and I had it hooked to U-Verse via HDMI cable so it could be used within minutes.  The TV was easy to get on my home WIFI so the internet features would work.  It seems to be as sensitive in receiving WIFI as my I-Phone.  The sound is not as good as a large TV but is better than an older VIZIO model M221NV that I have on a kitchen wall. I have not tried the digital receiver as I did not have an antenna handy in the basement location I placed the TV.

Reviews.Title: Love TV But Hate the Remote
Reviews.Author: J Baker
Reviews.Content: The Vizio Smart HDTV is all I expected it to be, but the remote is way to stiff with way to small buttons. It would be nice if Vizio would make a new larger remote for this TV and send it out as a FREE replacement to all model owners. The TV itself has brilliant picture quality. I would recommend this TV to anyone looking for a great TV.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product for an awesome price!
Reviews.Author: K. Burton "KMC Burton"
Reviews.Content: We added this for use on our screened in porch. With the wifi connection, we are able to stream from the home network with no problem.  It's a perfect addition and easy to use!

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I needed!
Reviews.Author: D. Jaehrling
Reviews.Content: I looked long and hard for a smaller tv with the same wifi conductivity as the "big" set in the living room. There are a lot of bedroom-sized tvs out there, but the pickings are slim if you want a smart/wifi model. As a workaround, I was about to order a Roku to pair with a smaller tv, when I came across this newly listed set—seriously, when I ordered, it only had 2 reviews! I was a little nervous about ordering something without more feedback, but both reviews were positive and it met all of my criteria, so took the plunge. Boy, am I glad I did! I'm REALLY happy with this tv. The picture and sound are top-notch and setup was really easy. The wifi feature has worked perfectly for me—even with the signal coming from another area of the house. One weird thing is that it seems to take a little longer than expected to power up when you push the "on" button—like extra seconds, so not anything major. Overall, I'm really happy with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great deal for the $
Reviews.Author: H. Rappaport
Reviews.Content: I had been keeping my eye on this tv for some time. I watched the reviews pour in which were mostly good so I decided to take the plunge. Set up was quite easy even if you are a novice at this. Several things to note. It's a little chintzy of Vizio not to include a remote with a keyboard. As one other reviewer noted, you can buy one that works with this tv and I did. I took my not so old Vizio this replaced to my vacation home. Compared to that one, this tv take about 20 seconds to boot up from first being turned on. That is quite a long time. Lastly, I tried settings that one other reviewer mentioned and the color reproduction was awful. Everything was somewhat iridescent (like dayglo colors). After two weeks of messing around I finally found the key. The default backlight setting is at 80. Another setting allows you to turn off this fixed setting and lowering it finally made the color reproduction to lifelike as well as eliminating pixelization along high contrast edges. I have it for a month so reliability is still open but otherwise I am very happy with the high bang for this buck tv.

Reviews.Title: Lots of extras; good value.
Reviews.Author: One Opinion
Reviews.Content: Totally satisfied considering the size and cost.  I doubt with the size of the screen you would be able to see a difference between 720p and 1080p or whether it's lit with LEDs or florescent lights.  A plus is the internet applications (Netflix, Pandora, Amazon etc) that make this TV "Smart".  A minus is the tinny audio, but this is a bedroom TV that I use to watch the news and talk shows until I fall asleep.  Also, I found the remote took some time to get used to because the layout and buttons are not as logical as others I have used.  Cnet has posted the optimal video settings for this model if you want to adjust the picture yourself.

Reviews.Title: Constantly have to restart
Reviews.Author: Aphrodite Starr
Reviews.Content: This is an ok TV.  The picture comes in nicely, the sound is good.  The size is perfect for the bedroom.  The remote does not bother me because for the most part I use the cable remote.  But the remote does feel flimsy and that it could break easily.  I am thinking of ordering another while this model is still being produced because I have a feeling down the line I may need. it.  The main problem with this TV is that it takes a LONG time to turn on.  I have Sony Bravia Smart TV that does not take nearly as long.  And a lot of times both the TV and cable are on and nothing happens or it freezes and I have to restart.  Glad I did not spend a lot of money on this one6 month update:  Still have to restart quite a bit as I will turn it on and nothing happens.  Additionally it takes a long time to boot up when it does turn on. So it you are running upstairs to catch the last 5 minutes of something on this TV - Don't.  You will miss it if you do as it takes a while to start. Other than that I still like the picture and the sound.

Reviews.Title: GREAT!!
Reviews.Author: vivekbl
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time looking for a small HDTV (1080 p) and found it in this set with a great price, and some wi-fi capabilities.  Perfect!

Reviews.Title: So far I love it.
Reviews.Author: Augustisburning
Reviews.Content: I had a Vizio 32' LCD tv and I've been wanting to get something a little bigger since I have Astigmatism and sometimes the tv looked a little blurry to me. A friend who knows a lot about tv's recommended maybe buying an LED tv since the backlighting is different and it can sometimes be easier for people such as myself to make out certain details. So I gave it a try and ordered this one because it was a decent price. So far, I love it. I played BioShock Infinite on it and right away, I could tell the difference in the details between this tv and my LCD. I also like the wifi streaming for Netflix because now I can watch Netflix in peace without having to be bombarded by game invites from friends on PS3.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price but...
Reviews.Author: James R. Robison "Ray Robison"
Reviews.Content: Love the TV but the navigation and interface on the web software is terrible. My Roku has much better software. For instance, Amazon video has no way to save the shows I watch. I have to use the search function every time I want to go to a series I watch. Also, would it kill Vizio to allow us to label channels? My cable does not come with a cable box, and the channels are not labelled. It should take very little effort to put in a function so I can name channels. Throw us a software update Vizio. When you use the smart TV it creates a new temporary input. So if I am watching Hulu, for instance, and I switch to my xbox, that temporary internet input goes away. So you have to go through the entire system to restart an internet video. Also, the HDMI inputs on the back are recessed with a ledge opposite the opening that makes them very difficult to plug in to. And the remote has to be pointed lake a laser at the receiver on the bottom left corner of the TV. Seriously, if you just point it at the center of the TV it won't work. A minor annoyance but I don't understand how this got past testing. Overall, for the money, it's a great buy and most problems can be fixed with a software update if customers complain enough.

Reviews.Title: A best buy in the 32 inch flat panel class
Reviews.Author: C. L. Boyd
Reviews.Content: This TV has superb picture quality, despite only being a 720p model (and on a 31.5 inch screen, 1080p would probably be overkill), and is hands-down the most compact 32 inch flat panel TV I have been able to find, being just under 29 inches wide and just over 19 inches high with the stand attached. It fits with room to spare in my 30 inch wide wall units in my small (12 by 20) living room. It is so much smaller than the former Sansui 32 inch CRT it replaced that I bought a one drawer glossy black modular storage drawer unit and put it under the TV to store DVDs, remotes, manuals, etc. The narrow edge design is probably the reason why it is not as wide as other competitor's sets or even other Vizio models with a 31.5 inch screen size. Setup took all of 25 minutes, including doing two scans for digital off-air channels (I assume scanning for cable channels without a box would be similar). I was able to connect my digital HD cable TV converter box (required by my Bright House service for its HD channels and premium channels) using one of the TV's two HDMI ports, then connected my DVD player via the composite RCA female jacks and my amplified off-air antenna to the female coaxial cable/TV port (hence a 32 channel "backup" in case the cable goes out). There is also a USB port that allows inserting a flash drive so that you can view photos on the TV. I will be buying a second HDMI cable so that I can connect my HP Pavilion multimedia notebook with a HDMI port to view movies, etc. In addition, this is a Smart HDTV and has several Internet apps already configured, and more can be downloaded. The TV established a connection with my encrypted wireless g/n home network with a "hidden" ID without a hitch -- just type in the network name and the WEP key, wait a few seconds, and you are connected for Hulu, Netflix, etc. (no Roku box required). If you want one of these, I suggest you act fast ... I think this model will soon be retired or replaced, and for well less than $300.00, this is clearly an outstanding set for the price.

Reviews.Title: great screen
Reviews.Author: Nilufar Baratova "Nina"
Reviews.Content: I simply love that TV. The delivery was fast, no damage. Great picture quality and sound. You will not regret the money you spent.

Reviews.Title: Very Sharp
Reviews.Author: jlcapt
Reviews.Content: Nice picture, Good apps. If it had a web browser I would give it 5 stars.Super light weight. Easy to move around like outside if I want to.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Dennis L. Lundy "Running Man"
Reviews.Content: TV arrived super fast (3-days).  Easily setup and connect to WiFi.  Picture quality is at good as my Sony, LG and Samsung flat screens. Extremely small border.  Sound is acceptable.  I am satisfied with the purchase

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted.
Reviews.Author: T. Christensen
Reviews.Content: First, thanks to all the great reviews here, they helped me make what I feel is the best purchase for my needs. I'm adding to the reviews because I wanted to praise the ease of set up. 30 minutes from box to watching Big Bang Theory. Had the wifi set up, the tv set up, speakers and getting the hang of the remote and settings.It will take some time to figure out all the smart features, but I don't think it will take much. Already Netflix and Amazon set up. I'm hoping I'll be able to add Pandora easily.

Reviews.Title: Great Tv At first
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Iannelli
Reviews.Content: Ok I am a huge fan of buying electronics on Amazon. For the price and a 50 inch tv it is great. The features you get for the value like built in wifi is also great. Picture quality is good. Sound quality sucks. Well then again no flat screen has ggod sound lol so no complaint there. The only real downside to this tv for the first 7 months is the warm-up time. You can take a nap waiting for the tv to turn on. Again this was all acceptable for the price.Now for the disaster. Ive owned this tv for 9 months now. One month ago the Tv began Flickering and having lines going through it bad. Like 50% of the screen. Not all the time. It has its moods. Some days normal. Other days when im already in a bad mood it is as well. You all can relate to that. Anyways I monitored it for a week and then called Vizio as Im under there standard warranty for purchaseing a tv. Well first they make me check this and that power cord etc and nothing worked. Then they went on to the cable box being the issue. So I say my dvd player does it as well. Either way that phone call went no where. Followed there steps being re-assured everything would be ok if we just did things step by step. So I did the cable box and even went as far as to have my cable tech speak with them over the phone while he was here.After finally admitting that it could be one of many different problems like main board, this circuit or that....blah blah it was basically a defect in there tv. So they tell me they will fix it for free. Well heres the real kicker. I have to MAIL the tv back to them. Now two problems. One I live in a small house so i was unable to save the tv box it was shipped in. And two I have to pay to SHIP the tv to them. That is not the kind of service I expect from a company that I just spent 750.00 on one of there products. And if most of you are like me a hard working blue collar person, well you know we can afford a tv of this purchase once every 7 or 8 years. So for now I'm stuck with a tv that flickers whenever it feels like.So please be weary of this Tv or any of vizios tv with that kind of customer support. You may be buying a feature rich tv but at what cost? Hope this helps the next person

Reviews.Title: This TV is AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: Nikki
Reviews.Content: Movies, Games, and TV all look GREAT on this fine piece of technology! I'd buy another one in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: Exceptional picture - strong wifi signal - I love this TV
Reviews.Author: A Guy "Otis"
Reviews.Content: At first I was a little puzzled with some of the reviews being all over the map, but everyone's entitled to their opinion, so I'll give mine.We've only owned this tv about 2 1/2 weeks now, and I bought a refurbished unit from Amazon's 'little sister' company, so I could try out our first internet ready set without paying full price.I have to say I am very impressed with the picture clarity and all the other features of this 32" tv so far. Even with our less than spectacular internet connection, and this set being in our bedroom, over 30 feet from the wireless router, and through 3 walls, reception has been spectacular. The picture is twice as good as our 6 yr old Toshiba Regza 42" set. We use it to stream Netflix content quite a lot, and not only do most shows/movies come through crystal clear, with true color and deep blacks, but Netflix streams about 2x faster than on the larger tv outfitted with a little Magnavox media box, less than  12 feet from the wireless router. The sound quality is acceptable to our ears and another really nice thing is the usb port not only allows movie and personal photo viewing as well as music listening from a flash drive, I discovered that a WD 2 TB external hard drive is recognized and we have the option to play several hundred files from that. Of course it doesn't play all file types, but quite a few. I find the speakers good enough for me to listen to Pandora internet radio in the mornings and to enjoy it. Haven't hooked any periperals up via HDMI as yet, but a DVD player attached to the composite jacks looks excellent, so I imagine the HDMI hook ups should only be better.  If I had one small criticism of this tv it would be the remote is a bit clunky and when pressing the buttons its not as smooth as many others. Button pushes make an audible click, but it does work. This unit only came with a 90 day 3rd party warranty, being a refurb, so I will update this review if there are any changes in performance or our feelings toward it, but so far this is the best set I've ever owned, by a wide margin, and I'll be taking a hard look at the 47" Vizio when it comes time to replace our Toshiba.

Reviews.Title: Worst TV ever for streaming
Reviews.Author: Lucia Fedina
Reviews.Content: The TV has many problems.  First, the connection to Netlix and other streaming sites is extremely poor and works 1 out of 100 times.  The help phone number said there were issues with connection, with Netflix, etc; but our other TV that used Roku did not have any issues at all.  Considering streaming was the primary purpose to purchase this TV, give it 1 star rating

Reviews.Title: Best Amazon Purchase of the Year
Reviews.Author: Brandon F.
Reviews.Content: I am incredibly pleased with this television and use it as a monitor for a docked Macbook Pro, an Xbox 360, and occasionally a Raspberry Pi. The smart applications work brilliantly and the wifi connected without any pains - surprising since I am a story up from my router and through several walls. I am very happy with this purchase and expect you will be too. One small note - the headphone output produces rather awful sound quality on my unit. This wouldn't be an issue for many users, but I was surprised by it. Found an easy workaround though, so no complaints! Buy this Television! You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: Recommend
Reviews.Author: Jerry Z.
Reviews.Content: I personally do not agree with any bad reviews on this tv so far, even when when the first TV that was sent and got damaged in transit before it even got delivered to me. They sent another one in place of it and I am totally impressed, because it is way better then I expected. My note to everyone that reads reviews in general, read the bad and good with an open mind before you make your decision. I didn't believe all the bad on this one and I was right so far.

Reviews.Title: Slow Start  Now happy
Reviews.Author: Charles Grandpa
Reviews.Content: Opened the  box and found that the TV was not damaged and that I needed a HDMI cord (not included).Ok off to the store to buy one. Plugged in the TV to my DIRECT TV cable box, read the manual and choseall the proper options. Tried to get the apps to work ; no luck. Called VIZIO service. Very nice young ladysaid I needed a software update downloaded to make the apps work. Ten minutes later all the apps worked ok.Sound quality was not a problem. No need for a sound bar. Volume filled my  20 x 35 great room. I read 120refresh was a problem  but action sports and movies were good quality. Most of the problems I see are becausenot all programs are broadcast in 1080p. I would recommend this TV to anyone. Price is right

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: JeffreyL
Reviews.Content: Very happy with thisFor the price it's greatWhat you want to know:Cons:There's nothing in the manual that tells you how to activate the keyboard so you will probably get stuck during setup.Just go to then area you need text in and press the ok button then your onscreen keyboard will appear. A bit confusing and I'm a tech.Audio: very good for the small speakers it hasVideo: looks great, but blacks are eg. Contrast ratio are not real black. But, the screen when off shows how black the black will get so don't expect them to get darker when on. But I'm picky, you probably won't notice it much. I'm also a photographer and notice everything when it comes to on screen flaws be it photo or video.Digital smoothing it not great but I think that's still a limitation of technology. You basically have a choice between some pickax tigon or a plastic type look. Hard to get it just right. I expect to see it go away when technology doubles the HD resolution.1080 Hd shows will look good but if not HD don't expect the best picture.  This is just a technology limitation as well.Takes about 60 seconds for the TV to actually turn onThe Vizio apps are fun but the interface and and technology behind them are make me feel like I'm using the button controls of the old cell phones from 10 years ago. They should take a look at the Apple TV interface to improve it. It's just clumsyYES. I would buy this again. For the price I believe it's the best available with built in wifiVery good quality but not great

Reviews.Title: WAY BEYOND MY EXPECTATIONS!
Reviews.Author: Jonnatan
Reviews.Content: I cannot stop congratulating myself for buying this Vizio TV.  When I made that decision, I did not know that it has internal WIFI capability, it was easy to set up and even easier to navigate the menu.  The applications are awesome!, and the image quality is incredible, clear, brilliant colors.  I own a Sony 46" LCD and a Samsung Smart TV 42", and VIZIO is literally rocking their boat.  I recommended, as a matter of fact I want to buy another one.

Reviews.Title: I like it! I like it!
Reviews.Author: kingbarnaby
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for a few weeks now. No complaints so far. Just about anything would have been an improvement from my 15 year old, 19" tube. I think I made the right choice though. Has all the features I wanted. For the price, you can't beat it. It's energy efficient and should save me some $. Amazon instant videos, however, will probably put me in more debt.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E320i-A0 Lacks Full Amazon Video functionality
Reviews.Author: B.G. Williams
Reviews.Content: Despite having a dedicated Amazon button on the Vizio remote control, this product lacks functionality to watch Amazon Prime content using Vizio's internet app (VIA). When the Amazon button is pressed, nothing happens. By contrast, when the Netflix button is pressed, full Netflix functionality is present.Secondly, when Amazon is accessed thru the Vizio VIA app, there is no access to Amazon Prime features such as Watchlist, Recently Watched, etc. available thru your Amazon Prime account.  This is the case even though one has to authorize VIA with Amazon the same way other streaming devices such as Roku get authorized. However, the only thing one can easily do is watch content recommended by Amazon. For anything else, you have to search for the content, which is very cumbersome. Even after you find shows you can't save them in any way. This is ok I guess for movies but clearly not for TV series.A quick internet search will show that this is a long-standing issue that Vizio and Amazon have failed to address despite being contacted directly by many users and the issue being posted on Amazon user forums and reviews. This was my first and last Vizio purchase and I cannot recommend that anyone should buy any Vizio internet enabled TV product. Also, this experience has made me question whether I will continue with Amazon Prime.  I have previously used streaming devices such as Roku and now have to connect it to this so-called internet enabled TV in order to have reasonable Amazon Prime functionality. For any future TV purchases, I think I will avoid internet enabled models and rely on my trusty Roku and other streaming devices.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Amature Plumber
Reviews.Content: Just a great tv so far.  It was worth the wait.  Have not had it for very long yet so need more time to evaluate it.  But would recommend it as it is a great value compared to other brands.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO......Yes!!!
Reviews.Author: Vermont Grandma
Reviews.Content: Decided to (finally) upgrade to larger flat panel tv.  Chose Vizio on our techno-son's recommendation:  "Best product for the money."  Even our son is amazed with this model!  I purchased as b'day gift for my husband and he's glad he got his gift early!  Decided on the 47" and the picture is wonderful!  The "E" series has a narrow "picture frame" and it makes the picture seem to float in space.  The LED illumination of the picture is not only a savings on power usage, but the picture is bright, bright, bright.  Some reviews I read critiqued the TV's light changing feature (in relation to room environment), but we can't notice anything at all.We highly recommend this Vizio model:  me, my very-grateful husband, and our son who set the whole thing up.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for very little money!
Reviews.Author: Brandon Lord
Reviews.Content: I was deciding between this Vizio at 50" and a 46" Samsung for around the same price, but did not have the SmartTV features. After seeing a friends Vizio E601, I decided to go with Vizio. I am very pleased with my decision. The picture is amazing, and for $649, a 50" TV with built in WiFi and apps is a great deal. This TV is located in my bedroom, which is at the opposite end of the house from my wireless router. Please note, I am still using a WRT54g. Despite the distance, the TV still has decent signal strength and can stream in HD without a hiccup. The TV start up takes a little longer than expected, and the apps are not incredibly fast either, but these are such minor complaints that are made up for in the fantastic picture quality at a bargain price.For those of you that have seen the E601 in person, this TV's picture looks entirely different.  Despite it being 120hz, the E500 does not have the same "soap opera effect" (SOE) as the E601. This was a major plus for me, as I dislike the unnatural motion/jumpiness displayed by the E601.Overall I am very pleased with my purchase and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a big TV with a great picture at the bargain price!

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E320i-A0 32-inch 720p 60Hz LED Smart HDTV is a great TV for the price, but be aware its only 720p.
Reviews.Author: Christopher J. Cowen
Reviews.Content: VIZIO makes a nice TV and the fact that this TV is only $288.00 with free shipping is pretty awesome.  So first off I would definitely recommend this TV one for the price, second for the technology within the TV, and third for the fact I don't have to fight people in the stores for it.  But I will tell there a few things to be aware of.  This is only a "720p" and not the standard "1080p" definition most TV's are today.  The second thing I noticed while reviewing this TV it that it only has to 2 HDMI outputs.  This could be an issue for you if you will have alot of things plugging into it.  But with all that said I have had some great looking 720p TV's and this TV is under $300 dollars.  So I still would recommend it.2 years ago you could not even dream about getting a 32 inch LED Smart TV for under $300 dollars, times have definitely changed.  This review will act as a guide as well as a review for this VIZIO.One thing that I have found with TV's that its very important to actually look at the TV in person. Now when you look at the TV's, go to a place like Walmart to see them, because many times specialty stores like Best Buy play with the lighting controls on the TV and in the store to skew the image to there advantage. Once you look at the TV simply look and decide which one looks better to youNow first thing when a TV says its LED that is very similar to LCD.  The main difference with this type of TV is the way the lighting within the TV is done.  LED is back-lit better so that their are no dark spots on the screen.  The term SMART TV means this TV has the ability to directly connect to the internet.  But what makes a TV a smart TV is its ability to connect all of your devices together.  The Smart TV is the train conductor that can push content from your DVD's, game systems, and other devices to the TV.The next step is to look at the features that are offered with the TV. Here are some offered by this VIZIO Smart TV:SMART TV Internet Apps this TV has built-in Wi-Fi which allows you to watch internet content like Netflix, rent movies through the TV.  Pretty much whatever you can do on your computer you can do on this TV.- With LED backlighting the pops with rich color and vivid details.- This LED HDTV is up to 50% more energy efficient than conventional LCD HDTVs to save money.- The slim frame design for this VIZIO lets you maximize your space, allowing you to fit a bigger screen size TV in the same space.- Here is the input/Output layout: 2 HDMI, 1 Component, 1 Composite (shared with component), RF Connector for Internal Tuner, 1 Ethernet, and 1 USB 2.0.Thank you for reading my review, if you have any questions feel free to email me, I would be happy to help you with any questions you have.

Reviews.Title: NOT DEAF FRIENDLY
Reviews.Author: Bond, James Bond
Reviews.Content: This is our first HD TV and we are freaking loving it! The main points are that we use Netflix as a TV provider instead of cable or satellite, so having a Netflix app and a Netflix button is too cool. I am not a tech guru so i can't say too much about the technical stuff but I do know that LED is the way to go, 120Hz is the latest and greatest and wifi connectivity means I can cut out one device. The thin frame should be standard on every tv, it makes this 47" seem larger.stuff I'm unhappy with- no browser and no Pandora. It does however have rhapsody but I don;t have a rhapsody account because Pandora is free. And one more row of RC inputs would have been nice but I understand they're not as en vogue as they used to be.*update, one month in- ah shucks the list of stuff I'm unhappy with has grown  Amazon app does support captioning ( big mad judgmental look going to amazon for that one)  The remote has to be pointed DIRECTLY at the lower left hand corner of the tv. Changing batteries on the remote to a higher quality battery has helped, however its not the free ranging point wherever stuff of old.  And last of  all, when you start viewing a show and when you skip the image takes a few seconds to come to. It gives a strange pixilation that one might mistake for a few beers too many vision. Not the worst stuff in the world, just minor annoyances. But it still shows  great picture right out of the box! Nothing major to gripe about which means that this TV is holding its own!*** Update 10 months in Pretty ticked about the continued lack of captioning support particularly from one of the quick app buttons. Thats costing you stars since Amazon says that its Vizio's fault and vizio won't respond.

Reviews.Title: Very nice tv, but is it really 120Hz?
Reviews.Author: jimstix99
Reviews.Content: This tv has great picture, especially for slow-moving camera movements.  But when the camera is panning left-to-right or right-to-left, there is some ticking and image ghosting.  I have a hard time believing that this TV actually has a refresh rate of 120Hz as advertised.  My sister has a different VIZIO, the M470SL, which is also 120Hz, and her picture is much clearer.  I'm honestly considering sending this one back.

Reviews.Title: BROKE
Reviews.Author: John E. Bonesteel "old conservative"
Reviews.Content: Received TV on 10/21/2013 about noon, set up, connected, operating fine at 5:30 PM.Early morning of 10/21/2013 TV would not turn on. Called Directv to make sure everything was alright on their end. No problem there. Called VIZIO got a young woman on the phone told her what the problem was. She put me through a work out of shutting it down, holding the off button etc. to no avail. She asked me for serial number. Gave her the number on the set and the box it came (both the same). She said no such number. I would have to take a picture and send it to her. Enough of her. ( Ah to be young again and not care about anyone but me) Went up the ladder to supervisor Steve, went through the process again with him, gave him the serial number, he told me he would order the parts, when they came in a repair person would call me and set up an appointment, also said it would take 5-6 business days. Does this sound like a common problem  now? Talk with a guy for about 4 minutes who is about 2,000 miles from me and he is going to order parts? Repair contractor called me on 11/01/2013 said they would be the ones to repair the TV when the parts came in and who the repair person  would be and they would call before coming.  Now it is 11/12/2013n nothing yet, still have a useless TV. Have had it for 23 days, it worked six. A bit past the 5-6 working days. Called repair contractor, lo and be hold they are sending repair person  tomorrow for repairs. Should have sent it back and replaced, would have been quicker. I think this will be 13 business days. Must be using the presidents math. Amazon has always been great to deal with so doubt if there would have been a problem  Advice for all.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a Great Price!
Reviews.Author: SCMama
Reviews.Content: We love Vizio TVs; we bought a 55" a couple of years ago when we moved into a bigger place. During our PCS, our bedroom TV was damaged, so we needed to replace it. Found this one and it fits perfectly above our fireplace. Picture is great, sound quality is good for the size of the TV and being able to connect to Netflix without having to use the PS3 or Wii has been much easier! We couldn't be happier with this TV!

Reviews.Title: love this tv
Reviews.Author: Beth Abbott
Reviews.Content: the only drawback is that it is tilted too far back, will definitely get a bracket to put on the wall.  Other than that it is easy to set up and love the picture and the remote is easy to work also.  I would highly recommend this TV

Reviews.Title: Nice picture but freezes up in WiFi! Problem may be across other models as well!
Reviews.Author: E L
Reviews.Content: When I initially bought my TV, the picture was great. However, I began to have problems with the TV where it would freeze up. After sending the TV back in and having the wireless card replaced, I found that the TV still has the same issue, freezing up to the point where you would have to turn the TV off and back on again. After multiple hours of time spent with customer support, I was told that there was an incompatibility issue with my wireless network such that it caused the TV to lock up. I was told that I would have to either disable my WiFi network (then what would deb the point of an internet TV) or disable the Network or File sharing function of my WiFi network. I was also told that it may have something to do with how the TV is not DLNA compatible. I have a standard out-of-the-box network from an Apple Airport Extreme, nothing fancy. I wouldn't know how to set up anything fancy with my network anyway. I spoke with Vizio by phone and email more times than I care to count. I was hoping to exchange my TV for a model that would not have the WiFi issues, but apparently I am told that all their TVs have the same WiFi card AND MAY BE SUBJECT TO HAVING THE SAME LOCKUP ISSUE! I was told that I am not alone in having this issue. So while having to deal with repeating the same story over three months to various support reps, getting the voicemail of a manager who takes over a week to return a voicemail, overall I have to rate the whole experience of owning a Vizio as abysmal. I'm still trying to troubleshoot the issue with a different manager, who has shot down my proposal to exchange my model for a newer one in the hopes that it resolves my WiFi issue. I guess, we'll just have to see...

Reviews.Title: Cheap and easy
Reviews.Author: Julie j Mayhew
Reviews.Content: Not the best TV ever, but it's been nice so far. The stand is really crappy, so you should intend to mount it. Seriously, the stand is THAT bad. The sound is nice and so is the picture. The only other real problem is that it takes forever for this to boot up and turn on.

Reviews.Title: Awful response time, the first Vizio I've bought that I don't love
Reviews.Author: Computer Repair Depot
Reviews.Content: I own 4 other "regular" Vizio TV's ranging from 32inch up to 47inch and I love all of them, have never had a single issue with them.However, this "smart" TV is absolutely horrible. For one thing it takes forever just to turn on, we're talking 20-30 seconds before it's ready to even display the TV or HDMI connection.The remote just feels laggy and there is a several second delay after pressing buttons.The "smart" aspect of these TV is atrocious, it has a terrible interface that is clunky and incredibly slow. I own Roku's and HTPC's and they run circles around this TV. In retrospect I should have just bought a regular Vizio TV and a Roku, but I thought this would be better...The internet connection is intermittent at best. There are times when I turn it on and none of the Apps can connect... Getting Netflix to work is a chore sometimes. This is never the case with my Rokus, you turn the TV on and boom it's already up and running.Stay away from this TV if you are looking for a good "regular" TV and if you're looking for a "smart" tv you should REALLY avoid this.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV, great price
Reviews.Author: Denise Marie
Reviews.Content: This was my second Vizio smart TV. I bought this to replace a bedroom TV (not a Vizio; a Magnavox). The picture is great and it does a good job in automatically adjusting the aspect ratio for different channels. The sound is quite satisfactory for a small TV. The front-firing speakers clinched my decision (as they did on my slightly older Vizio). Most TVs today have rear-firing speakers (I suppose so the electronics companies can subsequently sell auxiliary speakers for $120 or more). Having speakers fire against the living room wall is just silly. The only thing I don't like is the stand, which is a simple lean-to. "Swivel" is unnecessary for such a lightweight TV, but "tilt" to change the viewing angle would have been good. Unfortunately, the old TV's stand would not work as it had a different VESA hole placement. I would recommend this TV to anyone looking for a smaller TV - great price. Setting up the WiFi is a snap. Interesting to note that the Netflix interface on this TV is slightly different and a tad friendlier that the Netflix app on the slightly older Vizio. I use Netflix, Hulu, and Amazon.Edit on 3/6/14: I saw my review showed up for this TV in a listing by vendor One Stop Shop. I bought the TV from "Amazon.com LLC" with free prime shipping (and for 37 bucks less). I didn't buy from this vendor.

Reviews.Title: You better have a good and fast wireless signal
Reviews.Author: S. Macy "I'm the Decorator"
Reviews.Content: It wouldn't work in the room for which be bought it, because it couldn't pick up the wireless (the wireless was too weak and/or too slow, according to the customer service setup number that I called).  Very frustrating, particularly because other wireless devices work fine in that room.

Reviews.Title: TV crashes if it connects to the internet in certain circumstances
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "SK"
Reviews.Content: TV can freeze up when connecting to the internet in certain circumstances. I've bought 2 of this model.  What type of Smart TV can't connect to the internet.  I spoke with Vizio support, and this is a common issue, though unfortunately they weren't able to figure out why the TVs were freezing in my circumstance, even after being on the phone with them for hours.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Kumar "Kumar"
Reviews.Content: Few weeks back I bought a Samsung TV,which I had to return as it's turning itself off whenever I increase or decrease the volume.Later, I bought VIZIO E500i-A1 50inch TV, and totally surprised how excellent the picture quality is for almost $300 cheaper than Samsung model that I've returned.None of the default settings of this TV are good. Used Disney WOW to calibrate and a lot of trial and errors and finally came up with the following settings and hope it'll help people who want to do the settings.Picture Mode :CalibratedBacklight : 45Brightnesss : 52Contrast : 45Color : 40Tint : -2Sharpness : 0Color Temperature : CustomRed Gain : 100Green Gain : 105Blue Gain : 110Red Offset :128Green Offset : 128Blue Offset :128Advanced Picture:Auto brightness control : OffBlack detail : MediumSmart dimming : OnReduce signal noise : OffReduce block noise : LowFilm mode : Auto.

Reviews.Title: This is a great TV and worth the money.
Reviews.Author: Donald Shipman
Reviews.Content: If you decide to purchase the additional warranty and you have a Costco card, buy the warranty from Costco and save a good amount.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: amy meixner
Reviews.Content: This TV is nice and big and it has amazing quality and I love the smart feature about it! Its awesome!

Reviews.Title: VIZIO 32" TV
Reviews.Author: Robert T. Hawkins
Reviews.Content: I really like this TV.  Very light and easy to set up.  Smart features (e.g. Netflix and Amazon) built in, are really handy and seem to work well, using the remote.  Excellent value for the price.  Picture qualify is outstanding.  Sound is "weak".  Added a refurbished VIZIO sound bar for about $40, which vastly improves the sound.  Overall, still an excellent buy.

Reviews.Title: Poor WiFi Reception Made for Frustrating Experience
Reviews.Author: An Average Joe
Reviews.Content: I put this 24" smart TV exactly where a Roku 2 worked perfectly before.  This TV would not work acceptably until I bought a WiFi extender.  I ended up just running ethernet between the WiFi extender and the TV to eliminate using the WiFi in the TV at all.  Software is not as fast or as polished as the Roku and it doesn't recover from errors and interruptions as gracefully.  As a longtime Roku and PS3 streamer this is a sub-par experience.  I bought it to save wires and clutter but the need to add a WiFi extender negated that.  Would not buy again.

Reviews.Title: Information pane needs improvement
Reviews.Author: RV guy
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture and features it just has the same problem that all Vizio tv's have. The information window is too small and does not contain information for the next program. If you using a cable box than this doesn't matter if your viewing off air signals it makes a big difference. It doesn't matter if you have 19 inch or a 60 it's the same small window. Samsung has a much better info window containing the next program information and you can read it across the room.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be happier
Reviews.Author: Brianna Scheper
Reviews.Content: It was in great condition and I love how easy it is to use the apps. Definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Watch out when buying from Amazon!!!
Reviews.Author: Reynold D.
Reviews.Content: stopped working in about 2 months and Visio said they would not honor the warranty because Amazon provided a third party seller who was not authorized by Visio.  I had an extended warranty(Square Trade) or I would have been out $200.00

Reviews.Title: Value depends on what you are buying it for.
Reviews.Author: KrazyKorean
Reviews.Content: I was purchasing this TV for the kitchen. We are trying to break free of cable and we only have Netflix and Amazon Prime for TV show watching, which is why I purchased this "smart TV."Cons:Unfortunately, this Amazon prime app leaves much to be desired. The Amazon prime button on the remote does not work properly. Also, the Amazon prime app does not synch with your "list" on Amazon prime shows. You have to manually search for every show instead of it showing up in a que like it does for "my list" on Netflix.Also, the remote function in generally is a bit spotty. Not a huge drawback, but definitely annoying.Pros:Netflix app works great.Also, the TV itself is aesthetically appealing and pretty thin. Perfect for what we were looking for in the kitchen.The picture is good for the specs on the TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Duston
Reviews.Content: So far we love this tv.  After researching the different tv's out there I really wanted to stay with the plasma tv's but  I bought this one because it's a smart tv.  So far i'm loving it.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy the Vizio E320i-A0 if you want a good "Smart TV" Experience
Reviews.Author: Humble Patriot
Reviews.Content: As Amazon consolidates reviews for various models in the same product line, please note that this is a review of the Vizio E320i-A0.If you purchase this TV it will bring you frustration.  The user interface (UI) installed on the Vizio E320i-A0 is Vizio's crippled Yahoo! TV Apps/M-GO interface, NOT the company's "Vizio Internet Apps Plus" interface.  It is clunky, frustrating, limited, and NOT user friendly.  While the TV is just fine as standard TV or monitor, and has a decent picture, adequate sound, and plenty of inputs, the UI is terrible and the remote is almost worthless.
