It is not a good value as it comes at a premium over a similarly appointed HD set, and you can save nearly a C-note and a whole bunch of frustration if you simply buy a "dumb" 32-inch HD set and a Roku LT from Amazon.I purchased this TV in January 2013 on Vizio's promise that it would provide an outstanding Smart TV experience.  It was anything BUT outstanding.  Its primary app, "M-GO" (prominently displayed on both the unit's UI home screen and its lousy remote control), was billed as a "revolutionary" TV experience when I purchased the TV.  Bizarrely, M-GO wasn't installed on the TV at the time of purchase and didn't even become available for it until Summer 2013.  When it finally did arrive via Vizio's eventual firmware update, M-GO turned out to be all "pay" TV - no included content.  It was thoroughly disappointing and not "revolutionary" as promised.  I already have Netflix and Amazon Prime, so I don't need their lousy pay app.  Aside from M-GO, there are other apps available for the E320i-A0 -- some are preinstalled like Yahoo! Finance and Skype, but most are downloaded through the Yahoo! TV Apps store in the unit's poorly structured UI.  Strangely, Yahoo! TV Apps offers only a very limited number of apps for this "smart" TV -- a grand total of 134 (that's right:  ONLY ONE HUNDRED AND THIRTY FOUR!) as of this writing on December 26, 2013 -- and most of them are either local news station apps from distant corners of the U.S., or paid anime/cartoon channels. Even the familiar apps like iHeart Radio have limited feature sets and don't offer the programmable, personalized channels you would customarily be able to set up on your computer or smart phone, but rather offer only a specified set of broadcast stations from select markets.  The entire experience is really bizarre.Ultimately, the greatest disappointment of the E320i-A0 is its abysmal UI and limited apps, which Vizio flatly informed me it has no intention to update to its current "VIA Plus" interface.  Again, the TV is good in terms of picture, size, sound and inputs, but the "smart" content is worthless.  If you buy this TV you will be stuck with the lousy UI, crappy remote, and crippled apps.  Be forewarned, and get a "dumb" TV and a Roku (or Chromecast, or XBox 360, etc); you'll be much happier you did.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E-500i-A1  50 inch Smart HDTV  It is a winner!
Reviews.Author: Mary Wright
Reviews.Content: Ordered it off of Amazon and it arrived within 2 days.  It does take several people to put on the stand. We had to use a magnetic screw driver to put in the screws but it is a very sturdy stand when finished.  The picture on the set is wonderful.  I like how the picture has a small frame which means more picture in less space.  The apps are very nice to have right on your remote.  I really like the remote which is easy to handle for input into the tv.  My husband bought the tv as a Christmas present to each other.  We are really enjoying it.  Sound is good with the built in subwoofer.  Don't think you need a sound bar.  We really like it and plan on enjoying it for years to come.  Price was really good and I received $10 off of that as a prime member.  Also the 24 month financing same as cash was a good plus.  All in all I give the purchase 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: good picture from directly in front
Reviews.Author: James R Rowe
Reviews.Content: very faded picture if off center viewing. unclear directions for making picture fill the screen. difficult directions to setup and use smart wifi feature as no0 printed directions are provided, just references to computer or working within the tv....navigation difficult.

Reviews.Title: Vizio is the absolute best!
Reviews.Author: Darob
Reviews.Content: This is my second Vizio Smart TV and am completely pleased with the quality and performance of the E420i-A0 42". What I like most about this particular model is that it is very lightweight, easy to mount on the wall, and the screen fills virtually the entire frame. It is operated solely by the remote, as there are no on-board accessible tuner controls. The setup is easy and dummy-proof... and you can't beat the picture and audio performance. To see how Vizio's quality stacks up with other brands, just stroll into a typical dept store and compare with the others... and you'll be able to see the difference. Without doubt, Vizio is your best choice for a reliable, quality TV. For my application, I installed the E420i-A0 on the wall with an Ominmount Play25x, a full-motion interactive VESA compatible mount, which works beautifully for effortless adjustments of viewing heights or angles.To use any of the apps in a Smart TV you need to have a wireless router WIFI attached to your internet connection. However, if you don't think you'll need the Smart TV version with the apps, save a few extra bucks and just get the the non-smart TV version (which is the E420-A0). Basically, most of the smart apps have a long way to go to be of much value anyway.

Reviews.Title: Gorgeous.
Reviews.Author: Francisco
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous color. Surprisingly lightweight, though. Have to be careful how and where it is placed because the cat can easily topple it. That aside, easy to set up especially with outstanding tech support from the Amazon tech team and the manufacturer's people. Very easily switches from mode to mode. Netflix, which I watch almost every day, and Amazon Prime have their own buttons, as does something called GO-M,which I have yet to explore. My only complaint so far is that the remote has such small buttons and keys, making it somewhat difficult to find a button by touch in the dark. I will have to memorize the topography. This is a huge improvement from my old standard TV's washed out images and sound. And the price is great!

Reviews.Title: great value compared to other brands
Reviews.Author: timazon "cybernaut"
Reviews.Content: A lot of bang for your buck here.29" smart tv for under $300 is pretty amazing, and 60hz not a big deal for smaller screens I don't think.The only weird thing for the unit I got (29 inch) is the tv stand, which has the screen tilted back at an angle.Should at least have the option for a "straight up" view.Otherwise, no complaints, though it would be nice if they included the "keyboard" remote with the less-expensive models too.

Reviews.Title: made a big difference in viewing
Reviews.Author: papa
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace a 22 inch screen unit in my bedroom. It's only about 7-8 feet away but the smaller screen made it hard to see the score when watching a game. This unit has four different setting on the picture, wide, standard, panoramic and zoom. I use the zoom when watching a gme and now can see the score! The thing I like is there's no distortion like some other tvs I've seen where the picture looks stretched. You just have to learn all the little nuances to make it work for how you want to view, as there are infinite adjustments for color, tint, etc. It actually has more stuff than I'll ever use. Nice to be able to watch youtube, netflix etc too. For the money, I think the average viewer will be more than satisfied. oh yeah, I also used an articulating wall mount so you can swing it around and up and down to change the angleof viewing

Reviews.Title: Brilliant
Reviews.Author: Verte Holdings
Reviews.Content: This is our first HD TV. The picture is stunning. Football looks great. Even local news is mesmerizing.The setup of the product was very easy. Hulu Plus is a joy. The only issue was the lack of an HDMI cable to connect with my computer. It would have been nice to know that was missing in advance, but it certainly doesn't diminish the product.

Reviews.Title: very good value
Reviews.Author: mackoy59
Reviews.Content: I love the fact that I can watch movies thru netflix and amazon prime without using any other connection to another device like my older flat screen tv,easy setup and wall mounting, nice picture even just on regular rabbit ears antenna

Reviews.Title: RIP after four days
Reviews.Author: Rutabegger
Reviews.Content: After four days of minor use and just receiving a DirecTV HD receiver to enjoy the HD on this new Vizio TV, it went black. Luckily I went through Amazon Fulfillment and will receive a replacement in about four days. I just connected the HD receiver last night and the picture was very sweet. Turned it on this morning and nothing. This is after I initially bought a Samsung 40" LED smart TV and it was delivered with a shattered screen. Hope third time is a keeper. If the replacement goes bad I will change my rating. Otherwise it was pretty easy hook up and set up.

Reviews.Title: pretty sweet
Reviews.Author: Phyllis Williams
Reviews.Content: so far so good great selection of settings and its great that my wife can use apps on ithopefully this tv doesn't suddenly die or something retarded

Reviews.Title: Great picture, great price!
Reviews.Author: Robert B. Sweeney
Reviews.Content: I purchased this set to replace a 7-year old Sony HDTV that had given up the ghost. I shopped around for the best quality/price compromise, asking advice from friends as to which brands have good reputations. Not having an unlimited budget, I soon found my choices narrowed down to this Visio model and another one with 3-D capability. Since I have no use for 3-D, I went with this model, which also saved me a few bucks over the 3-D. I managed to assemble the base by myself, but as other reviews have noted it is easier to do with an extra set of helping hands. After hooking it up and setting up the WiFi, I turned it on expecting to be wowed by the picture compared to my old Sony. After all, the technology has improved quite a bit in the last 7 years, but I was sorely disappointed! The picture was dull, flat and not all that sharp. I wondered if I had made a $648 mistake! But it was getting late and my wife and I had to leave for church. When we got back a couple hours later and turned on the set, we were greeted by an on-screen message telling us a firmware update had been installed. The picture now looked entirely different; bright, vivid and beautifully sharp. The viewing angle is amazing; any seat in the house is comfortable viewing. The remote works at almost any angle and is pretty straightforward and user friendly, although I'm stumped as to why there are 2 buttons (INFO and GUIDE) that perform the exact same function? Well, I guess it's always good to have a backup. I haven't used the "smart" features yet (with the exception of the automatic firmware update), so I cannot comment on how well streaming movies works. Bottom line: I love this set! My only regret is that I couldn't afford the 60-in. over the 50-in. But I can live with it. Happily.

Reviews.Title: Nice little TV...BUT
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: It's not a bad little TV.The picture,screen size and imputs are all good.I won't go all "tech" in this review but with those nice things being said there are a couple of things you should know before you purchase.I bought it because of the built in apps but honestly they don't work that great.Even if you have a fantastic wifi signal in your house the tv often has issues dropping the apps midway and freezing .More times than not Netflix will have problems loading and all of this can be very frustrating.The remote is also clunky.The buttons don't always seem to respond properly and the quality isn't that great.As I noted earlier picture quality and sound are great but for a 32 inch you may be better off getting a cheaper model without all the so called frills and purchasing a wifi blu ray player with apps sepratley.

Reviews.Title: good tv - wireless reception not great.
Reviews.Author: Chris A James
Reviews.Content: picture quality is great - Netflix does not work good it all -- they say it's because i need to move the wireless router closer - which defeats the purpose of purchasing a smart tv.  wireless on the xbox and laptop work fine in the same room.  it's the reception on the tv that sucks.

Reviews.Title: THE BEST!
Reviews.Author: Joseph M. Schalte
Reviews.Content: Best Tv I've ever owned (so far). Clear and bright picture. And it's really great to watch the Amazon prime movies.Very easy set-up.

Reviews.Title: Not obnoxious
Reviews.Author: Wit of a Twit
Reviews.Content: I think James May would agree with me when i say this not an obnoxious TV.Pros:-Good size-fast enough when operated one app at a time-useful apps.-Good sound-No trouble w/ set up or connecting to WiFiCons:-Slow when one attempts to access two apps simultaneously-<200 apps

Reviews.Title: Mediocre streaming capabilities
Reviews.Author: AJC
Reviews.Content: Picture and sound are fine.  Download speed over wifi is inconsistent, and often results in the tv stalling and stuttering.  Restarting the TV usually fixes the issue (the issue only occurs with the TV, not any other device in the house, it is not an issue with my internet provider).Would only recommend when on sale.

Reviews.Title: Bedroom TV excels
Reviews.Author: Paul R. Cote "Paul"
Reviews.Content: The TV is my third Vizio and was purchased to replace an old bedroom unit.  It was easy to set up and delivers crisp, clear and colorful video.  The audio is acceptable.  I couldn't be more pleased with my selection.  The only minor problem I encountered involves the interface with Netflix.  This interface is not the same as my other two vizios and is very cumbersome to use.  I contacted Vizio and they are working on the replacement App (I hope) as I am writing this review..

Reviews.Title: GOOD DEAL
Reviews.Author: Mr Mike
Reviews.Content: Have had this TV 3 weeks now.  It updated itself via WIFI the first night.  Has good sound and picture at a great price, I'm very happy.

Reviews.Title: Vizio
Reviews.Author: Chels
Reviews.Content: Shipping arrived sooner then disclosed.  It was easy to unwrap and set up (linked WiFi with no hassle and then set up my amazon and Netflix accounts).  I think the picture and sound is great and it's easy to access WiFi accounts. Good quality at a good price!

Reviews.Title: VIZEO39" Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Jenny Kack "Jenny Kack"
Reviews.Content: I chose this VIZIO brand tv because the VIZIO I had previously worked so well UNTIL we had a direct lightening hit that burned much more than the tv.  I particularly like the "smart tv" feature which is so much more convenient that the previous tv which required a blue ray  player.  Fine tv w/excellent picture.

Reviews.Title: Love the VIZIO
Reviews.Author: Linda Reimer
Reviews.Content: Quality of picture is excellent, user friendly to install and program, price was right, received the next day from Amazon after ordering on line. This is our second Vizio television and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Worked Great Until It Broke; But The Replacement Works Well So Far
Reviews.Author: Buddy S
Reviews.Content: I use this TV about 30-60 minutes four or five times a week in an exercise room and, after a little more than three weeks of use, the TV just completely quit receiving over the air (OTA) reception with an indoor antenna.  Until this problem occurred, the TV reception was outstanding, pulling in about 20 local channels, of which seven were in crystal clear high definition.  The TV also produced very good video from an up converting DVD player connected through the HDMI input.  Setting up the wireless function was quick and easy and I enjoyed listening to music through Pandora.Putting aside the catastrophic failure of the OTA TV reception, my only complaint with this TV lies with the small built-in speakers - the audio sounds tinny and anemic.  This, however, is not a major issue for me since I have a small home theater system connected to the TV through the TV's headphone jack.  The TV also has a digital optical output jack, but my inexpensive home theater receiver lacks a digital audio input, so I get stereo audio from the TV through the left and right front speakers in the home theater systemWhen I encountered the problem with no TV reception, I immediately called Amazon's technical support.  The tech rep suggested several possible fixes, most of which I had already tried and when it became obvious that there was a major problem that could not be resolved over the telephone, the tech rep arranged for a free exchange for a new TV.  Fortunately, I was still within Amazon's 30 day return period on my original purchase.  I just received the new TV today and it is working properly.  I will supplement this report as I get further use with the replacement.This 24 inch Smart HD TV offers a lot of bang for the buck and I am hoping the replacement unit, unlike the original, gives me many years of use.  If you purchase this TV, or for that matter any other electronic product, from Amazon, my suggestion is that you give it a heavy workout during the first 30 days.  If a defect shows up, you can then get it resolved with a minimum of expense and inconvenience during Amazon's 30 day return period.

Reviews.Title: It rawks!!
Reviews.Author: Mud Dauber
Reviews.Content: Works well, very well, in fact. Minus one star for tiny non-illuminated remote buttons. You'll need audio equipment. Speakers are for appearance only.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: mikaela robinson
Reviews.Content: I like this tv. It's a little slow scrolling around the apps and netflix but it's definitely tolerable. Its a great tv for the price.

Reviews.Title: Filled the need beautifully.
Reviews.Author: Darrick Webster
Reviews.Content: Bought this for the kids room.  They love both netflix and Amazon Prime, and having a button for each right there on the remote makes usage trivial; simpler than having to switch to Roku, for example.It connected to my wireless network without issue.  I can't say the same for my much more expensive Toshiba-branded TV, so bonus to Vizio for this.While this is perfect for a smaller room/kids room, it is not something that I would purchase for a larger room/living room because of the small size.  Note that this is my 2nd Vizio and I honestly don't have anything negative to say about either unit.  Both work well.  Good price, quality product.

Reviews.Title: Make Every Seat in the House the Best Seat in the House
Reviews.Author: Othello Lofton
Reviews.Content: This is our first HDTV. Our old SD CRT set is finally going to that great Living Room in the sky. The television arrived and I watched in horror as UPS tumbled the box out of the truck. The television box was safely in nestled in at least seven pounds of packing material and a larger, thicker card board box. Thank goodness for good packaging.We unpacked the television and everything worked right out of the box. It was easy to connect to Netflix and Amazon. The kids even prefer to use Netflix on the television as opposed to the Xbox360.I've noticed no lag and very few artifacts while watching football or playing video games. The picture is always bright and clear with very good color reproduction in a room with two large windows next to the TV. I have noticed a slight dimming and color washing when viewing off angle but it's much less than I expected.

Reviews.Title: It's good
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: Wish it had more apps, but otherwise is great. It's lightweight and easy to move around. Color is great, sound good.

Reviews.Title: as advertise
Reviews.Author: cheng
Reviews.Content: Great product.Came in as I expected.Easily to set up, but it feels fragile so don't drop it.Other than that it's great.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Price, Great Quality, Terrible Wireless Connection
Reviews.Author: wadej93
Reviews.Content: This Vizio has very good quality, though not nearly as good as my 5-6 year old Samsung Plasma. The picture is crisp, and the colors are pretty good. The sound from the built in speakers is good too, but nothing special, pretty much just what I was expecting.But the main reason for purchasing this TV was for it's affordable price for being a smart TV. It was easy setting up the wireless connection, just needed to point it to the right network and punch the password and viola! I mainly used it for Netflix and the picture brought down from Netflix was pristine. But I eventually started running into trouble with it constantly dropping the WiFi connection. To fix it I had to restart the whole TV. I even went into my router's settings and made sure that there was no chance that anything in the router would mess it up, but it still consistently dropped the connection (and it doesn't seem like I'm the only one). So I ended up buying a Google Chromecast to plug into it (USB port in this TV works for supplying power to the Chromecast), and the Chromecast has worked flawlessly. Hasn't dropped a connection once, which should be embarrassing for Vizio that a tiny $35 HDMI dongle can outperform the streaming capabilities of a 32-inch TV set.Though I wish the connection was stable, it was still a decent buy. It was a fairly cheap price for a TV of pretty good quality, although I would recommend just getting a TV without wireless streaming and spend the money you save on a Chromecast (if you have a smartphone or tablet, that is).

Reviews.Title: Amazing quality for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv as a replacement for my old Vizio that broke while I was moving. I have to say that I'm not the slightest bit disappointed. The tv looks great with the slimmer frame, the picture is great as always, and the apps are wonderful. I have read reviews in the past that the apps didn't work correctly. However, I have had no issues. I was a little nervous the first day I set it up because the screen froze and I had to unplug the unit to reset it. But I haven't had any issues since. I pretty much only watch netflix on this tv and the app works as good as on any other device and the user interface is as good as the Xbox. All in all, it was a great buy for me.

Reviews.Title: worst tv I ever had
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Harris "Mexican Bobby"
Reviews.Content: My biggest complaint about this television is the viewing range.  If you sit directly in front of the tv, the color is fine.  If you move slightly to the left or right of the tv, the color fades dramatically.  Reminds me of the old rear projection TV's from the old days.  I can't believe they actually make a television like this.

Reviews.Title: Missing HDMI
Reviews.Author: Murry E. Page
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Vizio E320i-A0 based on all the reviews I had read and because it had 2 HDMI inputs. I needed both.When I received the product from Amazon the HDTV had only one HDMI input.Very deceptive.10/14/2013 Update:I called Vizio and come to find out the serial number TV that was shipped to me, but not the one shown in the manual I received with my TV, has the second HDMI connection underneath next to the Ethernet port.  All is well.

Reviews.Title: Malfunctioned after 30 days and 2 hours use !!!
Reviews.Author: Richard M. Fisher
Reviews.Content: The power supply appears to have gone out, TV turns on and off at will, non-responsive to remote control, then finally died all together, 4 days beyond the Amazon return date - go figure, now forced to deal with VIZIO, we will see how cusromer service works when the VIZIO Help line opens at 8 AM PST  !So of course I called, a nice gal from a customer service office in South Dakota, took me thru some tests, and scheduled an in home tech repair visit, they are supposed to call within 5 days, news at 11.  I do feel better, unit will still not turn on -----dead !

Reviews.Title: Great TV.
Reviews.Author: Joe H Stanley
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV and I love it! It has a great picture and works great in the bedroom!

Reviews.Title: Best TV ever
Reviews.Author: Gettn2old
Reviews.Content: I have had this for tv for awhile now. I have been very impressed with the picture quality. I would buy this tv again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Ryan Williamson
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv a little over a month ago and it works GREAT!  The blacks are black and the colors vibrant.  I haven't used the "SMART" function yet, but plan to very soon (I have to be the only person on the planet without internet...LOL).  My only qualm with this set is that the remote control has to be the worst one I have ever used in my whole life.  It feels cheap and the buttons are very awkward.  Needless to say, I will be purchasing a universal remote to my liking.  You can't go wrong with this television...and for the price, I highly recommend it! ;)

Reviews.Title: Excellent size for kitchen, sharp resolution, love the wireless connectivity to internet applications.
Reviews.Author: Deal Pilgrim
Reviews.Content: Although there are lower priced 22-24" HDTV's out there, I'm very glad I chose this model that includes the internet applications. After connecting with my wireless router, I downloaded all the current internet applications that appealed to me. Regularly use Netflix, Pandora. I love the size and the sharp picture. Although I probably could tweak the color setup a bit, the display is nearly perfect with factory settings. This unit replaced an old 13" tube TV and the quality and viewing is all the difference between night and day. Excellent satisfaction -- highly recommend this Vizio model.

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: Andre R Rosete
Reviews.Content: This TV is a good value at $500.You can plug in a USB wireless keyboard to type things into search boxes in the Smart TV interface.I was disappointed that the 120Hz refresh rate is false, evident when using the TV with a computer. (only 60Hz option available from resolution settings in Windows)

Reviews.Title: Perfect size for a computer monitor and watch OTA channels in Hi Def.
Reviews.Author: fryedinaz
Reviews.Content: Awesome as a HD computer monitor and since I work on Saturdays I can switch to TV input to watch college football in HiDef with an $8 RCA antenna hooked up to it. Bought 2, 1 for work and 1 for home. I have an Apple Macbook Pro attached with an HDMI cord and a thunderbolt adapter. Also nice having built in speakers. Audio from the Macbook comes through the HDMI input.

Reviews.Title: Very good buy.
Reviews.Author: Ric Rotondi
Reviews.Content: Great picture, lots of features, and a good price. Got delivered way fast. Have really enjoyed it so far .Overall a really good buy.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV so far...
Reviews.Author: Charles B. Firth "Chuck"
Reviews.Content: I am watching more Netflix and Amazon movies than ever now that I have one button access to both. I am not a videophile and my standards would probably not live up to some people's but I think the picture is awesome! Setup was a breeze! I have this in my man-cave/workout room mounted high on the wall and it is so sweet.

Reviews.Title: Cannot beat this TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: Michael Wolfe
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical at purchasing a Vizio at first because they have not had the best reoutation in the past. However, I am SO GLAD I bit the bullet and gave this TV a shot! Has all the best features, Amazon Instant Video, Netflix, Twitter, Facebook and more! Plus the picture quality is unmatched! I went from a 40" Samsung and the 47" Vizio blows the Samsung out of the water both in terms of color and picture quality! I would recommend this TV to anyone in the Smart TV market, the only thing is no 3D but I did not want 3D anyway since it hurts my eyes.

Reviews.Title: best tv
Reviews.Author: orvil Savery
Reviews.Content: Buy this TV you won't be disappointed. I love this tv, everything about it screams sophisticated and the colors are sublime. If your arent playing battlefield on this, then shame on you.

Reviews.Title: A Happy Customer
Reviews.Author: k. king
Reviews.Content: Wonderful....Had I known of the capabilities and functionality of a smart tv I would have obtained one long, long, long time ago. This product is truly amazing and the display is WoW! Wonderful really enjoying it, I stream movies at every given opportunity. I've not hooked up the antenna nor do I have any intentions of so doing as I specifically purchased this tv for netflix viewing only. This is a must have for all you movies lovers, very good investment.

Reviews.Title: Very good 29" TV after manual adjusting
Reviews.Author: W. Hohauser
Reviews.Content: I purchased this after getting fed up with my 24" Samsung TV's lack of an audio out, getting up to manually switch an audio selector and having to manually adjust the audio when I want to watch a BluRay or NetFlix. Unfortunately many TVs now lack an audio out that follows the change of video input. Vizio is one of the few companies that still offers this feature in moderately priced TVs. I had purchased a Vizio 32" TV in the past year for a relative and was pleased with the image so I wasn't worried about picture quality much although I knew that it would probably be a step down from Samsung's high quality.First of all, after fidgeting with the cable box to get the audio thru the HDMI, the analog audio out works well and the sound is good thru my speakers. But my warning to you starts here. Vizio has programmed the set to do a lot of "intelligent" automatic adjustments out of the box. The most noticeable is how the image is constantly adjusting itself every time a scene changes or the camera pans to a different image in the same scene. This is probably fine during a baseball game but during an average TV show or movie it's changing all the time. This irritated me to no end so I spent a few minutes and turned off every automatic function in the picture menu. From there I manually adjusted the image to my liking and it's been great ever since. The same goes with the audio, there a few automatic functions that I turned off and now it's sounding great thru the external speakers. The internal speakers are OK, better than on the Samsung but not much.Now that the set is up and been getting daily use for two weeks, I am very happy with it. The only issue I have is the loud pop it sends out on the external analog audio as the set warms up. This may not happen with the optical audio out but I can't test this. I have not tested the Smart TV part yet as my BluRay is already set up for this although it is so slow I might be tempted to see if the Vizio is faster.Update: I finally decided to switch the internet connection over to the Vizio as I was getting frustrated with how slow my 3 year old Samsung BluRay player would take to update and to switch from selection to selection for internet content. The first thing you have to do is accept some sort of Yahoo service with checkboxes, you are not asked for any info. As I wanted to watch something only available on NetFlix online I set up the account which was reasonably easy. There are other on-line options on the Vizio which I haven't tried. Netflix booted up quickly and the quality of the image is much better than the Samsung BluRay player. However, I quickly noticed that all my manual settings for the image and audio had reverted to the factory defaults. The picture went back to adjusting itself in the middle of scenes. So I went thru the menus and set everything to manual again. Not sure why this happened but the very first time i turned on the set, the Yahoo acceptance selection came up automatically. I ignored it so possibly it's somehow hooked into the initial set-up of the set and it reset everything when I finally accepted it. Keep this in mind if you purchase the set. The Vizio already did a software update since I hooked it up and it did it totally in the background unlike the Samsung BluRay player which prevents you from doing anything until it is finished.This is a very good television.

Reviews.Title: Nice Led
Reviews.Author: rcarb
Reviews.Content: I research most items from user reviews all over cyber land  before buying them as i did with this one. I haven't had it long but i tend to abuse items in first 30 days to see if they can stand up to running 24/7 and multiple other things. So far this TV has done great and I have no complaints. I have another Vizio TV and so far have been happy with it and its over 2 yrs old. The Smart applications in this one is way beyond my older one and all of it works great. I would recommend this to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: The TV is great.  It has a real nice picture and it's so nice to have netflix built into the menus and the remote.  I am probably going to buy one more - definitely satisfied with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: Perfect size tv for my bedroom
Reviews.Author: Jessica Fisher
Reviews.Content: This tv does everything I need it to do! I love that it has the smart tv features and the picture looks just like my Samsung plasma!! Great tv great price would definitely buy another Vizio!

Reviews.Title: Good TV wouldn't get a smart tv again
Reviews.Author: Michael Kopplin
Reviews.Content: I like the picture quality and use the netflix app but most of the smart tv functions are not used.  I would have rather bought a roku or apple tv with the difference in price between smart and regular tv.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely amazing TV
Reviews.Author: WMH
Reviews.Content: This TV has a GREAT picture!  Very sharp and clear.  Using this TV on my outdoor patio and the picture has plenty of light during the daytime.  Logged into the TV's wireless WiFi using our PRIME account and caught up on Downton Abbey series.

Reviews.Title: Good little TV
Reviews.Author: Kelly W. Chandler "Kelly Wood"
Reviews.Content: Great TV at a fair price.  The apps are kind of limited to what Yahoo "sells" but serves the purpose.  If you want more apps (like the Amazon Cloud player), I'd recommend a Roku player.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, But VIZIO Cut Corners on the Design
Reviews.Author: Gatorowl
Reviews.Content: We had our kitchen redone last year.  The design included a space for a wide-screen TV.  The designer misinformed me about the size of the space so I purchased a 26" TV.  It was a nice TV but I wanted the biggest TV that could fit into the 29.5"-wide space.  I hoped to fit a 32" TV in the space, but the smallest 32 had a 29.5 width.  I thought about ordering it, but opted to not risk it. I, therefore, purchased the 29" VIZIO instead.The bezel is very slim, so the TV easily fits in the allotted space. The price is definitely a bargain.  My BIL purchased a 30" HD about 7-8 years ago. The image quality was not nearly as good, and the cost was at least 3 times as much.  The IQ on the VIZIO is good in standard def, and excellent in HD.  That really isn't much of a surprise since it is much easier to produce a 29-30" screen than a 52" screen like I have in my bedroom.  Moreover, the capabilities are excellent.  I'm an Amazon Prime Instant Video user.  To see IV movies on my other TVs, I use a Blu-Ray player that has WI-FI and extra functions built in. It's always a hassle switching from regular TV to the extra functions.  By contrast, on the VIZIO, there is a dedicated Amazon IV button built into the remote! In fact there are two other dedicated buttons for NetFlix and U-GO. In addition, it appears that there are 4 additional buttons that can be programmed, presumably to access other services. I have to give the TV a top score for added functionality.However, I have to deduct a star for the construction.  VIZIO must intend this TV to be wall mounted because the stand is the crappiest piece of design I have seen associated with a high quality electronic product.  The stand is basically a flimsy piece of plastic that screws into the back.  Like a desktop picture frame, it points the TV upwards at about a 25 degree angle.  For me, this is unacceptable since the TV is already sitting on a shelf that's almost 6' above the floor. I had to put something under the stand to shift the angle.  This fix doesn't leave me with the greatest confidence that I won't lose the TV due to an accident bump or earthquake.Therefore, if you plan to wall mount this product, it deserves 5 stars. If, however, you need to employ the cheap stand, then the TV leaves a little bit to desire.Regardless, given the incredibly low price, it's hard for me to complain to loudly.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, but Wi-Fi Reception is Spotty
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Carr
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality and overall features on this TV, but unless the Wi-Fi router is extremely close to the TV it won't work.  It even says the signal is strong, but won't connect to online apps.  Looks like some other reviewers have diagnosed the problem.

Reviews.Title: It seems ok, but it's not what I was hoping for.
Reviews.Author: BobbyB
Reviews.Content: The one thing that pushes me to say I don't like this unit is that it emits (intermittently, but at least as, if not more often, than not) an extremely high pitched tone that emerges, especially when the volume is pushed up due to low volume levels on the program I am watching.  It's way up there, maybe in the 10-12Khz range.  I don't know why it's there, and I've considered using the square trade protection plan to see if someone will come here to fix it.  I'm not going to bother shipping it anywhere.There is also another factor I'm none too crazy about; but this isn't specific to the unit, itself, rather to all new 16:9 aspect ratio televisions.  If something is in the old 4:3 aspect ratio, it looks fine on this (or any 16:9) screen, because it fills the screen from top to bottom, and, obviously, goes only as wide as 4/3rds of the height.  But very few things are displayed anymore in the old aspect ratio, except for commercials.  Almost everything is in a new aspect ratio that is NOT proportional to screen size.  This new format seems to be some sort of hybrid meant to work, more or less, with both aspect ratios.If you zoom in, you get full width, but part of the top and bottom of the picture is cropped off.  This is usually (but not always) ok for viewing.  But if you are zoomed and using the menu of your cable box to see what else is on, the very bottom of the screen (for my CSP) shows the date; and that date is gone.  Zooming can also be a problem with subtitles.  The date is always cut off, and  subtitles are often cropped too when zoomed, forcing a change in aspect ratio to normal, which then reduces the size of the image on screen with a lot of wasted space on the sides, and a bit less waste at the top and bottom.  That is an annoyance.  But, as stated, this is by no means a problem unique to this particular unit.I'll be replacing this 32" unit with a 3rd (38.5"--"39," nominal) HDTV, and relegating this unit to my spare bedroom, where it will rarely be watched or heard at all; and, if/when it is watched, it will be from much closer so that the smaller picture won't matter nearly as much.  I'm also replacing a 37" unit, from another manufacturer, in my living room that's not quite 2 years old, because of this aspect ratio problem.  Both of these units will be a bit larger (wider) than I'd like, but they will fit in the areas I have available for them and should solve the screen Image-size problem.I was going to go with another Vizio (so I don't dislike the brand), but I was unable to find a single Vizio that has two inputs for older styles of video equipment, Component AND AV.  That led me to go with 41.9" (42," nominal) unit from the same manufacturer as the 37" unit I'm replacing, because that one does have TWO inputs for things that aren't HD.How much could it cost per unit to include two of the old style inputs, instead of just one?  I have old VCRs, a DVD Player and a Blue Ray player hooked up to the 37" unit.  All I'll have to do is unplug everything from the 37" T.V. and plug it all back into the new 42" T.V.  Nothing needs to change in terms of how it's plugged into my home entertainment amplifier.In both cases (the 37" and the 32" HDTVs) I was replacing old 4:3 aspect ratio T.V.s.  Two years ago I was replacing a 3:4 27" with the 37" HD; and, a few months ago I replaced 3:4 25" with the 32" HD.  One thing you never see in the stores where they try to sell you these new things, is a smaller picture framed by black.  But that's what you get with these new T.V.s and that "hybrid" format--unless you zoom in, which is by no means without its problems.Go with at least a 37" to replace an old 3:4 25" T.V.  I went with a 38.5" Vizio to replace the 32," because the newest, sleekest designs by Vizio seem to weigh less than comparably priced T.V.s by competitors and have a narrower width, overall, because there is only a very narrow frame around the screen.  And go for a 42" to replace a 3:4 27."  For the same viewing distance this should keep image size about the same for broadcasts in the newer format, without the need to zoom.  Things broadcast in the old 3:4 format will be very much larger with only some wasted space on the sides, but the entire signal will appear on your screen.

Reviews.Title: Smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: Akbutter
Reviews.Content: This TV is awesome.  I can access Netflix from it, get a variety of crazy channels via cable, and can surf the web and watch YouTube.  Great little TV.  Nice picture.  Very good sound.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: The Mate
Reviews.Content: First and only HDTV that I own, it is good as far as Im concerned, good picture, and sound. Updates automatically and does what it should. Would buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, would buy it again
Reviews.Author: Peter W.
Reviews.Content: Pros:- The picture is awesome. My Samsung was a 720p DLP. This is a 1080p LED. My wife immediately noticed the difference when I was playing 1080p content. She mentioned several times to me how beautiful the picture is. I sensed she was skeptical when I bought it because I don't think she has ever heard of Vizio before. I had though, so it wasn't a concern for me.- The sound is pretty good. I noticed when I watched Jurassic Park on this tv though that it lacks bass (during the title sequence with the loud booms). When I had my Samsung, I had the video and audio running through an Onkyo receiver. The sound coming through the 7.1 speakers clearly blew away anything out of the tiny speakers in this tv (which I presume are larger than some thinner tvs).- Because this tv had 4 HDMIs (4!), I could hook up all of my devices without needing an a/v receiver. I sure do miss the bass though, but I'm in a town-home. My neighbors probably have no complaints now.- Built-it Netflix and Amazon (to name just two) saves me from having to run my 2nd generation "fat" PS3 (another 300 watts).- In about a month of using this tv, I have saved 200 kilowatt hours and some money too on my electricity.Cons:-The remote is terrible. It is nice to have built-in buttons for Netflix and Amazon, but this remote requires you to press hard to get a response. Sometimes, you don't even know if the press registered. I replaced it with a programmable Logitech Harmony. This tv also requires you to point your remote directly at the sensor on the lower left corner of the bezel, or nothing happens.-The Internet apps, including Netflix are slow to load and buggy.I ordered it here at Amazon, price is just amazing: http://amzn.to/13ErHQn

Reviews.Title: Wow! Great tv
Reviews.Author: Wayde LaRue
Reviews.Content: Great TV. Have in the kitchen on a wall mount. Bought this because comments about audio being better than most. It's more than fine for what we use it for. Highly recommend this TV!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for what we needed.
Reviews.Author: Vielehr
Reviews.Content: We bought this to mount on the wall in our bedroom. The 29" is not a common size, but it provided that perfect fit bigger than 26 and smaller than 32. Love the built in connectivity, used mostly for Hulu and Amazon streaming. We also have a 47" Vizio in our living room.Very impressed with this brand.

Reviews.Title: Another AMAZING vizio tv for our living room
Reviews.Author: Hillary L. Wald "hw"
Reviews.Content: We had another LCD vizio that we loved but needed something bigger and better :)  Got another vizio and LOVE this thing!  Perfect size for our small living room, makes watching tv or a movie a fun experience.  I'm no tv expert but this thing is user friendly and very clear.  Cool how you can watch movies with a couple clicks from our amazon prime account.  This tv is big but not too huge, would have gone with a 50" if you're into super big tvs or your living room is big.  Love our new vizio tv :)

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Small/Medium Living room
Reviews.Author: Ranjit Raveendran
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV  from  Amazon, 2 days back, Impressed with the quality even with 720P, Worth a buy @ $278 from Amazon for a smart HDTV. Installtion steps are simple as I connected WIFI and Cable in a minute and watched Movies in Netflix right away without any breaks or buffering (My WIFI modem is so close to TV). Got a Dilemma between Samsung HDTV and this one, As Samsung doesnt guaranteed the Smart version, I opted this one and quite happy with this.

Reviews.Title: TERRIBLE TV
Reviews.Author: MAT
Reviews.Content: The TV is definitely not smart.Everything is very slow.The reach of the wifi is literally 15 ft. Any more than that and it will drop the signal, and won't be able to find it without restarting the tv. If you are lucky it wont freeze, which takes a few minutes to unfreeze, and then you have to start the whole thing again. Really annoying if you are using netflix, even more annoying if you are watching amazon or something else because at least netflix has a quick button.If you are getting this tv, do not get it for the "smart" feature. It is very dumb in that respect.

Reviews.Title: Good Purchase
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This television was purchased to replace a dinosaur of a 19" TV.  Since it was in a smaller room, (12'x14') I decided to try a 720p versus a 1080.  I decided to try one with the Smart TV options as I have been a Prime member for about 6 months.The television's setup was very easy.  It connected to my cable system without a problem.  It connected to my wireless network flawlessly.  The smart options worked without any issues.The picture is great.  It is impossible to notice the difference between this 720 TV and my 42' 1080, and 46" 1080 sets.  The sound is adequate for a smaller room.  The build seems solid and well put together.  The only thing that could have been done better is a longer electric cord.  It is about 3' long.  Not a big issue, but my only "complaint".I would recommend this TV to anyone looking for a reasonably priced LED.

Reviews.Title: Sleek Design, Still Needs Work
Reviews.Author: glspark2007
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the price for this TV, it's a Smart TV, LED, Vizio. It's got a lot of things going for it, from the sleek design to easy set up. There are a lot of things to like.But there are also some things to dislike, some very frustrating things. I am having a lot of problems with some of the apps, especially Netflix (which is the main app that I use). It tends to load, play a video for a while, then freeze, and disconnect. I've contacted Netflix, tried all of their troubleshooting. They tell me it's nothing on their end. So, then I called Vizio, they checked my connection and tell me that it's strong and my TV is working fine. Vizio did mention that because Internet TVs are new, the servers aren't as good as what you would get in a computer or even a game console. As a result, even if an app like Netflix is running fine on your computer you may have problems on the TV (especially if you have a lot of devices hooked up to your Internet, which I do). Vizio and Netflix (I called them again) both told me that there is some sort of problem, and they are working to get an update out. But in the mean time, nothing else can be done.So, all this to say, nice TV with definite problems to still be worked out.

Reviews.Title: slow startup, weak remote, otherwise great
Reviews.Author: Zachary Berman "nerd about town"
Reviews.Content: I use this TV only for Netflix, Amazon, Pandora and Hulu plus. No antenna, no cable. No ethernet, either, works great on wifi. It's replacing a computer that we had set up in front of the couch that we nicknamed "the tv". I was happy with programming selection, just wanted a bigger clearer screen.It works great for all of these, and I especially appreciate the option in advanced menu to set output volume to variable. I have the audio output to my stereo (as I was doing with the computer) and it is lovely to be able to adjust volume from the one remote. One remote! How many people have a tv experience with one remote?!That said, the remote has tiny buttons placed in awkward places (it's virtually impossible to find pause and play in the dark). Startup doesn't take quite as long as Windows XP, but close (30-40 seconds). If you lose the remote, you lose access to the smart features, because there the only button to access those features is on the remote: A big downside for me, a man with a toddler.I was waiting for a 32" smart tv under $300. This is it.

Reviews.Title: sound issues
Reviews.Author: Pam Girouard
Reviews.Content: Love this TV except for one annoying thing...occasionally when I turn it on I have no volume. I have to turn it off and then back on to have volume.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the $$$
Reviews.Author: Audy Joy
Reviews.Content: This TV has great picture quality.  The moment I turned it on I noticed everything looked much more crisp than a couple other TVs I had.  The sounds seems to work fine.  I didn't adjust any of the settings so it seems to come out of the box pretty much ready to go.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Edia E. Bedell
Reviews.Content: I love my new tv.  It was easy to install and has a great picture.  I would recommend it others.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, especially for the price.
Reviews.Author: Kevin J Marsh
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this unit.  First, it was very affordable.  But even if it wasn't, the picture is great, The on board sound is way better than what's on my 42" Sharp that I paid a bunch more for.  Getting on line was a synch and haven't had any issues with NetFlix or Amazon instant video to speak of.  If you are looking for a solid, dependable 32", don't waste your money, get this bad boy.

Reviews.Title: Great price, great product!
Reviews.Author: Cheryl L Rosenberger
Reviews.Content: I originally bought this product because of the apps that come along with the television.  It works great!  I can watch netflix without having to watch the movies only on my computer.  The picture quality is fantastic.  I did want to say that the sound on this television is great!  Most of the flat screen televisions do not produce good sound, but the sound on this one is really great!.  Fantastic product and I saved 20.00 alone not paying tax, and because I am a prime member I saved an additional 10.00; in all I saved 30.00 on this purchase!  I love Amazon.com!

Reviews.Title: not all that good after all
Reviews.Author: Donville Edghill
Reviews.Content: after only having the tv for 4 months the remote stopped working and the power button on the side of the tv does not work ..after researching seems this is a constant problem with this brand....i will not be able to watch tv if i unplug it an then replug again...will have to purchase new remote, wonder how long that would work

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV for the money!
Reviews.Author: Adam P.
Reviews.Content: This TV is fantastic.  Great color and clarity as well as some great features.  The bezel is great because it's small and is the way all TV's should be!

Reviews.Title: Great price and value
Reviews.Author: Paul Meehan
Reviews.Content: A smart TV priced very well.  We needed a TV for a guest room and wanted it to be "smart" and finding this product filled our need completely.  Picture every bit as good as our much larger and pricier Sharp Aquos we use as our primary TV.

Reviews.Title: Visio smart tv
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: It is a great television.  I love it.  I plan to buy another one in the near future.  The color and the clarity of the screen are great.  It was delivered on time and the setup was easy.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E320i-AO 32-inch
Reviews.Author: Donna M P
Reviews.Content: Have no complaints about the picture, better, it seems, than my larger and much more expensive plasma. Sound is just okay, but it is very easy to plug a sound bar into it.

Reviews.Title: good price but not sure about quality
Reviews.Author: Jillian shatken
Reviews.Content: its a great price but i am a little worried- i have had less than a month, and already it has randomly shut off twice during use.also, it does take a little bit of time to boot up and turn on.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Lorraine
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for a month now and I love it! The TV was so simple to set up. It is so easy to access netflix and hulu. The only complaint I have is it that the remote is small. It is sometimes difficult to hit the right button. But other than that I think its great.

Reviews.Title: Easy Neflix and Amazon Prime Access for a good price
Reviews.Author: TNC49
Reviews.Content: This TV was perfectly sized for a spot in our family room. Accessing the internet was relatively easy and we have watched movies on both Netflix and Amzn Prime with no issues. Overall very satisfied with the purchase. As some of the other reviews have stated, there is a little bit of a slow "turn on" time but given that the TV in our house is already on too long, it's not a big deal for me.

Reviews.Title: HD tv
Reviews.Author: g-books
Reviews.Content: Great tv. Picture is remarkable. I have only one complaint. The remote could have been more substantial.However, the value and quality of the tv make it a great purchase. I shopped for a while and found this to be the best for the money by far. Buy it, you wil be pleased.

Reviews.Title: Little Problem
Reviews.Author: Rit566
Reviews.Content: Got the first set it was defective Amazon quickly sent another tv, Its fantastic has an amazing picture and the sound is not bad at all, Internet apps take a bit to get use to but work great.the only thing I would like to see is a complete owners manual you only get a quick set up guide but you can get that at vizio .com

Reviews.Title: Above and beyond expectations.
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: This is a great buy! I still look at prices online and instore, I feel like I got a Great deal. It has a Amazon and Netflix button on the remote. Apps are preloaded and easy to use. Picture is great!  Very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: This VIzio is great!!
Reviews.Author: sean sullivan
Reviews.Content: This is my third Vizio. I love these TV's.  They are priced excellent and work really well. The Picture quality for this TV is good to excellent. The sound quality is a little to be desired and so I added a sound bar to address that issue.  The APPs on the TV are easy to use.  I f you are looking for a great priced and great TV. This is the one!!

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Jones
Reviews.Content: We purchased this t.v. for a bedroom about a month ago. The size is perfect for the location; the picture quality is excellent and setup was quite easy. Don't know yet about its endurance over time, but so far, I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Very disapointing wi-fi
Reviews.Author: k postma
Reviews.Content: I bought this thing because of its wifi. The wifi works very, VERY badly. I have been on the phone with Vizio probably 8 - 12 times the first 12 hours I have had this TV. First solution they came up with was "we'll send a repair guy, he'll be there in 8 - 13 business days". Well that wasn't about to happen for a TV 2 hours in the house. That solution got fixed, but took some talking. The suggestion was made by Vizio why don't you hardwire it instead? Well, if that was an option I would have done it in the first place, and NO, I will not run cabling thru the house to get to my wi-fi TV. This was about par for the course for the rest of my conversations. They come up some nonsense answer, I question them some and low and behold another answer pops up that I should have received in the first place. In the end I got a new firmware downloaded (after 3 phone calls, with 3 different sets of instructions). I still can not get decent Wi-Fi reception, with a decent speed although my laptops and my cell phone have no problem getting enough speed in exactly the same location. If I turn the TV a different way (the way it fits in my cabinet) reception completely disappears, it seems the TV is shielding it from the router. Very disappointing experience. It is going back to Amazon. I hope retuning the TV is not going to cost me an arm and leg.

Reviews.Title: Wireless router must be in the same room as the TV
Reviews.Author: Charles Bogenberger
Reviews.Content: As a disclaimer, I have tested 2 of these TV's and they both have the same problem.  I returned the first one because I assumed it was defective, but after unpacking the second one, it became clear, this is an issue with the TV itself.The WiFi doesn't work if the router isn't in the same room.  I live in a 1 bedroom apartment, so the router is only about 30 feet away from the TV, but still it won't work.  When I put them in the same room, it works fine.  I called tech support and after identifying the problem they told me to contact my internet company.No other device in my house has trouble with the internet.  My laptop, my iPad and my iPhone all connect just fine.  It's only the TV that is unable to receive a signal from 30 feet away.I am returning this TV

Reviews.Title: Cheap Quality Parts
Reviews.Author: Michael A Toto
Reviews.Content: speaker stopped working after 3 months. the extended warrantee I purchased was worthless. I had to send the TV back to Vizio repair depot in CA....waiting 4-6 weeks for the TV to be fixed. Next time I need a TV I will go to Costco. Integral Netflix and Amazon menus are horrible

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price, but NOT a 120hz TV
Reviews.Author: Javery
Reviews.Content: To start with, for the money I paid for this TV (on sale for $429), I'd probably buy it again.Pros: The picture looks great in general, but I'd recommend playing around with the settings until you're satisfied. Compared to my last piece of crap TV, the sound is actually pretty great. The app selection is fairly small, but it has most of the staples - Netflix, Hulu Plus (if you like commercials), Pandora, Amazon Prime, and a bunch of those online movie stores everyone keeps pushing. It also has DLNA capability, which I haven't used since it froze up on me the first time I tried it. 4 HDMI inputs is also a big plus.Cons: Even though it says 120hz, it really isn't. I've scoured the menus and the manuals looking for the Smooth Motion setting, but it just isn't there. I'm fairly sure they just skipped it for this model. I'm not a huge fan of the soap opera effect, but I don't really mind it. I DO mind this TV being labeled 120hz when it clearly is just a 60hz TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Aaron C. Ettlin
Reviews.Content: With a small footprint, slim design and an actually usable feature set, this set gets high marks from me. I love the built in WiFi and streaming video features, and the quality of the picture is great. It's not cluttered with unnecessary features like many other TVs offering better "features". I also feel like the 120hz doesn't upsample too much, like some other TVs, where their high refresh rate passes the 60hz source material (Blu-Rays, DVDs, video games, etc.) and yields an unnaturally fast looking image, making everything look like a daytime soap opera. For whatever reason the 120hz refresh rate on this Vizio feels very natural, but keeps up with fast cut scenes, or action sequences.Also, I wish I had bought this TV on Amazon, it just went on sale for $50 less than I paid for it in-store. Either way, I think this TV is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Top of class
Reviews.Author: Wayne Matthes "movie collector"
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great picture. Thin frame makes it look like a picture, low weight, easy to set.up. Connects to the internet through my router faster than my computer or Kindle does. I now have 3 Vizio TV's because of my good experience with them.

Reviews.Title: Wasn't what I expected definitely pleased
Reviews.Author: T. A. Lewis "- Mr. Lewis"
Reviews.Content: First off, the TV is wonderful. Some reviews said that the sound could be louder. I personally find the sound is more than loud enough. The picture is great. Initial set up was very easy to navigate on the screen. The HD displays a crisp, clear, and colorful picture. My only issue with the TV is that it does not have an internet browser. I was under the impression that I would be able to get on the internet right from my TV but that is not that case. It comes with some pre-installed apps, that connects using an internet connection (Ethernet cable or Wi-Fi). Looking back, I should have contacted Vizio's customer support to ask them if the TV comes with an internet browser. But I love the TV other than that. Definitely a great buy for a budget under $700.

Reviews.Title: Vizios seem to be nice TVs
Reviews.Author: FoxyGma
Reviews.Content: We like the Vizio's.  Nice picture and decent sound out of the tv speakers for the price.  First one came damaged since it comes UPS in the store tv packaging.  This one seems fine.  Only bad comment is the internet is hard to keep connected and you need an N-router to even have a hope of connecting.  So far I've had to reconnect each time I want access but maybe I'm missing a setting.  once connected apps are slow to load but I think this seems to be the case for all devices except idevices and the ps3.

Reviews.Title: Great Product: Reasonable Price
Reviews.Author: JMarcos
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV for the price. I was a little hesistant in buying a VIZIO because the brand was little known to me. I am glad I made the purchase and only regret that I did not buy the 60 inch. It would be nice to have a web browser as one of the apps to the Smart TV software.

Reviews.Title: I Love Vizio!
Reviews.Author: ZachBG
Reviews.Content: This is my second Vizio TV and first LED Smart TV.  I shopped around a lot before buying this product and found this TV to be the best bang for the buck. The newest LED 1080 HD technology, 50 inch Smart 1080 HDTV for under $700 is a great buy.  I found comparable Samsung's and LG TV's for 400+ more, and thought this was a great TV for the price tag.The screen looks beautiful, design is sleek, thin and light.  Picture quality is incredible.I like the remote and the Amazon and Netflix buttons featured on the remote.I'm very happy with my Vizio TV and highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Brian Hart
Reviews.Content: We purchased this tv as a second in our home. It has a good picture, decent sound, and was easy to set up and operate. I know some people remark about the sound being under whelming, but we aren't using this as a "theater" tv, just a living room sit and watch. I think for the money this Vizio is tough to beat in the 50" size. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: A Poor Choice
Reviews.Author: John S. Eddinger
Reviews.Content: Arrived ontime.  The remote control is difficult to use.  We were unable to hook up to wireless.  We called Vizio Customer Support.  They suggested we move the TV closer to the modem.  We did so, but the TV was still not able to connect to WiFi.  We returned the TV.

Reviews.Title: Not-so Smart TV - BEWARE (FIRST WORLD PROBLEMS)
Reviews.Author: Jason Willome
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture quality, for the price, and compared to other "smart" TV's in its class, its interface for streaming video is a little faster and slightly easier to navigate. They have a very responsive customer service system in place, that you can contact by phone or email, although it's only available during normal business hours (which is frustrating, as I usually don't watch my TV/have problems with it, during normal business hours).My experience with this TV has been very mixed. We bought it for its "smart" features, so that we could stream Netflix and Amazon, wirelessly, but this feature only works about 50% of the time. When it is having a good day, it's beautiful, streaming video effortlessly, with a gorgeous picture and sound. When it's having a bad day, I spend the whole evening digging through trouble-shooting info online, emailing the Vizio customer service people, since they have usually gone home for the day, checking my wi-fi signal, restarting my cable modem and router, and resetting the TV to default (which is usually what the customer service folks tell me to do, anyway).The last point has become the most frustrating aspect of owning this thing. Sometimes, resetting the TV to default actually works, so the hopeful, optimistic side of me gives it a try. This means that you have to re-enter all of the required data, not only for the TV itself, but for all of your streaming accounts (email, passwords, check-here-if-you-agree, etc.). You would think this would not be too much of a hassle, but consider that you have to do this using the arrow & enter keys on the remote, often scouring a non-QWERTY keyboard for the right letter. If any of your passwords are long and have both numbers and upper/lower-case letters, this can be a bit hard on one's positive state of mind.Another thing you should be aware of is the sensitivity of the wireless feature, itself. We bought a new Cisco E2500 wireless router, anticipating the purchase of this TV, which beams a full signal throughout our 1920's era house (with its plaster and expanded steel lath walls), and out into our backyard. We also recently bumped up our internet subscription to the highest speed (thinking maybe the 20mbps we were getting wasn't enough for our poor Vizio). Often, what happens is that the signal doesn't show up on the TV at all, or shows a signal that is at about 2-3 bars - much weaker than what our laptops, iPhone, and kindle show (all of them showing full signal strength). Last night, after trying to get it to work for an hour, we gave up and watched Netflix on my laptop...BOO.So, ultimately, I have given up on this TV being "smart." For the money, it's a good quality TV for the picture and sound, but the wireless features are so sketchy, they are practically non-existent. At this point, we will probably buy a Roku or some other external device for streaming wirelessly.  A "smart" TV is a great concept, but this is our second one in this price range, and both have offered a similarly disappointing experience (we exchanged the first for this current one - god bless costco). I would say that as there are so many positive reviews on this TV, that we must be the common denominator where our problems are concerned (our old house/the metal lath in our walls), but then I can't account for the strong connectivity with all of out other devices. As far as I'm concerned, it's all about the hardware, and the cheap components in this TV are reflected in the affordable price.There. Now I feel a little better. Thanks, Amazon, for letting me feel a little better about my first world problems. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: Vizio TV
Reviews.Author: prisonjudy
Reviews.Content: We love Vizio products.  We currently have four Vizio TVs.  The pictures are crystal clear, audio is great, and the slim size is perfect!

Reviews.Title: excellent tv
Reviews.Author: maceman
Reviews.Content: great tv. wireless is good. the colors are great. I have an older about 10 year old lcd 32 inch from vizio that doesn't even come close to colors on this tv. I can tell you LED is far better than LCD color wise. Only time will tell which one will last longer.For those that havent gotten a smart tv, get one. Having apps to watch and do different things is great. I love watching youtbe videos and vudu movies.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV!!!
Reviews.Author: Patrice Mincey Scheiner
Reviews.Content: I love it!  Mounted it on the wall in my new bedroom and it is great to be able to go online with this and not have to get out of bed to go to the computer!  Can stream video through Amazon Prime right to TV, can go on Facebook and post, can download and play games, all from my cozy bed!  Amazing picture and audio quality too!  Only negative is the remote that is included...no keyboard!  I did my research before ordering and ordered New! Original VIZIO XRV1TV Qwerty keyboard remote for M420SV M470SV M550SV... when I ordered the TV so they arrived at the same time, which works like a charm with this TV even though it isn't listed in the remote's description.  Vizio really should include the XRV1TV Qwerty keyboard remote with any of their Smart TV's- doesn't make any sense to sell a Smart TV and not include a remote with a QWERTY... other than that... PERFECT!!!  Just remember to spend the extra $13.69 and order the QWERTY remote when you order the TV!!

Reviews.Title: The one I received has defects
Reviews.Author: T.C. Peace
Reviews.Content: I would rate this TV 5 stars but the one I received has defects.TV has 4 HDMI inputs. HDMI 1 works perfectly fine all the time. However, the other 3 have an annoying habit of losing signal 2-3 times for each hour of viewing. Doesn't matter if the input is from SAT, PC or Blu Ray. While viewing content, every 20 mins (or so), I get a "No Signal" message on the screen of the TV which lasts one to two seconds. It's not the HDMI cables because I have tried different cables only to experience the same. It's not a big deal, but it is annoying. I've had this TV for 5 months and it has done this since day one.The other annoyance is the TV's built in media player. I can play an .AVI or an .MP4 video, and part way through the movie the player will just quit and go back to the home screen. Doesn't happen during every movie, but probably half of them it does. None the less,  it's annoying to watch three quarters of a 2hr movie only to have the player quit. I then have to restart the show and fast-forward to the point in the movie where the player decided it would quit. UGH!Having noted the defects, I will say this TV has cool features. The picture quality is good, better than the 5 year old 46" Samsung LCD it replaced, and it is totally customizable to suit your tastes. Its wireless streaming of movies works flawlessly. I use a sound bar for audio, but the sound quality of the TV's built in speakers is decent enough to where you could probably get away without using a sound bar, if you have a smaller room. Also, the price of this TV is more than competitive with other similar offerings.So you may be thinking; why doesn't he call customer service about those defects? Answer is; the annoyance of unmounting the TV from the wall outweighs the annoyance created by the defects. Or put another way; human laziness.

Reviews.Title: So so.
Reviews.Author: Mafalda Quinn
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv because it was the only smart tv in 24" size. Easy buttons and easy to organize. The drawback is that colors are a bit off, at least compared to other tvs we have. Tried tweaking, with no avail. Sometimes the picture is in squares, so i just go to another channel, come back and is OK. I would have bought another brand if available.

Reviews.Title: Great For The Price But...
Reviews.Author: Roger
Reviews.Content: UPDATE:(after four star rating)Netflix on this television needs to be updatedSmart features are not so smart.All the apps are low quality and the Instant Prime app is horrific.The television randomly turns off while i'm using it (I think this is due to the Netflix app).I wish I hadn't gotten this television.But for the price it's not bad.... if you can get over the aforementioned issues.

Reviews.Title: Had to return just after the warranty expired.
Reviews.Author: AlfredNYC
Reviews.Content: I might complain but Amazon did give me full credit although this TV started getting a mysterious blue line running horizontally across the screen two weeks after the warranty expired. I should have returned it the minute I set it up. I hated the stand and the way it pitched the screen back. Sound out of this was very tinny and it was basically being used in a spare room about 5 feet away from the sofa. Also thought the picture quality was less than desirable but put up with it because of the price.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for small spaces
Reviews.Author: Renee D. Martin
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my daughter (for now and when she goes off to college in the Fall).  This is our first Smart HDTV.  We love it - very easy to set up, perfect size for a smaller room and will be great at college.

Reviews.Title: Clear Picture
Reviews.Author: Chelsea
Reviews.Content: Very clear picture. I just thought you would be able to use the internet and browse the web but you can. It does a lot of other things though.

Reviews.Title: Amazing clarity!
Reviews.Author: Derek Guthrie
Reviews.Content: This is a second tv that we don't use much except at night, the picture is great!!  Was hesitant about buying from Vizio, but will for sure buy another one!!

Reviews.Title: Smart TVs are Smart---Good Purchase!
Reviews.Author: C. James "Cris-Style"
Reviews.Content: No complaints thus far, bought this TV for my toddler daughters and its a perfect size TV for a medium sized room. Cool apps, smart TVS are the way to go. Great sound quality! I've always been a VIZIO fan! Recommended product! Can't beat the price!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful picture
Reviews.Author: Tim Amos
Reviews.Content: This was a great buy. Great HD picture and good sound. If in my budget, I would have purchased a larger version of this same Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Nice but only one HDMI
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The picture is nice but it only has one HDMI connector so could only do either cable or BluRay without purchasing a separate connector.

Reviews.Title: Great Budget TV
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: I ended up buying this TV for $635 with prime. It's a great deal and was a quick (2 day) replacement for our previous TV that met an untimely end. After purchasing this TV I saw it for $50 more at Costco so you can't beat the price. I haven't bought a sound bar yet but one will eventually be needed if you don't want movies and music to sound flat. The only negative thing I've experienced with this TV is that the Netlfix app occasionally crashes and the TV has to reboot (even after the last firmware update).

Reviews.Title: Nice picture but slow Smart features
Reviews.Author: J Free
Reviews.Content: I bought this model in order to use Netflix and other sites to watch movies. Netflix works well (though not on wifi - has to be attached with a cable) and is easily accessed using the TV remote. However, I can't get the TV to connect to Pandora, which my old Roku did flawlessly. I'd probably just get a Roku and a regular TV without Smart technology in the future. Otherwise, no complaints about this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, solid picture, plenty of functionality.
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I had the hardest time finding a TV that didn't have a ton of features I'd never use. This one was the winner. It has a few extraneous things, but for the most part it's a lean, mean, picture making machine.I have one complaint, so let me get that out of the way first. On assembly, there are three parts and six screws. Three screws attach the vertical stand to the back of the TV, that's simple. Three more screws attach the vertical stand to the base. That part is a bit more interesting. there is some sort of clip that feeds in to the base. I accidentally broke this on trying to put it together. I don't think it really matters, the screws are what hold it all together anyway. I was just kind of annoyed that there seemed to be no way to put it together without breaking this little tab-like piece. It's a little thing, but something that you should know when you go to put the thing together.I'm thrilled with the picture quality, the size, the thin bezel, the overall thickness of the screen, and all of the features. I don't feel the need to list all the features here as you can easily get those just about anywhere you want.I will however, talk about some of them that are especially handy.There is a HDMI port on one side of the TV which is great for devices that you might not have plugged in all the time or might want to borrow an HDMI cable from. It's much easier access than the other ports. The Component port and standard Phono plug ports are sort of combined, so if you think you can plug your N64 in along with an xbox using component cable, you're out of luck. The component ports are GBR for video and of course RW for audio. The G component port is also the Y standard definition phono plug port. I really appreciate whoever designed this though. The ports are vertical on the back, a little recess near the bottom allow for the port placement, but the diagram is placed facing you so you don't have to stick your neck back there at an awkward angle to understand where the ports are. I had some trouble with the coax port, but that could have also been the antenna so I won't hold it against the tv.The menu setup is great too, everything is extremely navigable. The netflix and amazon instant video integration is smooth and simple. I honestly don't know what else I could ask for. Overall, I'm very pleased.

Reviews.Title: very good LED flatscreen for the price
Reviews.Author: Tom Petit
Reviews.Content: for the price this is a very good LED flatscreen.  Set up was fairly easy.  I had a small issue with picture scanning, but a quick call to the Vizio 1-800 number fixed that in under 2 mnutes.  Nice clear image.only two drawbacks:1) there are no S-video connections on back of television, but i was able to work around that so not a real big deal.2) no real instruction manual, just a basic guide with a 1-800 number to Vizio.  on the plus side, i was able to figure all the setting out except for a picture scanning issue, and that's were the 1-800 number came into play.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Andrew J. Butler "bojay1"
Reviews.Content: Great TV. Love everything about it. Crystal clear picture. Streaming apps on TV run with no fade or glitches. Highly recommend this for a great midsized screen.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 24 inch
Reviews.Author: Manateebob
Reviews.Content: Unit shipped very quickly.  Was very easy to setup.Picture is very crisp, clear and sound is adequate.I'd buy again and recommend this tv.

Reviews.Title: It is just OK
Reviews.Author: Billy Hindman
Reviews.Content: This TV was purchased to replace an older and smaller Sharp TV that is in our Kitchen. I've found the sound quality of the VIZIO TV to be very poor; much below that of the old Sharp that it replaced. Also, for a "Smart TV" it is difficult to connect to the internet plus it looses the connection often. I've contacted VIZIO customer support twice about this problem and while they were quite friendly and provided helpful ideas none solved the connection problem. The internet signal in the Kitchen is very strong and used by another Smart TV located in another room and two computers without any lost of connection issues. I rate the TV as OK because it is an inexpensive unit and as the expression goes you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: TV Meets Expectations
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
