Reviews.Content: My television arrived on time as promised. Overall, the TV meets my expectations. The picture quality is good with some minor tweaking. Head on the picture is great. At an angle the colors seem a little washed out. All smart TV apps function without any problems. I wish that the TV had a DNLA function to allow it to connect with my smartphone.

Reviews.Title: Stops Working...
Reviews.Author: Summer Flores "Summer In FL"
Reviews.Content: We've had this television for less than a year and now when you switch it on it doesn't always stay on. The white light comes on and then it turns itself off; in order to solve this problem we have to stand there and hold in the on/off button until it finally stays on. For owning it for less than a year (May 2013 purchase), we're disappointed to say the least. So it's "okay" for now as it's still technically working....

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Watson Michael D.
Reviews.Content: For the value it is a good tv.  Does not yet rank with the quality of a Sony, Samsung or Panasonic but, as they say - you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: This Smart TV has a bright and vivid picture along with quality Surround Sound.
Reviews.Author: Mike Branstetter
Reviews.Content: I was looking for the largest screen that would fit between my kitchen counter and the upper cabinets.  I have 18" which is fairly typical. On this model the support stand attaches at the back along the lower edge opposite the speaker strip.  Not the best if you need it close to the wall, but PERFECT if you are trying to save vertical space.  Also, the trim around the screen is only 3/4 inch and the speaker strip barely 1 1/2" wide.  All this nets nearly 16 inches of screen fitting into an 18" space.  We have a large kitchen and a very wide center island with seating on the far side.  This row of seating is 6-7' from the screen.  At this distance this 29-inch TV is very clear and easy to see.  I think the picture quality is actually better than my Big Screen Sony in the family room.  The (i) version of this model is Smart or Wifi enabled.  We thought the streaming movies might be a nice addition, but after hours of searching we found the selection from all the sources to be generally "old" and rather uninspiring.  What was inspiring was the included TuneIn app.  Now we have a quality music system with an HUGE selection with sound that easily fills the kitchen and dining rooms.  We are very happy with the Vizio E291i.

Reviews.Title: a great buy
Reviews.Author: Sojouner
Reviews.Content: This is a great ty(price and quality considered): got cat5 connection plus wifi; light-weight: if mounted have two people assist in the mount; great picture quality.Dislikes - there is not a good way to update the bios if there is one; the rename of channels to names that another can identify is not readily available not possible; the sleep options are not in optimal denominations etc; and there is no discernible way to get the time set on the TV; but all things considered these are tiny based on the price, other options and price offered by this product.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: Bunnyman
Reviews.Content: We bought this in November, wanted to use it for a bit.  We're loving this TV.  Its our first flat screen, we opted for the Smart option, totally happy we did.  No cable, no satellite, we're over the top and over the air only, and everyone is happy.  Picked up a $50 powered antenna, pull in 21 digital channels.  I wish more apps were available (players) but that will change once people realize how awesome an integrated device is.  Holding out for a PBS player for this!  Great pic, sound is fine, no complaints.  Shipping was incredible.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy with This Excellent HDTV!
Reviews.Author: Taliesin
Reviews.Content: Purchased the 29" version for a bedroom wallmount and had it up and running in just a few minutes straight from the box.  Exactly as described, and even better than expected!  Had planned to hook up a Roku to this TV, but there was no need. This Smart TV has excellent WiFi, and using Hulu, NetFlix and Amazon Prime Instant streaming is a snap. Very easy to set up and use, very good quality picture, sound is fine for bedroom, outstanding value for the price, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Great value, sharp picture
Reviews.Author: Vincenzo "Vance"
Reviews.Content: "Needed" a TV for my bedroom and decided that I wanted to get a Vizio because of my previous experience with them.  I am impressed by how clear, bright and vivid the picture is and its very smooth.  I love the SMART options and it streams Netflix and Hulu perfectly. Definitely a winner in my book.

Reviews.Title: Good Purchase.
Reviews.Author: bober bill
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my new Vizio TV.  I already have a larger one in my living room and liked it so well I got one for the bedroom. The picture quality is very clear and the speakers make clear sounds so I don't think I'm going deaf. Highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great T.V.
Reviews.Author: redhead
Reviews.Content: I really like our new T.V.-we had an ancient TV/VCR combo-now I can watch Hulu and Netflix on my T.V. directly and it's very nice.  Very clear picture-can be very loud on the volume-great bedroom TV for us.  I'm very happy with it so far.  It's very user friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: mrsmaonaigh
Reviews.Content: We got this tv solely for the purpose of streaming Netflix in our bedroom.  However, the tv has major issues connecting to Netflix.  It either lags several times during one show, causing major interruptions or it doesn't connect at all.  We've contacted Vizio and got the standard "do a factory reset" which did nothing but make it even worse.  It does have a nice picture when it is working.  This is very disappointing because we own several other Vizio products and have loved them.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Paladorys
Reviews.Content: It doesn't have every bell and whistle, and since its a smart TV there is some additional setup besides plugging it in and turning it on, like connecting it to your network. Naming your inputs, adjusting the settings for each input so they are where you like them for each connected device. Setting up and updating the apps. I was disappointed that there were 2 updates, and that all my app settings were reset after I thought I was done, but after the 2nd update no more problems.

Reviews.Title: Sharp picture
Reviews.Author: KaiserKat
Reviews.Content: We bought this tv for our bedroom and it's working out great.  It's the right size and the clarity is super!  We like we can get netflicks and all the functions are on the remote.  The best buy for our money!

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: atropos
Reviews.Content: Got this TV as a gift to my husband and he loves it. Easy to set up, easy to work with. I love that we have access to all of our subscriptions at the same time. I think that Amazon can work on making their app for smart TVs better.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: My first TV I bought or have had in 6 years. Best decision I have made in a product! My Dog even watches the tv!

Reviews.Title: Great buy great picture
Reviews.Author: Jennifer stands
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the tv and the wireless capabilities are awesome.  We would recommend this tv to anyone who is looking for a smart tv.  Price was better than any store we could find.  We were a little worried about having it shipped but it was packaged very nicely and ups did a great job handling it.

Reviews.Title: Vizio tv
Reviews.Author: Judy Penick
Reviews.Content: Slow coming on. Visio remote hard to understand. Cannot find apps on remote.  TV ok but disappointed in complexity of remote.

Reviews.Title: Very good value for the money.
Reviews.Author: Frodo9 "NewYorkah"
Reviews.Content: We needed a larger TV in a new location, and since we've had a good experience with a smaller (24") Vizio we decided to go for the 42" E series model. Even though Samsung is our favorite brand, we didn't want to spend Samsung $$$ this time.Also, we really didn't really want a 'smart' TV, but I gave up looking for a dumb Vizio in the size we wanted after brief search ( I'd originally planned to get a Roku to hook to it).  I LOVE Roku.PROS:- I'm not one to want to mess around with picture settings if I don't have to, and fortunately it worked fine for us right out of the box. Other reviewers have plenty of suggestions for tweaking the picture, but I did nothing, and we're happy with it. It's not quite Samsung sharp, but it's close, and meets expectations for the price I paid (about $460).- The sound is OK - but I may add a sound bar later.- It connected to my wireless network right away with no issues.CONS:- The whole Internet Apps thing seems very clunky. I mean it works, I suppose, but as another reviewer pointed out somewhere, it has the look and feel of something out of the 1980's. The whole app GUI/menu process just looks antiquated. From the available apps I only really care about Amazon Prime, which itself has a gaping whole - there is no way to access your Watchlist. You have to 'search' for anything that is already in your Watchlist in order to stream it. I'll probably eventually ditch using the apps and get a Roku anyway.- The remote is almost ridiculously small, and the buttons follow suit. A real PITA when working your way through the above mentioned search feature in Amazon Prime.But overall, we're happy with the purchase. We have a very good  (not Excellent) TV for not a lot of money. Which is what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: OK for the price
Reviews.Author: Stan Funston
Reviews.Content: From straight on, good sharp picture in HD with good black level., good picture on SD sources. However about 40 degrees off axis the blacks turn gray and the color quality turns to a pinkish blue tint. On antenna input digital picture is good but analog channels (from an in-house distribution system) have a boosted black level.

Reviews.Title: worked for one week
Reviews.Author: Kimberly S. De Witt
Reviews.Content: This TV shut off by itself several times and finally would not come back on. I Had to return it.

Reviews.Title: Just the Ticket
Reviews.Author: George Heuston
Reviews.Content: This TV fits our family room cubby nicely.  It's colors and resolution are sharp, and I love the smart features on this TV, which allow 1 button access to Netflix, MGo, and the Internet.

Reviews.Title: It plays great....
Reviews.Author: M. Crespi "Zomby Woof"
Reviews.Content: It has a great picture. I'm only using an antenna and the apps. I use mainly Netflix and Youtube. I use the yahoo weather app too. Anyway I say other reviews that said the apps were troublesome. I've had no problem. I have great picture on the Netflix and Youtube apps. My other TV is a 50" Panasonic Viera plasma so that's all I have to compare too. Anyway, I recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good....
Reviews.Author: Troy Edwards Jr. "teejaysuperman"
Reviews.Content: I've only had this TV about 1 day, but I must say, I love the size, and the picture.  My wife loves it as well.  We are both gamers, mostly Call of Duty, and we can't wait to play later tonight on this 50'' beast of a TV.  Great bang for your buck, thank you Vizio, keep bringing out quality products, at a decent price, and you'll keep earning my money, and my recommendations.  And thank you Amazon, for double boxing this bad boy, knowing that UPS and Fed Ex throws these things around like monkeys throwing feces.

Reviews.Title: Best 24 inch HDTV ever!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Miky
Reviews.Content: I have had other HDTV's by Vizio and they sucked!!!! But this tv (to me) is just about as good as a 4K tv. The picture is so crisp and clear that it exceeded my expectations for Vizio. I recommend this tv to anyone who already has other HDTV's or wants to have a HDTV. And the best part is that it's way cheaper than most HDTV's on the market. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Good Picture But App Interface Flawed
Reviews.Author: Walter L. Werling
Reviews.Content: I like the HD picture but I am not satisfied with the smart tv app interface. I have Amazon Prime but the Amazon app doesn't have a watch list. Also, there isn't an easy way to flip back and forth between cable and an active app. The app closes when I switch to cable. Obviously I'd like to pause the app, flip to cable and come back later, but I can't seem to be able to do so.

Reviews.Title: Work right out of the box
Reviews.Author: Wanda G. Bailey
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best tv s I've purchased . Set up was seamless. I have used this tv for three weeks and I can honestly save no worries.

Reviews.Title: Not clear
Reviews.Author: Carol Ross
Reviews.Content: 24 inch The picture is not clear.  I have tried different settings, media, connections, sources.  It is very hard to read any words on a broadcast.  I could read words better on the old fashion type TV.  Words on the help menu are clear, but that does not help for watching a show.  Surely I must have missed something.  I see not reason this should be so hard to set up.

Reviews.Title: Good picture, Terrible apps
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV so I could watch Amazon Prime movies and Youtube videos on TV. The audio and 1080p, 120 Hz picture is great, but the built-in apps are terrible. Youtube only shows a few results when you search for videos that return hundreds of results on my laptop, and the TV doesn't buffer videos as well as the computer. The Amazon app looks and acts like something out of the 1980's. I find myself searching for a movie on the computer and then having to type in the name of the movie on the Amazon app using the 1980's TV remote just to get it to play on the TV. The remote was terribly designed and the buttons are microscopic. I find that it is easier to hook the laptop up to the TV using an HDMI cable and just typing/searching on the computer. Now that I think about it, maybe three stars was too many...

Reviews.Title: 32'' TV
Reviews.Author: Tamara Hillman
Reviews.Content: We ordered this 32" TV for our screened-in Arizona room.Living here,(in Arizona) it has to be heat-resistant to survive our summers,so we'll see how it does, but it is mounted on the house wall which will always be shadedinside the enclosed patio.Works great so far, and is the perfect size.

Reviews.Title: Great tv, great picture
Reviews.Author: ernest g ruiz
Reviews.Content: This tv really surprised me with it's inky black levels and fantastic contrast and color.The smart features are excellent but viewing angles are fair.This is a great buy, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: sasha
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this deal.  We've had a little trouble getting it dialed in as far as sound & picture, but that is probably operator inexperience more than anything.  It has a very crisp picture and we love the fact that there is little frame - all picture.

Reviews.Title: I loved my shipment of my Vizio TV sent through Amazon.com
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "James T Simbeck"
Reviews.Content: I trust Vizio products and this order I made through Amazon.com met all of my personal standards. The box came to me a little damaged but with the packaging the TV was in excellent condition TY very much for your company

Reviews.Title: Well I wouldn't call it a "smart" tv
Reviews.Author: Cicely "dinocat"
Reviews.Content: This TV is ok if you only want to watch from your cable, if however, like me, you want to watch netflix and other apps, you can forget it. It connected once, but it hasn't since then. It says there is only one wifi bar signal, but I get full strength with my laptop, phone, and ipad in the same location.In addition to the lousy wifi connection, there is a really weird feature that makes the sound come in waves--I finally figured out that you have to turn this "feature" off in the settings.Also, I wish the remote lit up. And the power button on the remote is so small it's hard to locate.

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews here and bought it at Walmart. It was the same cost either way and I was able to see it in action on display there so.....But anyway, I have the 50". Great price for a LED smart tv.  Picture is excellent. I adjusted the picture settings from factory as it was too red, now more realistic colors.Setup was extremely simple. It located my Wi-Fi in about 3 seconds and hasn't cut out yet (1 week in).Only gave it 4 out of 5 stars as there were some downside.There is a glare from windows. Doesn't matter if sun is shining or cloudy. Not terrible. Snow outside makes a brighter glare..It does come with the Amazon streaming app installed even with an amazon button on the remote, but it is glitchy. Sometimes it doesn't work right, freezes, etc. Once a video was streaming, it doesn't have any problems. but exit out early and thats when hiccups occur.I mounted it on the wall and cannot seem to find a flat plate for the bottom to cover the stand port. so I just left it open for now.All in all, I highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Crappy wireless connection
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "schupe7"
Reviews.Content: I've had this tv for the last 4 days and it has not stayed connected to the internet consistently. There is nothing wrong with my wireless network. My other devices work just fine. I purchased this tv specifically to use the Amazon Instant video app and it sucks. It won't connect and on the few instances that it did connect, the connection was intermittent or just dropped completely. When it was connected to the internet Netflix worked fine, but Amazon did not. If I do not get sufficient customer support it's going back.Update: I went as far as purchasing a new router thinking that maybe that would help resolve the issue with the tv not connecting to the internet wirelessly. However, no such luck. It connected once and we were able to watch a couple of shows on Amazon, but then the signal was lost to never be found again. I even restored back to the manufacturer settings TWICE and no such luck. So the tv is on it's way back to Amazon. Hopefully the Samsung I've purchased will prove to be better.

Reviews.Title: Gift
Reviews.Author: Michael T Pulos Sr
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a gift for my grand-daughter and she is very pleased.  No effort to set up and attached to cable.  She loves it.

Reviews.Title: Perfect wifi tv!
Reviews.Author: lizzy
Reviews.Content: I love my TV! I've now had it 10 months and have had no issues. The picture is perfect! I researched the hell out of wifi TV's and knew that Vizio had a very good reputation. Couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: Whoever designed that stand should be flogged.
Reviews.Author: P. Johnson "Savannah J"
Reviews.Content: I'm not normally a fan of public flogging, but that stand is horrid. Whoever is responsible for that should be stopped before he/she designs again.

Reviews.Title: matches with the Vizio 40 inch Sound bar
Reviews.Author: clark foster johnson
Reviews.Content: Great combination for a guest room.  Very little space used and great picture and sound... 1st class combo.  Got them from the vizio outlet. Great value.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with it
Reviews.Author: J. L. McKinley ""I even read cereal boxes...
Reviews.Content: After several false starts getting another brand of "smart" TV only to be totaly disappointed, this Vizio is everything I wanted.  Just great.  Good picture, simple menu commands ... even a nontech person such as myself can understand it.

Reviews.Title: VIZUO TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: So far I like the tv & size & HD.  It is a smart tv but have not used that much yet. So far so good.

Reviews.Title: Smart TV, HD TV, What More Can You Want?
Reviews.Author: Marc Schiler "Curious Professor"
Reviews.Content: This TV has all of the normal qualifications, such as high definition, outstanding color, a half dozen inputs and does double duty as a computer monitor.  But it is also already a WiFi station with preprogrammed hulu and Netflix access, so you can watch from anywhere in the house, if you have WiFi available.  No wires, just the power plug.  Lovely!

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: Suzanne Neloff
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my kid. Works great. Love the quick access buttons on the remote. If it was 1080p i would've given it 5 stars

Reviews.Title: A smart TV at a great price.
Reviews.Author: Brett M
Reviews.Content: I bought my first VIZIO tv almost 5 years ago. It was a 37'' LCD. We recently bought a house and the apartment sized 37" just wasn't cutting it. I made my buying decision on the great success I had with the old VIZIO. This review is for the 50".The Good:Smart TV features are simple yet entertaining.After some adjustment, the picture is beautiful.The thin bezel makes this TV look very sleek.Both WiFi and ethernet streaming is fast.American made.Cons:Because the TV back lit, it is not as thin as edge lit LED TVs.Sound lacks. You will want a sound bar or other speakers.No Quarty keypad on remote makes initial set up a hassle.Dark spots in corners from weight of TV. (I will be contacting them to see if this is normal)The Ending Sentence:Vizio makes a great American made TV at a price lower than most.

Reviews.Title: How is this TV so cheap?
Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: Technology is getting so amazing.  I can't believe the quality of this TV for the price.  I upgraded my bedroom TV and the smart TV was huge for Netflix and Amazon Prime.The TV is light, slick looking and the picture is amazing.  I have nothing negative.  The sound is ok, but what kind of speakers can you fit in a flat screen?It's a no brainer.  Great purchase.

Reviews.Title: Plugged it in and watched it Work
Reviews.Author: Edward W Nesoff
Reviews.Content: I do not normally take the time to do ratings, but this one is worth the time.  This TV exceeded my expectations despite some of the negative reviews.  It worked right out of the box.  I did not have to mess with settings or anything.  Also, this TV was purchased through Amazon and was shipped in perfect condition, and it arrived in only 2 days to Honolulu!!!

Reviews.Title: Very nice tv for the price.
Reviews.Author: BJW
Reviews.Content: I had been considering upgrading my old 36" tube TV to my first HDTV for a couple of years now and had narrowed it down between a Samsung and Vizio, Samsung didn't have the 42" size I determined I needed and there closest model was more expensive so I went with this 42" Vizio. This TV has a impressive picture, especially when you hook it up using the HDMI cable for max resolution and calrity. Component cable is not that bad looking, if that is all you have and don't want to buy additional cables, but would recommend the HDMI cable. Wasn't expecting the built in speakers to have nice sound but it does, it has different modes(rock, jazz, classical like on a stereo or ipod, it even has a sound equalizer. This TV has a lot of features and several picture and sound modes, but the picture has a custom mode if you don't want to use any of the predetermine modes you can adjust the TV manually.Amazon shipped this out quick and arrived, it good condition ordered it on a Saturday night it came on Tuesday.I was concerned before receiving this because I didn't get the Samsung and Vizio is the lesser manufacturer, but heard some good things about Vizio in the past, so this also helped my final decision I am so glad I did I am very happy with it so far. I haven't use the smart features yet, like the ethernet or the wifi yet as I had the TV just a short time. But will update my review once I do.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV except for the stand.
Reviews.Author: B. Kirkorian "History buff"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for one of the bedrooms. Considering the small size, the features, price, and picture and sound quality are excellent. My wireless N router is located about 15 feet away from the TV in another room, but the wireless strength is excellent. No issues streaming Netflix, Vudu, or the other sites.Unlike most small flat screen TVs with a tilting stand, this particular model comes with a fixed angle table top stand, in which the best viewing quality will be if the TV height is lower than eye level. In my case, I initially set the TV on top of a 5 ft tall chest of drawers to be viewed in essentially a prone position below the TV. Needless to say, the picture quality as a result of this viewing angle was poor. I resolved this issue by replacing the supplied fixed table mount with a tilt/swivel wall mount, and mounting the TV to the wall. I now have the perfect viewing angle and the picture is great.Now if the TV manufacturer's could only include a snore detector that would turn the TV off automatically...

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Eric O
Reviews.Content: Really appreciate this TV, it has an excellent picture, good quality, the price point was excellent for a Smart HDTV. Don't use the smart functions as much as I thought, but nice to have them available.

Reviews.Title: Size matters - in sound quality
Reviews.Author: Tastinient
Reviews.Content: I recently rated the 24" model of this series. I rated the TV 3 stars because of the low quality 2 watt speakers. What is the point of high definition, and streaming audio and video, if the sound is just bad? I also think the tilted base is odd and limiting for many people.But it's better news for this size. Happily, the 29" model comes with 5 watt speakers, and while it's not exactly a theater experience, the sound is adequate and improved in comparison to the 24".This set is otherwise impressive for the price. It starts up quickly, gets a strong signal from my router, and has an impressive amount of apps. It's light, the picture is crisp, in short it checks nearly every box you want for a web enabled TV. The tilted base on this series remains strange, and because the set has limited viewing angles, it's a problem for many, so I give it 4 rather than 5 stars. I have mounted mine to the wall, so the base is not an issue, and I'm completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Comprehensive Smart, But
Reviews.Author: Randall Griffin
Reviews.Content: Pros:Video - good not crisp.  cropping or zoom may be required.  8 of 10Audio - fine.  8 of 10Smart - Netflix and media library and othersCons:Media app doesn't have current video and audio codecs and no updates are possible or available (per their helpdesk)Media app response time and display fair.  Took minutes to display folder contents and then only a few ~15 per pageStuck.  Device froze a couple of times (grey screen of death).  Had to unplug to reset.  (Not good during the first week.)Conclusion:It is going back.  I will spend $50 more to get better video and access to my media library (perhaps Samsung UN32EH5300)

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: jl
Reviews.Content: Great deal for the money. The quality of the image is better than anticipated. Lots of great features on top of that.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Wonderful!
Reviews.Author: Renee Ann Hermiz
Reviews.Content: This item arrived within a day or two -- so quickly.  I bought it new, but want to make clear that it was in perfect condition.  So first, bravo for the packaging and shipping.  The product itself ... well, I can't believe how amazing it is.  The TV is easy to use ... the set up was simple.  I bought a Blue Ray player to go with it and am so happy.  I'm still stunned at how little it cost for what it can do:  go online ... watch netflix ... beautiful picture image ... etc.  I bought it with the black surrounding trim.  Some users have said it takes a little long to turn on -- eh!!!  There's a bit of a moment you wait once you press the "on" button, but I so don't care ... quite a petty thing compared to the package itself.  EXCELLENT BUY!

Reviews.Title: Fine TV
Reviews.Author: Susan Bonello
Reviews.Content: This is my first experience with HDTV & I'm sorry I waited so long.  The picture is very bright ( checked it before I bought at a big box store).  I've only had it slightly over a month so do not know how reliable it will be.  Quite happy so far.  It's a 40" not a 47" though.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price - plus we ditched cable
Reviews.Author: christina
Reviews.Content: When our old TV died, we started doing research on what to get, and read reviews here on Amazon, and CNET, etc.  This TV got great reviews everywhere and so we went for it (even tho we had never heard of this brand).So besides being a space-saving flat screen, and having a great HD picture, the best part of having this new TV is that we no longer have cable!  Instead, since this is a "smart TV" -- we have our internet plugged in directly to the TV, and since the TV comes with NetFlix, Hulu and Amazon Prime (and many more) "pre-loaded" - it's super fast and easy to stream from the internet.So far we're loving the TV and not having to pay a cable bill.  Highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Love this product, did not come with the keyboard remote.
Reviews.Author: Naturegirl "Naturegirl"
Reviews.Content: I had to plug in the computer keyboard to enter in the wireless stuff because the remote has no keyboard. But the sound and picture quality is excellent. Especially considering the 24 inch only takes 5 dollars a year to operate. It was really easy to set up Netflix and Amazon Instant. I would recommend this tv to those people who do not have a xbox to connect netflix with.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: John Schaefer
Reviews.Content: Good on-axis image. Not so good off-axis by more than maybe twenty degrees.The mounting point pattern was not fully consistent with the standard wall mount I bought. I made it work, but I was surprised by the existence of the issue. Probably my fault for not checking the specs well enough, but why would mounting points be non-standard?

Reviews.Title: exactly what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Alicia
Reviews.Content: Easy set up..color and picture is great.I bought this for my 9 year olds son's room for him to watch Netflix on and he loves it. The remote makes it easy to access Netflix and Amazon and a bunch of other apps.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift
Reviews.Author: Lynn Nolan
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV as a Christmas gift for my daughter who is just out of college and moved into her own small apartment, she is very happy with it she doesn't have cable so the Wi-Fi with Netflix and other options are great for her and the price was right in my opinion

Reviews.Title: Vizio tv review
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: The tv freezes on me. sometimes I can't change between inputs or change the volume. I would have to turn the tv on then off

Reviews.Title: Great bang for the buck; smart TV is limited, disappointing
Reviews.Author: Bobbity
Reviews.Content: Just a quick review, point by point:* The black levels are fantastic on this TV* However, white is not so good. The four corners are a bit dim compared to the rest of the display area. I've heard this is typical of low-end/budget LED TVs. So be it.* Four HDMI inputs is great for people with lots of devices and no receiver to handle the device switching.* Smart TV features are lame. I think the wifi radio inside the TV is too weak to do much, honestly. Netflix, for example, is terrible. But a PS3 just less than a foot away can stream Netflix on the same wifi router with no issues at all.Bottom line: Great bang for your buck. Don't buy it for the smart TV features, get an Apple TV or Roku device instead.

Reviews.Title: Screen isn't very bright, needs a low light room
Reviews.Author: Curious Guy
Reviews.Content: My parents bought this TV in a black Friday sale and like it well enough, now that we adjusted the settings. As the title suggests, the TV lacks brightness, I have never seen such a dim LED screen on another TV. At first, it was completely awful, ANY source of light reflected on the screen and made it impossible to make out any detail on the video behind that light. My parents have a small lamp on an end table with a 40 Watt bulb in it, which was covered with a lamp shade and still caused this, no matter where you sat in the room.However, once you go into the setting and turn OFF the ambient light sensor, "Luma" setting, and Auto dimming, it's not nearly as bad. It's still not great, but even during the day with some sunlight on the screen it is possible to watch something and see what is on the screen. So the auto-dimming feature is basically so aggressively trying to save power, it dims the screen too much (or maybe it just can't accurately tell how bright the room is). Again, once you turn off all those features it's much better, probably a 4 Star viewing experience, though the power use will be MUCH higher than normal with those features off.So why the 2 Star review then? The first TV my parents bought was the 47 inch version, and they loved it. They especially liked the smart TV features and only bought the 50 inch version because with the black Friday special it was 3 inches more screen for 50 dollars LESS money.However, the first 50 inch TV they got had a faulty wi-fi adapter in it, so none of the smart TV features would actually work. They called Vizio and Vizio's support rep was completely unable to help resolve the issue. He told them that the TV needed to be only 25 ft away from the router at most because if they put higher quality wi-fi adapters in the TV's it would cost 600 dollars more for the TV (which they got for 500)! They explained that they had basically the same TV and it worked in the same spot, and he continued to assure them that Vizio uses junk parts to save money and it wasn't going to work no matter what.They took the bad TV back to the store and haven't had any problems yet with the new set. So the lesson here is that if you call Vizio with a warranty issue, they will likely tell you "Of course it doesn't work, we use cheap parts". I didn't believe it, but a Vizio employee who claimed to be a manager repeated that line to us about 20 times.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: David A. Rollins
Reviews.Content: It takes almost 60 seconds to boot up, but I guess that is normal with all Smart TV's these days.  Changing channels takes 3-5 seconds, so an older TV has it beat on that, but it does have wireless internet and we watch Netflix and YouTube streamed right onto our TV.  Good price, good TV, not the best but it does the job, has decent sound as well.  I like the multiple HDMI ports, that is one of the reasons why I got this one.

Reviews.Title: This is possibly THE best TV I have ever had for the money!
Reviews.Author: GLIverson
Reviews.Content: I expected nothing more than the normal good quality HDTV like I have bought before..... this was much more.I cannot imagine how anyone would be disappointed with this TV.  As an added benefit, I loved the easy access to NetFlix and Amazon,.... but the 1080 screen is so clear, clean, and bright that I was really pleasantly surprised!It it nearly effortless to set-up, install, and get everything going intuitively.  You do have two small screws to place in the special V-stand.... very easy to do with a regular phillips screw driver.  Even a "caveman" can do it with ease.....(smiles).  AS an added plus:  The mounting or setup base is unique to Visio only and makes it to fit into smaller places without looking so big and out of place!  In all the other TVs, I found not one that sat so low and firm/stable.  I needed to fit this into a corner spot in my home office and it not only works great, it looks fantastic.  Clean, sharp lines, and small..... very small for a 29 inch TV.... foot print. Perfect.  The plastic rim is VERY narrow, so you do not have all this huge black bezel around the picture.  The sound is crisp and clear too - excellent.Buy with confidence.  Now if you really wanted a 50 inch, do NOT buy this great 29 inch and then be disappointed.  :-)Now my wife wnats one for her bedroom...... (Oh my, what have I done? Ha ha!)  Do Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: I needed a new TV
Reviews.Author: Outlaw
Reviews.Content: Other people rave about it but I'm not quite THAT thrilled. The remote doesn't work that well on it's own even with new batteries frequently and it doesn't seem to sync well with the basic remote for Verizon. A bit of a pain in the ___.

Reviews.Title: Very good basic smart TV at a great price.
Reviews.Author: Jblakus
Reviews.Content: I have had the 32" set for 3 weeks now and so far am happy with it.  It suits my general viewing purpose very well. Primarily have it hooked up on an antenna to receive local channels in HD or standard broadcast. The smart function allow me to also view streamed programs if I choose.The picture quality was good out of the box.  The screen is very clear, bright and capable for all lighting conditions. HD programs were crisp and clear in 720P. However, after adjusting the picture setting in the menu to my preferences the picture quality is now very good to excellent.  I definitely recommend turning off all the automatic picture enhancement features then, adjusting the settings back to your own personal taste. There are a couple of older reviews that can help with that chore. Its worth the effort.The built in WiFi works well for using Netflix or Amazon prime programs.  Set up was fairly easy on the WiFi. I am also impressed with the built-in audio. The speakers are louder and better than the older 32" LCD this one replaced. The remote is very basic and has small buttons which could be a problem for some people. The remote buttons also do not illuminate.So far the only thing I was not impressed with was the flimsy, light weight, stand.  It also does not much of a footprint compared to the older 32" TV stands it replaced (also a Vizio). So stability could be a concern with the stand that comes with the set. But the stand is not a big concern for me since I wall mounted this TV, just like the older one before it, to a very secure bracket.The one thing I have not done with this set is watched DVD's or BR disks with it. So I cannot speak of the dynamic range. I highly recommend this set for general purposes viewing.  It would be very good in a bedroom, small den/office, workshop or maybe for a student or person who need a good first TV set.

Reviews.Title: Good Television, Great Value
Reviews.Author: clancyfurr
Reviews.Content: Compared to other LED TV's of this size the Vizio was much more reasonably priced.  The set up was quick and easy and the apps were easy to use; Vizio customer service was phenomenal as usual.  You get a REAL person who picks up immediately and will stay on the phone with you until your questions or problems are resolved.  Our last problem was with the DiSH box NOT the Vizio TV but the Vizio Customer service rep knew that and even talked us through correcting THOSE settings! I am not a TV snob and don't really spend hours and hours in front of the boob toob but I am very happy with this set and would recommend it.  My only wish is that there were more apps included such as HBO on demand; but the HDMI cable is easy to reach.

Reviews.Title: After 3 months I still love it
Reviews.Author: D. Barnes
Reviews.Content: What can I say that hasn't already been said? This is a fabulous TV at a great price. I bought the 39-inch model because my living room is tiny, and it's just about the perfect size for my viewing distance. The built-in apps are all you really need but you can add and delete apps (yes, it's actually possible to delete the useless Yahoo apps). You do have to sign up for the Yahoo app store but that's painless. I had no trouble at all getting the TV to recognize my WiFi network, and connecting it to Netflix and Amazon Prime couldn't be easier.The slim-bezel design ensures that none of the picture gets cut off. Of the brands I shopped before buying this TV and experience with friends' TVs, Vizio and Samsung seem to be the best at not chopping the bottom of the screen off. Panasonic and LG cut off a significant portion of the picture on all sides, and Magnavox cuts off quite a bit too.TV reception is solid, the tuner has all the latest DTV technology and it has no trouble with my indoor antenna. Fast-motion shots in football games can be problematic if your local station has any sub-channels eating up their bandwidth but as long as the source signal isn't compressed too much you won't notice any artifacts. Picture quality is incredibly sharp and the built-in speakers are all most people will ever need but it does support external audio devices if you are a surround-sound aficionado.The coolest thing about the Amazon Prime app is that while you're searching on the left side of the screen for the video you want to watch, the live TV picture scales down to the remaining 75% of the screen on the right so you can browse for the latest Downton Abbey episodes while your local meteorologist talks about the weather. Of the video-streaming apps on this TV, the Amazon Prime app is the best.Netflix comes in a close second. Navigation is easy and video quality is second to none, as long as the video is available for 720p or 1080p. Some TV shows that were produced in HD are only available on NF in 480p resolution, but the TV handles those well. I was actually surprised when I was watching a David Tennant-era Doctor Who episode and the TV reported that it was only receiving a 480p stream from NF.The YouTube app is kind of clunky but when it's playing videos it plays them back without any problems, and you can sign in to your YouTube account so you can use the website to find videos and put them in your Watch Later list, then get to them from the TV without having to deal with the app's search function.The only app I was disappointed with was Hulu Plus. The video was washed out, and the sound was tinny. I hooked up the Xbox and played the same video using that Hulu app and the video and sound quality were great, so this is a fault with the Hulu Plus app for Vizio. I contacted Hulu support and they were not helpful. Most of what I wanted to watch they still don't have rights to stream to TV or mobile devices so I canceled my free trial anyway. Therefore the Hulu app's shortcomings are a non-issue for me. If you want to use Hulu and have a game console or other streaming device, use that for Hulu, not the TV's Hulu app.The media player app can stream videos, music and photos from your PC running media-streaming software such as TVersity. Combined with Windows Media Center (free) and a TV tuner card, I've made this my DVR.This is by far the best TV I have ever owned. I'm planning to buy a smaller version for the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Larry Wishon
Reviews.Content: What an amazing deal I recieved n with a great quality to match. This will be a great addition to our home entertainment.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV; WiFi adapter is worthless
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews but felt I had to write so that people will know that if they intend to use this TV for its Smart TV apps (Netflix, Amazon, Hulu Plus, YouTube, etc) via WiFi, you will be sorely disappointed. I have yet to try a wired connection, but the built-in WiFi adapter for this TV is terrible. My Nexus 7, iPhone, and laptop all get good reception using the same streaming apps from the same spot, but the Vizio TV either cannot connect or the connections constantly drop out. So unless you are intending to use this with only with a set-top box and/or a wire Ethernet connection, I'd say look for another solution. My way around this problem was to buy a Google Chromecast.That said, the TV is otherwise a decent, low-end TV. The picture is good, the connections are adequate (only 1x HDMI), and setup was simple.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E390i-A1 39-Inch 1080p 120Hz Smart LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: KellyB
Reviews.Content: Including the tv I have since the reviews seem to include all the eSeries Vizios, regardless of size.I've had this tv for a couple weeks and love it for the most part.  This is my first LED or HDTV as my previous tv came over on the Mayflower.  :)Plusses:Netflix and Amazon Prime Streaming are great.  I've also used an HDMI cable to hook my laptop up to it to watch other video, which works well once it's set up.It has a great pictures, after adjustments as described below.Original setup was painless.Minuses:The remote--Would be better if lit.  It could also be easier to read and would be nice if it included a keyboard.When watching streaming (Amazon/Netflix/etc), I can't get it to stay at 1080i or other picture settings to stay without resetting it every time I turn the tv on.  I use the "Reset Picture Mode" to get to 1080i, and then go in and turn off the Smart Dimming.  It's ok when it's the DVR, so I'm not sure what I'm doing wrong there. It would be nice if those settings would stick.

Reviews.Title: One really good value!
Reviews.Author: Lawrence
Reviews.Content: You don't know how much of a picture you are missing till you see it on this TV! At 60Hz there are things that you never see. Watch football on this one!

Reviews.Title: No online content without remote control.
Reviews.Author: 0xDEADBEEF
Reviews.Content: Great for the price if you can live with the following:No extended functions without remote control: no netflix, amazon, dlna, youtube, etc. You can not access any of these things without the remote control.The wifi performance is weak. I have other devices that work fine in the same room, and area (router is downstairs about 30 feet away). It works, but sometimes it just flakes out.The DLNA streaming performance is worthless. Does not support mkv or any format other than mp4 and then only at the low standard. Sometimes it will list the movie on my server, but refuse to play it.

Reviews.Title: Not happy with the product
Reviews.Author: Lovin' life in Florida
Reviews.Content: Not happy with the product.  Have had a very difficult time adjusting the color balance.  Colors in the shadows go very dark too easily and if I adjust to brighten up the shadows, it blows out the brighter colors.  Also struggling to get the tints just right.  Looked at other reviews for clues on settings, but it seems other Vizio products use different scales on color settings, so not much help.  Did not have the same problem with a Samsung product.I assumed due to weak audio, I would hook up a PC speaker set to the TV to enhance the audio. First TV had no earphone jack signal output.  It was easily and quickly replaced by Vizio (Kudos to Vizio).  Replacement TV earphone jack output signal was very weak.  Had to crank up to 90% to get low to average sound output on either earphones or the PC speaker set.  [Earphones and speakers worked fine on my PC at 20-25% volume setting]  Spoke to Vizio Customer Service and was told (1) earphone jack was not for that purpose(??); (2) Earphone jack was not  an "amplified" output (true, but it should provide a variable level signal to drive the earphones); (3) it was a constant volume output (not true; varying the volume level would vary the output) and they couldn't help me further.

Reviews.Title: Love the Smart TV Functionality
Reviews.Author: Robert Harris
Reviews.Content: Let's face it...it's great to have the wireless device inside the TV instead of a separate wireless receiver and related extra remote.  The picture quality is quite good but not quite as sharp as my existing Samsung Flat Screen TVs.  I had to avoid Samsung since it didn't come with the Smart TV feature in a 29 inch TV.  Another "stand out" feature is the sub-woofer and great speakers...what a super sound out of a 29 inch frame!!!  The price is also very low for all the features that you get.  I'd buy it again without any hesitation.....

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Helen R "Helen R"
Reviews.Content: I love this smart tv and have had no problems with it at all. I would recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Great quaility
Reviews.Author: Gary Chatham
Reviews.Content: Great Picture , Easy to use and the Smart part of this Flat Screen takes you to another Level of Electronic Devices.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV with great value
Reviews.Author: EFP
Reviews.Content: This set is my first flat screen and I couldn't be happier with it. The picture is crystal clear with vivid colors. Especially useful is the smart TV features: I'm able to connect instantly to Netflix and Amazon Instant Videos. It's an excellent choice for the money.

Reviews.Title: Best bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: Joshua Rene Gomez
Reviews.Content: Viizo has really improved the quality of their products.  A couple of years ago I would have never bought a Vizio but I couldnt pass it up at the price I got it for and I am truly happy with my descision.  I watch Netflix and play my PS4 on it and the picture/refresh rate is gorgeous.  Another plus is that it is an American company with a 1 year warranty.

Reviews.Title: 3 times and out
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I really tried to like this TV, but finally ran out of patience after experiencing problems with the third set that I received. The problems were either related to poor image stability or no external audio. The picture problem appeared while watching a video that was over an hour long. The picture started to get darker and then lighter.Many thanks to the good folks at Amazon who assisted me with these problems. I cannot say enough good things about their customer service!Finally ended up buying a Samsung 32" TV (without any Internet options), which I purchased from Amazon. It has a solid picture!

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Love the picture, love the "Smart-ness", love the price!  Researched TVs for a while before settling on this one, and glad we did...it's been fantastic.  Having a remote control button for Netflix is particularly helpful, and the Pandora and YouTube/Hulu apps work great too.  Wish it had a browser or just an ESPN3 app and then I'd be completely satisfied.  But overall, you're hard-pressed to beat the functionality, quality, and price this TV offers.

Reviews.Title: Great for the teenager
Reviews.Author: Helena R McMaster
Reviews.Content: This TV was purchased for Christmas for my 12 year old son.  I have to admit I am jealous my husband and I now wish we had one.  The smart TV capabilities make this TV awesome.  The picture is very nice, and the quality of the HD is very good.  I recommend getting a good HDMI cable to show this TV's potential.  The sound is even pretty good, my son uses this TV with his Xbox and you can see the difference in the graphics and the screen size is just right for his age.  Not to big and certainly not to small.  My son loves the smart TV apps, he has already set up his Netflix, Hulu, and my amazon account for streaming TV shows and movies.  The set up was very easy and quick. Setting  up the internet is also very quick and easy.  You cant go wrong with this purchase for the price and the fact its a smart TV its a great deal.  My mother is planning to purchase one for herself this coming year, and my husband and I would like to purchase the 39" for ourselves this coming summer.  Cant wait.

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: ronno "ronno"
Reviews.Content: Works as expected. I have good luck with Vizio products, although they might think about working n the sound quality of all their products.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, terrible stand!
Reviews.Author: NBelks
Reviews.Content: The tv itself is perfect, great picture and decent sound - we use it as a second tv. However, it gets a less than perfect star rating for the terrible design of the stand. It is flimsy and breaks easily. I installed it correctly - which was no easy task with the tiny screws - but it cracked within two weeks. Trying to re-order a replacement stand was next to impossible, with nowhere having that size or type of stand (don't get me started on the best-buy - parts dept that was the only place claiming to have one and shipping me one that was totally different because they wanted my money rather than tell me they didn't have it in stock). Anyway, I ended up having to spend more money on a different type of stand that is mounting as well as standing -- much sturdier. So, that whole stand debacle made the tv price end up being a lot more!

Reviews.Title: 47" Vizio Smart Tv. Great tv, poor shipping conditions
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: After failing to come out of black friday with a new televsision I began an online hunt. After much debating, I took a gamble and went with my gut with this 47" Vizio Smart tv.The first problem was with the shipping. I ordered this through Amazon Prime, the amount of time it took to arrive was great, 2 days just as expected. The problem was upon seeing the box there was a HUGE hole that was larger than the diameter of a baseball bat. My nerves went through the roof with the hole seeming severe. I took the actual tv out of the shipping box and noticed a hole in it. The hole was smaller, maybe the size of a half dollar. Which doesn't make sense when compared to the size of the hole in the shipping box. I removed the tv and was fortunate that the holes were on the backside, and there wasn't a scratch (miraculously) on the backside of the tv even. I am really hesitant to purchase a tv online anymore after this experience.After removing it the set up was simple. The stand screws in easily with 3 screws. The only thing I don't like about the stand is that it doesn't swivel. With a 47" tv you don't need to swivel much so it's not a major concern, but it would be nice to have easier access to the HDMI ports and such. I was amazed that this 47" tv is A LOT lighter than my previous 32" HDTV that was purchased 7 years ago that I was replacing.The onscreen set up was easy. I am still trying to adjust picture settings to get a good picture because it's just not too great for me out of the box. Shouldn't be a big deal to keep tweaking the custom setting. I have Verizon Fios connected through HDMI. I am a big NHL fan so immediately I turned on Center Ice. I notice there is a little lag with the players. Maybe its my eyes just not used to this size of a screen. I'll give it some time to adjust. I wouldn't expect lag with it being (supposedly) 120hz.I checked out some of the apps. I tried Netflix but kept getting errors and couldn't even have a chance to sign in to my account. I tried Hulu and it worked perfectly. I tried netflix again, still nothing. However, after going to bed, waking up today and seeing a firmware update, I tried netflix again and magically it works today!Over all good picture. Not the best thing in the world but definitely not the worst. For the price I am satisfied minus the shipping incident.I would recommend this television. If I can get the picture to a quality I desire I may bump this up to 4 stars. I notice in the corner of the tv it says "1080i" for that setting, this is supposed to be a 1080p tv so if I can figure out how to adjust that setting it may help as well.

Reviews.Title: Is Amazon price the best, beware...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: For the price this is a GREAT TV.  I have it connected to a media center PC and play video from my server quite well.  My only problem is the current price - On 12/6/13 the price with Prime discount is $568.  I purchased on 8/31/13 for $420.  That is a SIGNIFICANT increase, makes me a little less sure that Amazon prices are the best.  Did they think that just because it it Black Friday week that the price is going to be the best and just buy blindly?  The price of these TV's is coming DOWN, not going UP...

Reviews.Title: Buy it if there are any left
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price. Perfect for the bedroom. Crystal clear HD picture. Has just the  right amount of features

Reviews.Title: Watch Netfix or Prime?  This is the tv for you!
Reviews.Author: Teresa James
Reviews.Content: Great picture, great sound.  I purchased this tv quite a few months ago and couldn't be happier.  In my option, Vizio is the best quality for your dollar.  We have 3 Vizio tv's in our home and all of them have been great.  Easy to set up.  About 20 minutes and you are connected to all your favorite internet apps.  My only gripe is that the remote doesn't have a querty keyboard, but seriously not a huge issue.  I would highly recommend this tv.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful HDTV SMART!
Reviews.Author: Rev. Mark Johnson "Rev Mark Johnson"
Reviews.Content: This HDTV is the best ever and it is SMART!  Wow what afind this unit is with great sound and picture and all the apps you can imagine!  Buy this unit and you will like it!

Reviews.Title: enjoyed it
Reviews.Author: Gerard Seitzinger
Reviews.Content: It has everything I wanted. I have another VIZIO TV and enjoy it. That was a 47 inch 3D. both have wifi and I enjoy the apps on it too.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: Chanda J.
Reviews.Content: really good price and it shows very nice as well, it was delivered within good time. sometimes the volume lowers on it own but its ok otherwise

Reviews.Title: Vizio E420iAo 42-Inch 1080Hz Smart Led HDTV
Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV about 4 months ago. It is the best TV I ever bought. I have my Wi Fi  plugged up to it and it's shows a great picture. Netflix shows just as great without my HD box.  I bought two more remotes, but the first one is working just fine. The remotes are cheap in price at Amazon and not like those $150.00 remotes that breaks easy!

Reviews.Title: TV's for Dummy's
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Rohrbacher
Reviews.Content: So easy to use and install even my engineering manager could do it... and he has no idea how to do anything... soo....

Reviews.Title: Vizio E-Series E241i-A1 24-Inch
Reviews.Author: Betty Anne Johnson
Reviews.Content: Nice good looking TV and the price from Amazon under $200.00 was great.  Unfortunately, it looks like you get what you pay for.  I received this TV on 09/24/2013.  As of 11/16/2013, the remote control and panel remotes no longer work.  Only recourse is to pack and ship from Florida to Vizio service center in California at my expense.

Reviews.Title: Great design, great features, great price.
Reviews.Author: James S. Morgan "Jim@HiTek"
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant to buy a Vizio TV after the experience I had with one of their 55" LCD units. The pic was great and all but the software was soooo sucky. It was totally annoying having to reconfigure it whenever you turned it on since it always switched back to the default settings instead of keeping the current. 'Nuff said about it.Some of the dumb things you find with modern TVs these days is a delay after changing channels. You'll get a blue screen for 2-3 seconds (even some older Vizio's do this), followed by the sound a couple seconds later. There is no reason for this, other then bad design. This Vizio did away with that silliness so when you change channels, it's virtually instant. Sound comes along for the ride and it's on instantly too. Even when switching to a pixelated picture it's happy to go there, without the annoyance of jumping back to the previous channel like some TVs and VCR/DVD players do.The picture is great even at wide angles (though you loose some brightness), and although I'll need to have an articulated wall mounting device to allow 25° tilt so I can watch either from my desk, or while lying down on the couch, I'd say that most won't have a problem with the viewing angles.In my small RV, it's a pleasure to have such a wide TV...compared to the old CRT 19" it replaced. The thin screen surround (3/4") is thin enough that it disappears into the background. And at only 22" wide, it fits perfectly over my existing cabinetry without any extensive alterations or interfering with the cabinet doors on either side. Though I will do some cabinet mods at a later date.The WiFi feature was an added bonus at the price paid for this unit, and although it requires a pretty strong, local signal, once it's up and working, it's nice and stable. But if the signal is down to 2-3 bars, it tends to lose it. Then sometimes it doesn't even show the AP it was just connected to as available until you turn off the TV and back on. This is the only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5.The built-in internet software favors commercial sources (the remote has direct keys for Amazon, Netflix, and M-Go, then there are several more commercial or pay-to-use sources, like Hulu, shown at the bottom of the screen when you press the VIA button on the remote) and although I haven't figured out how to just enter a URL yet, I expect I'll be able to. Haven't tried the Cat5 direct connection yet either. One thing they missed is that when entering the passcode, the typical cell phone shows upper case for the first entry and goes to lower case after you enter the first letter. The Vizio starts at lower case so you have to walk down to the control to set it up for upper. A minor annoyance as I find most passcodes start with uppercase. Strangely, when you need to enter a password into say, Netflix, the on-screen keyboard DOES work like a phone. Showing upper case first, then auto-switching to lower case after the first entry.The input sources available are more then just adequate, though I would have liked to connect via S-Video (no connector for that). Instead, I hooked up my computer and my VCR/DVD recorder/player via both HDMI and AV and the TV worked flawlessly. Push the remotes 'Input' button and a scrollable window pops up without blacking out the current picture...I like that. I also like that the picture scrunches up on the right side when you press menu, which shows up in a nicely readable box on the left taking up 1/3 of the screen. Navigation with the remote is fairly easy tho some keys could be larger, like the 'Mute' button. And the default settings for color, brightness and the like are perfect for me.Even the sound is better then expected. I will be going to a sound bar soon for improved dynamic range, but this TV is pretty good as it stands. Especially if it's sitting on a hard surface to reflect some of the sound from the front firing speakers and the passive rear grill openings.As a full time RV'er, it was a pleasure to find a TV like this that has such an easy to use 'Available Channel' scanning system. Many are so slow or have user unfriendly multiple pages as to be annoying. This Vizio is easy to use but as far as scanning speed goes it is about average, taking 5:45 to find 29 digital OTA channels. I am in a fringe area so that may have added some time to the scan. Haven't tried it on cable yet and I'm hoping for a faster scan with that typically stronger signal.For the price, feature set, and the quality, you would be hard pressed to find something that would beat the Vizio E241i-A1. For RV'ers who don't want to do extensive remodeling of their cabinetry, it's darn near perfect.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: K. Cashman "xboxer"
Reviews.Content: Love this TV.  I bought it becasue it was Internet ready.  It's such a pleasure to have something work like it's supposed and not break the bank.

Reviews.Title: Love the TV.
Reviews.Author: mac2monster
Reviews.Content: This TV is awesome. Fast internet, big screen, bright and crisp! It is a little slow to start up (about 5 seconds maybe) but well worth it.Buy a cable with it if you don't have a Cable/satellite appointment to hook it up (Usually they provide a cable for free)

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Charles Devin Daulton
Reviews.Content: This was my first LED TV I bought it a a 29" at the same time.  So far I'm very pleased with both of them.

Reviews.Title: bought a used tv from this seller
Reviews.Author: bryan
Reviews.Content: It was a lot better than expected no marks on the screen and a very very minor fingerprint mark less then a fingernails length cant even notice it.  the screen was perfect to say the least although a bit slow, but then fast in the end.  It made no sense but fast in the end.  Overall im very happy with the product and having a television that has everything intergrated makes life so much easier.  the picture is perfect but it did not come with a manual.  I figured out 95 percent of the tv within 10 mins anyways.  I thank them for having a product like this in my price range.  Well worth the wait! Im going back to watching tv, take care.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: Guy Davies
Reviews.Content: Does great so far!! Every thing I thought it would be!!! Nice picture quality and the sound is great and adjustable!!!

Reviews.Title: Vizio E-Series 24 inch 1080 LED Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Linda Eaton
Reviews.Content: This is my third Vizio TV.  I have a 70 inch, 42 inch and this 24 inch that I keep in the kitchen.  Really good quality clear picture.  Ours are set up with Netfix.  So Great.  The price from this seller was the best price out there.  Well worth the purchase.  I would buy from this seller again.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 39" TV
Reviews.Author: Jonathan E. Lepoff
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture quality, although it requires adjustments to achieve it and it was very easy to set up. I am happy with it

Reviews.Title: VERY happy with this TV
Reviews.Author: Terra R
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with the sound quality and picture on our new VIZIO E390i-A1 TV and would recommend it to others. This is our second VIZIO and we would buy from them again.

Reviews.Title: Not just a TV
Reviews.Author: Texasdan
Reviews.Content: Just got my new Vizio 42" TV and WOW the picture is great and if I'd known what it could do I would not have waited.Hooked it up to the internet via my router and instantly started watching Amazon prime videos.I like to listen to music while I cook but in the area i live in you cant get a good radio station so I tried the free app that came on the TV called Pandora internet radio and created my own stations and now all my favorite music is streaming on my TV loud ,clear and free,I love it. Many more apps I have not tried yet,cant wait to see all the things they will do.Also arrived on time and in prefect condition so dont be affraid to get it shipped to you.

Reviews.Title: Too slow to be Smart
Reviews.Author: Marcello De Feo
Reviews.Content: The possibility certainly exists that there is a flaw specific to the television that I received -- and I would like to hear from others who own this TV to get their feedback too -- but the Wi-Fi on this television is terrible, which renders most of the apps useless. You want to get a weather update? Awesome. You want to watch something on Netflix? Good luck with that.The picture on the TV is very good on the whole but I bought this specifically because it was "Smart" and did not intend to get a cable box or streaming device. If this is a product-wide flaw, though, I would recommend that you save some money and get the next model down without Smart capabilities and buy a Roku or Apple TV, unless you are capable of directly hooking up the ethernet connection.

Reviews.Title: It stopped working right when it was too late to return it.
Reviews.Author: Carolyn M. Rondthaler "artist"
Reviews.Content: I had this tv less than two months when it stopped working.  A guy who came to look at it said the tuner was broken.  I can use it in my art studio now for streaming reception, but that is all.  Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Good price for 39 inch smart TV
Reviews.Author: Missy jost
Reviews.Content: Paid under $400 on Amazon. It was the best price I found anywhere at the time, also bought the square trade 4year plan at a discount. I have a 50 inch LG plasma, a 32 inch samsung, and others. I was expecting a lot from reading all the reviews, but was a little disappointed when I hooked it up. The colors didn't seem to in tune with what I was expecting, it also seemed to have ghosting problems when on sports channels. At night there seems to be a bit of a backlight problem. I decided to give it a week of trial. After manually tuning in the color for a week I started to like it. It has the nice smart TV features which included Netflix and Amazon apps. I would recommend it for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Mike Mazzante
Reviews.Content: I'm no HDTV guru or anything but I do believe that this TV has a crisp, clear and colorful picture. Oh, and it's awesome because you can access Netflix, etc. from the remote! (See, I'm not electronically technologically up-to-date.)

Reviews.Title: Display quality is good, App quality is poor
Reviews.Author: Craig Yarnold
Reviews.Content: The apps are slow to launch, and the Amazon Prime app ABSOLUTELY STINKS! Also, the TV has randomly rebooted a couple of times, may be related to the Netflix app? Now that I know that smart TVs are notorious for having crummy apps, I would re-consider my purchase next time, and instead purchase a "dumb" TV + Roku, which actually works well.

Reviews.Title: Great so far and it is my second one
Reviews.Author: J. Gerving "JAG"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased the smaller 39" and now the 47". Connectivity is amazing and quick, just a little fumpling with the multifunction key pad but no big deal.Netflix works seamlessly, Amazon prime is great, Vudu, Hulu and all in one package. I shopped around a little bit but with my prime membership and the discount no one beat the price and it was delivered to my door!I dont pay for Cable but use the free channels and this things goes right through the auto set-up and then you can easily delete the channels you dont want. So saving the 100-200.00 a month for cable and using netflix, amozon, hulu, and vudu you just cant beat it. Along with all of that the sound out of this TV is really amazing for its size and price. i am a sound and loud movie nut, this does ok for what i do with it and would more than likely please 99% of the people who would buy it.So all i can say is if you need and or are looking for a SMART TV but this TV no matter what size it is!

Reviews.Title: Good buy. Great price.
Reviews.Author: Thedivamd
Reviews.Content: Good picture. Connects easily to wifi. Sound not so great which is why I gave 4 instead of 5 stars. I'm not very technically savvy and I got this hooked up and in use very quickly. Looking at buying one for my daughter's room instead of cable connection there. Very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Brenda Debouse "Brneda  Waters-DeBouse"
Reviews.Content: Excellent  picture quality, vivid. color. Received it sooner than expected. I love all of the features available on my new "Smart" TV.  You can't beat the price.  I'm in heaven!!!

Reviews.Title: it is smart
Reviews.Author: MC - Texas
Reviews.Content: Love it!  Easy to set up and install.  Internet is great, my Amazon Prime is easy.  Have not played any video games as of yet.  The picture is not the greatest I've ever seen, but is still good.  Side view you can still see the show.

Reviews.Title: NO CLOSED CAPTIONS
Reviews.Author: betty boop
Reviews.Content: IT IS NOT CAPABLE OF CLOSED CAPTIOING WHEN STREAMING SHOWS . THIS WAS A LITTLE DISSAPOINTING BECAUSE I USE PRIME FOR TV I MISSED.

Reviews.Title: Great Smart HDTV at very reasonable price and easy setup
Reviews.Author: Artsy
Reviews.Content: I searched Amazon reviews and was aware that Samsung was considered number 1.... But after many reviews that I read on settled on the Vizio and I'am glad I did. It's excellent and I think rivals Samsung . Easy setup and the best thing is up front on quick start is 800 number for tech support and it's not in India I can easily understand everything... Best ever decision... Plus it has quick button right on remote to Netflix, etc.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: R. Herrera "rherrera"
Reviews.Content: Love it.  Apps works great.  Only drawback is remote is not lighted.  still have recommended this to friends.  Worth the money.  Great Amazon service as usual.

Reviews.Title: Bought Used and it works great!
Reviews.Author: Markiv
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV after some heavy deliberation.  I did not want to spend too much on a TV, but I wanted something that will last and hoped to get a smart TV so I don't need to buy chromecast or anything else.  I needed a TV mainly for cable, netflix, and hulu plus.I really liked the reviews and specs on this TV, so I took a chance and bought it used, and it turned out to be a great decision!The Netflix and Hulu apps work well (though typing can be a pain sometimes) and the youtube app pairs with your phone or computer, so all the smart features work fine.The television quality is great when you use the apps, but i do wish it was a bit crisper, but then again, it is 720p.Overall, I'm quite happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Good t.v. for the price
Reviews.Author: Jesus R.
Reviews.Content: Considering this was 485 with shipping it was a great deal BUT i was disappointed to see the 42 inch modelat the same price at a brand store 50 dollars cheaper considering i paid shipping, so not very happy about that... (rhymes with warget).The television it self looks amazing the wifi isn't so great i tried youtube and netflix. Netflix worked great but youtube would buffer constantly even though i had full wifi bars and have a 30Mb/s speed. Might have been a youtube issue.

Reviews.Title: A great TV so far
Reviews.Author: Blake R. Rosengren "Blakesterguy"
Reviews.Content: What can I say? It is a really great TV for an awesome price. Pick one up for yourself today.

Reviews.Title: Its our 3rd Vizio.
Reviews.Author: Mike Vanner
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with there TVs and more so there customer service. This is the 3rd Vizio we purchased in the last couple years as replace the old dinosaurs one by one. Will be getting another soon.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: Bryon Bean "Rock n Rolla"
Reviews.Content: What can I say, I love this television. The HD picture is great, the setup was easy, and it would be hard to express the titillation that I felt when I discovered that there was an Amazon.com button on the remote. Seriously? Yes Seriously. It's like having movie rental store at the tip of your fingertips; I can watch whatever I want, whenever I want. The other app that I find absolutely incredible is the YouTube app. It allows you to select YouTube videos from your computer so you don't have to go through the painful process of trying to find movies with a remote. You can also watch, without interruption, the videos on your watch list. This is 50" of pure television bliss. I'm very impressed.

Reviews.Title: Needed a new television - this one is great!
Reviews.Author: Laura Grimmer
Reviews.Content: I truly like that this television allows for internet access, too.  It makes it more than just a television - it makes it a true entertainment center.  I also got it at a really good price!

Reviews.Title: Truly a SMART tv
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "jjfenton"
Reviews.Content: I am somewhat of an early adopter. I got a Roku a couple of years ago and loved being able to connect to Netflix from my tv. Then, I got a BlueRay with internet and was able to add Youtube to the mix. Score. We needed to replace our tv in our bedroom and went with the Vizio E320i-AO and love it. The quality is wonderful. What I really enjoy is being able to launch my smart apps within the active tv window instead of having to turn on a different device. It is all there and I can browse while my tv show is playing. This is great for checking the weather, stocks, news, etc...Overall here are my list of pros/consPros:Nice interfaceEasy to set upClean designCan switch viewing modes (panoramic, wide screen) very easilySleep timer - intuitive (good for bedroom)Ports placement is decentLightweightEasy to see from many anglesCons:Wish the remote was back litBody cheaper plastic

Reviews.Title: Great 32" Television
Reviews.Author: Rinaldi
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small television for my sunroom and this one fit the bill. Generally speaking not anything special as far as picture or sound. The feature I like the most is the apps available, specifically amazon prime and youtube. Lightweight and small border are a bonus as well.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Diane L. Fisher
Reviews.Content: I haven't had a new TV since 1985 and imagine my amazement at this new technology with the Vizio.  Not to mention the clarity and size of the picture.  Love it!

Reviews.Title: Great TV but font on apps a little small
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: This was a great TV for the price. The picture quality is great and set up was a breeze.I love everything about it except for the fonts on the apps. It is hard to read from not too far away. I also don't like the way the Amazon prime app functions but that is not Vizios fault. I have a Roku hooked up on my other TV and the interface there is much better. You are about to view your watch list and it is much easier to find content.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Vincent Hotz
Reviews.Content: Really enjoying this smart TV. I got a good deal at $397 and I would have happily paid another $100 for it. Great picture after adjusting settings. Great apps. Easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Very good TV.
Reviews.Author: Thomas A. Riggs
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews of the various TVs in this size range, I picked this one.  I am very glad so far that I did.  There was a minor issue the first couple of days in which I would get a No Signal message and the screen would go blank for maybe 3 seconds.  It would do this at random.  The second I sent an email to Vizio about the issue.  Got a response in just about an hour.  Their recommendation was to unplug plug everything, all the connection cables and the power cable.  Then press and hold the on off button for about thirty seconds, before reconnecting everything.  That did the trick, the problem has not recurred since the fix was done. I like the style, and though the remote is small and does not have a qwerty keyboard ( a minor annoyance) it i does work well and is reasonably easy to navigate through the menus.The colors are vibrant and after going through all the settings and then making my own custom settings, I am quite pleased with the picture quality. I do not use the TVs speakers since I connect it directly to the home theater sound system so I cannot really comment on that feature, though I have never really heard any TV speakers that sound all that good, especially when compared to a good sound system. I read a few comments about the stand that comes with the system.  Some said they did not think it was not a secure as it might be.  I find the stand to be more than sufficient to handle the set with no problem.I was a little leery of the Vizio brand since I had heard of it but had never really know anyone who owned one, but I decided for the price and features that I would take the chance and I am very pleased with the TV and the support from Vizio. Great TV - Great price and so far great support. I t was delivered on time, and it well packed and the packaging was Eco friendly for the most part. Rather than using styrofoam peanuts they used cardboard chips.  There is styrofoam they use for packing but not as much as some set sets that I have seen. I don't think you can wrong with this set.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!!!
Reviews.Author: matt wilkerson
