Reviews.Content: I purchased this visio for my bedroom, it was working fine and everything, but the stand is plastic and does not work well. After using it for almost 3 weeks, the tv just randomly fell off the stand. The screen then became black on one side. i contacted visio because you have a one year warranty with them and they're sending a replacement. Great TV, great apps. Netflix is awesome! but 4 stars because stand is cheap plastic that has nothing to connect to, it just sits on top of the stand

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I needed
Reviews.Author: Saida
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV couple weeks ago, it arrive within 2 days as expected, it was very easy to hook up. Easy directions. I didn't have Youtube feature on there first 12 hours, called customer service they were very helpful and told me it would update slowly the longer it was connected to the internet, As soon as I got of the phone Youtube was on as well as all other apps. The sound is absolutely perfect I thought I would need the sound bar, but I was very happy with the audio. The remote could be a little bit more advanced, but I can't complain it's easy for the kids to use. I would recommend this TV

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: TJH "TJH"
Reviews.Content: Great picture, good sound, easy to set up.  The only issue that I have with this TV is that when you first turn on the power, it seems to take about 20 seconds to come to life.  This seems slow, but you get used to it very quickly.  If I needed another TV, I would buy another one of these.

Reviews.Title: Hveto diagree with oter reviewers
Reviews.Author: Sean "Sean"
Reviews.Content: I just go this TV and I too had trouble setting it up. I called the support number in th quick setup guide and was able to set it up and achieve the picture I expected. Love the internet WiFI feature. The alphabet input is annoying I agree but not impossible to negotiate...having the usb connect certainly is a way to improve it. For the price - $499 @ Costco w/ 2 yr warranty and $29 to add 3 more years w/ ability to exchange for replacement is a good deal for the product. Most Smart TVs are running 800 to over 1000. I'll update if things change.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E320i-A0 32-inch
Reviews.Author: Lori
Reviews.Content: This TV is really cool!! i've owned it for about a month now and havnt had any issues.the wi-fi lagged a bit but, i'm sure it's not the TV and more so my router trying to handle too much going on in my household with my son's gaming, the wireless computer going and streaming movies on the TV so, i bought a cable and clipped in direct to the router..perfection.the picture on this Vizio is beautiful, clear and colorful, the sound is decent/clear no issues there.i love that the internet apps are built right in...one click on the remote and you can get to many, many dif. apps. too many to list.my only issue is the remote control. it's small and hard to read but, i've got the feel of it enough now...you know that you goes. ' gets to the point where you dont have to look at the remote to know what button to press...the set up out of the box was a snap..had it out of the box and turned on in under 15 min.anyway, i love the TV and would buy again and recommend without hesitation

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Caleb
Reviews.Content: This tv is amazing!  The quality of the picture is fantastic and although people complain about the remote... I like the simplistic design of it.  The sound also quite nice giving the low price of this tv.  When browsing through internet apps it is sometimes a little slow to respond but I would assume it only has a processor that is required, not comparable to a computer or gaming system.  The set up for this device was very easy, 7 screws and you are up and running.  Also, with the thin edge, it actually makes the screen size a little larger.  There are four hdmi inputs on the side and a composite towards the bottom of the tv.  In my opinion, this is a good layout because of how few devices use composite cables anymore.The only issue I have had is my device is taking some time for the firmware to update.  If you have issues with netflix (shows not playing) check your firmware version at the help menu and system settings.  I think the most current is 3.x, but when mine arrived it was only on 2.35.x.  As long as this automatic firmware update works correctly, I am more than happy with this tv.  And if it doesn't, vizio's support plus amazon's return policy... Still a good purchase.Oh, and shipping on this item was excellent.  I know some people are concerned buying electronics online because they may be tossed around or the box looks rough... That is not the case at all with amazon.  Mine was shipped in less than 24 hours (paid 8.99 for Saturday shipping) with a box in perfect condition by FedEx.

Reviews.Title: Very Impressed
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this TV. It is very easy to set up, great picture, and the sound is very loud.

Reviews.Title: Downstairs TV replacement used for sports and some movies
Reviews.Author: Ralph M Hawk
Reviews.Content: After getting a professional install of entire entertainment system the tv WORKS FINE - except: I know it is high def., however the screen is a little to bright - football fields look almost like being covered with a light snow.I haven't had a chance yet to determine if there is an adjustment. WE use DirecTV for viewing and this TV is much less natural in color than our other two (one being a 46" Panasonic).Otherwise it performs well, especially using our SOUND system ( TV s is to high pitched).

Reviews.Title: Very slow to turn on
Reviews.Author: jerry kohnen
Reviews.Content: This model is very slow to turn on. It takes aprox. 20 Seconds to get a picture from the time you turn it on, this seems a bit long. One of the sets will loose sound, and you have to turn off TV and back on to get the sound back. Not sure what the problem is with that. Unit does have a nice picture.

Reviews.Title: This TV is GREAT!!!!! LOVE IT!!!!
Reviews.Author: Jenice R.
Reviews.Content: I just got this TV on the 29th of November it's a great TV the picture and sound its great quality love it..... I can watch Hulu and Netflix on it Great TV Great Price......  I would recomend it to anyone.  My husband and I are enjoying it. :-)

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Mister S.
Reviews.Content: This is a must have TV if you want to watch Netflix or some other on-line service without having to connect some other device to you TV. Picture, sound, apps, are all awesome!Down with Sony!!!!

Reviews.Title: Vizio Envy
Reviews.Author: SS
Reviews.Content: I am the envy of all my friends with this new TV.  Two have ordered their own since coming over to see mine.

Reviews.Title: TV remote, and physical buttons on the TV itself, do not work.
Reviews.Author: Chris S.
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV from Amazon because of the low input lag (I had planned to use it for gaming).  The picture and sound were fine, as was the lag.  I was happy with the TV.But then, after a long gaming session, I tried to adjust the volume.  That's when I discovered that there is an intermittent issue, with a high occurrence rate, in which absolutely no TV settings can be adjusted (this includes volume, power, menu access - literally everything).  The picture and sound will still work when this is happening, but the TV will not respond to ANY input from the user, whether it comes from the remote or the physical buttons on the TV.  I'm not talking about gaming here, just to clarify - I'm talking about the TV settings.  You seriously can't even turn the set off unless you physically unplug it.I contacted Amazon's tech support (you get it free for 30 days with this set) and, after an exhaustive call, the representative agreed that there was a hardware issue with the TV.  She told me what my options were at that point, and I decided to get a replacement set after she assured me that the rest of the TVs in stock had been tested and that this wouldn't be a problem with the replacement set.Well, I set up the replacement set today and it does the exact same thing.  To top it all off, both the original set AND the replacement set arrived after my "guaranteed" delivery date (which was not Amazon's fault - it was the courier's - but it is still frustrating).I called customer service about the new one and I am getting a refund.  I'm still a bit upset that I was assured that the new TV wouldn't have this problem (by an Amazon representative), but it did.This whole order has turned into a 3-week long ordeal, and I certainly haven't been compensated for the amount of time I've had to invest in it (setting up the TVs, re-packing them, taking them back to the UPS facility, etc.).  I was given a $30 promotional certificate, which was a nice gesture, but I don't think it makes up for the hassle of having to return two faulty TVs.I would recommend that people stay away from this TV.  There is a very high chance that your set won't function properly, and you'll be rewarded with headaches, headaches, and more headaches.

Reviews.Title: vizio 39 inch tv
Reviews.Author: Bonnie
Reviews.Content: great picture. just what I wanted. take your time to get get the picture the way you want it. took many days to get everything set. good value for price

Reviews.Title: LOVE MY NEW VIZIO
Reviews.Author: Maureen Brokaw
Reviews.Content: I BOUGHT A VIZIO AFTER DOING A LOT OF RESEARCH ON OTHER BRANDS.IT HAD ALL THE OPTIONS I WANTED AT A VERY GOOD PRICE COMPARED TO A LOT OF OTHER BRANDS.AFTER SETTING IT UP,I WAS VERY PLEASED WITH MY NEW VIZIO AND WOULD RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected of best rated J D Powers award tv.
Reviews.Author: walloon
Reviews.Content: The color was washed out and the backgound was grayish. Motion blur and background was wavy like a heat wave. I called Vizio and they were very helpful in tweeking the color to vivid but it still had blur. Amazon tech helped also but in the end both my husband and I remained too disappointed to keep the tv and returned it. Amazon was very helpful and I am ordering a replacement Samsung tv.Pro: Easy to set up, solid base, nice looking slim line. Amazon very helpful in trying to get better color and ease of return. Made in USA.Con: Washed out color, generally grayish tint. Took long to start. I couldn't get rid of motion blur and wavy background.

Reviews.Title: Overall Acceptable
Reviews.Author: AH
Reviews.Content: I give this rating 3 stars mostly due to the price (I paid just under $800).  I upgraded to this from a plasma 42" and, to be honest, I don't notice a difference.  I do notice a reduction in sound quality; on certain programs it's even scratchy and makes a noise akin to nails on a chalkboard (though to be fair, I did read this before buying and was prepared to purchase an additional sound bar, but after actually getting it, I have decided that $800 shouldn't require anything additional).  I don't hate it, and I haven't been so dissatisfied that I have returned it.  But I must say, if I had bought it from Best Buy or a brick-and-mortar local store that would have made the return less of a hassle, I would have.  Especially since about 2 weeks after my purchase, I saw several sales for even better televisions for as much or even less than what I paid (e.g. 60" or same size but with 3D).  For comparable televisions not on sale, this is a good buy.  But if you're interested in getting the most bang for your buck and can afford to hold out for a sale (and right now is sale time), then you can certainly find better for less.

Reviews.Title: Great deal (steal)
Reviews.Author: Melina
Reviews.Content: This TV is one great TV. I can't believe how many features came with this TV at this price point. This is by far the least expensive LED TV with apps. The only this I didn't like was that it didn't come with the keyboard remote because it gets annoying when setting up or doing a search for a movie on Netflix to use the directional pad to pick each letter on the screen. I've only had it for two days so I'll try and update a little while longer down the road, but so far I think it's great and worth probably 200 more.Update 4/12/13I've had this product now for about 1/2 a year and it is so nice. We are even thinking about cutting off our cable because we most of the time just use the Netflix and Amazon apps. Heck, my wife even does workout videos through the Youtube app. It is so much better than using something like a Roku or PS3 to use apps. We've had pretty much zero problems, but there was one time it froze on the Netflix app, but I think I attribute it to Netflix server being down. I just did a hard restart and everything was back to normal. This is definitely a TV that is so worth the price and way more. 100% glad I purchased.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV GREAT PRICE
Reviews.Author: murenovich
Reviews.Content: Awesome Features and Awesome Picture Quality. The Apps are great and easy to use and setup and the Initial Setup for the TV was a Breeze. Great Tv I would Recommend this TV to anyone looking for an entry level Smart LED TV

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Alan Outhouse
Reviews.Content: The first unit came much earlier than expected, but was damaged in shipping.  This would have been very discouraging except for the exceptional ease of the Amazon exchange policy.  The second unit arrived very quickly and has been working wonderfully.  It took a bit of a learning curve to operate it, no much in the form of instructions.  But if I can figure it out, anyone can do it.  Beatiful picture, great internet compatibility.  Fair price for a good quality product.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E-Series E241i-A1 24-inch 1080p 60 Hz LED Smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: Tool User
Reviews.Content: This is the second Vizio tv that we have purchased. We bought this one to replace a small and older tv in our kitchen. Since we are planning to cut the cord from Directv, we wanted a tv with apps (Netflix, Hulu Plus and Amazon, etc). Due to the space in the kitchen, the largest tv that would fit was this 24 inch.  As far as I can tell, Vizio is the only 24 inch TV that is 1080p with apps, all for under $200. Other brands of 24 inch tvs would not fit due to the stands.  Vizio's stand is different letting the tv base sits flush on the surface.  The picture quality is superb and that is watching an over-the-air (OTA) station from an outdoor antenna. Since OTA signals are not compressed, the picture is far better than the Directv picture.  I have this tv hard wired to the internet and the apps work fine. I have not tested the wifi, but, based on my other Vizio, I am confident that it works fine.  The other Vizio wifi works better than my large Samsung wifi. Also, I find it easier to navigate the apps on a Vizio, compared to the Samsung.  I like Vizio.  I think they make a great product at a great price.  Excellent value

Reviews.Title: Great for me.
Reviews.Author: People Paula
Reviews.Content: I'm not the pickiest person as far as clarity and whatnot. I'm just a normal person who wanted a huge, fancyish TV, and that's what I got! My guy friends seem amazed by it, so I guess that's proof that it's at least pretty good. It's solid, with good color and not a lot of reflection from light across the room. As a non-expert, I totally recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Bad audio
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: Audio sounds tinny; you will need to add a sound bar.  Also, after about 30 minutes on one channel the audio lags a full second behind the video; you have to wire the sound directly from the cable box to the sound bar to remedy this.

Reviews.Title: Loving my Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Ghettobomb
Reviews.Content: It took a little extra time to be shipped but considering; it was after the mad online rush for black friday and cyber monday it shipped relatively quickly.Likes* Netflix app works great* Youtube app preloaded* A very sleek and sexy design* Great veiwing anglesDon't Like*Amazon video only works if your in the USA*Did not receive the stand that connects the TV to the base*The on-screen keyboard is very tedious

Reviews.Title: Best Value in TVs Today
Reviews.Author: Jerry Palmerino Jr
Reviews.Content: This is my first Vizio.  I replaced a Samsung DLP and Onkyo a/v receiver with this tv. I must say, this is the best value for my money and everything I hoped for (with the exception of a few minor issues).The combination of my Samsung and Onkyo setup was using 800 watts of electricity to run at all times, so this tv was a cost effective replacement at only 62 watts.  Plus, my onkyo receiver was flaking out, losing the HDMI signals multiple times during a show, buzzing through the speakers, and causing "sparklies", so it was time to junk it.Pros:The picture is awesome.  My Samsung was a 720p DLP.  This is a 1080p LED.  My wife immediately noticed the difference when I was playing 1080p content.  She mentioned several times to me how beautiful the picture is.  I sensed she was skeptical when I bought it because I don't think she has ever heard of Vizio before.  I had though, so it wasn't a concern for me.The sound is pretty good. I noticed when I watched Jurassic Park on this tv though that it lacks bass (during the title sequence with the loud booms).  When I had my Samsung, I had the video and audio running through an Onkyo receiver.  The sound coming through the 7.1 speakers clearly blew away anything out of the tiny speakers in this tv (which I presume are larger than some thinner tvs).Because this tv had 4 HDMIs (4!), I could hook up all of my devices without needing an a/v receiver.  I sure do miss the bass though, but I'm in a town-home.  My neighbors probably have no complaints now.Built-it Netflix and Amazon (to name just two) saves me from having to run my 2nd generation "fat" PS3 (another 300 watts).In about a month of using this tv, I have saved 200 kilowatt hours and some money too on my electricity.Cons:The remote is terrible.  It is nice to have built-in buttons for Netflix and Amazon, but this remote requires you to press hard to get a response.  Sometimes, you don't even know if the press registered. I replaced it with a programmable Logitech Harmony. This tv also requires you to point your remote directly at the sensor on the lower left corner of the bezel, or nothing happens.The Internet apps, including Netflix are slow to load and buggy.  I have had to unplug the tv once already (in about a month's total usage) because it froze while watching Netflix and I could not get the tv to respond.  The Netflix app also has an aspect ratio issue, meaning that, if a movie has letter boxing, sometimes the letter boxing gets smaller and larger multiple times during a movie. This results in an effect where it looks like the movie jumps (as it then occupies more screen area and then suddenly less when it jumps back).  The changes are uniform, in that if the screen size changes 1/4 inch at the top and bottom, it then changes back by the same amount (of course I'm eyeballing this measurement).  This does not happen when I watch the same movie on Netflix using my PS3.Why is there no Picture-in-Picture?Overall, I am happy enough with this tv for the amount I spent for it.  It would have been twice as much or more for a similar model from the bigger tv manufacturers.  I can live with and work around its flaws.  Maybe a software update will fix the issues I mentioned.

Reviews.Title: wireless is useless
Reviews.Author: Paul Di Sciullo
Reviews.Content: this product has an extremely cheap wireless adaptor in it. If the tv is more than 10 feet from the router the download speed drops off significantly making it impossible to stream hd. Do not even attampt a wireless g connection. I have a wireless n/ac router which is the latest and get below 4 meg download when the tv is about 15 feet away from router. For ideal streaming you either need to be hardwired or wireless within 5 feet of router. You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: Incredible functionality for the price
Reviews.Author: O
Reviews.Content: I use the 32inch version for watching Netflix while running on the treadmill.  Previous reviews of earlier VIZIO models complained that Netflix was slow to load and navigate.  This version does not suffer from this issue.  I found it more responsive than my (4-year old) ROKU box.Set-up was a breeze; connected to the Internet, pressed the Netflix button on the remote control, put in email and password, and there was my instant queue.  The remote does have small buttons, but I have not found this to be an issue; on the contrary, everything is in easy thumb reach.  Mounting was made easier due to its very lightweight.Picture quality for casual viewing is very good.  Blacks and colors are all where they should be.  Most important is that there are no annoying artifacts to distract viewing.My only beef with the TV is that the sound is not great.  Although I expect it is not worse than other TV's in its class.  Making the TV's look slicker from the front and slimmer from the side is the opposite of what you want to do for good sound.  It is OK for casual viewing, but not for serious movie watching.

Reviews.Title: Can't be beat at this price
Reviews.Author: patrick220
Reviews.Content: 1. Excellent picture2. Good sound from 2x10 watt speakers3.Decent apps4.Good looking tv with thin bezel5.No regrets6.Would buy again7.Go for it

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: jcalbi
Reviews.Content: The last of our old analog TV's finally bought the farm. I wanted to move our HP 32" flat screen out of the master BR and into the playroom. Found this on the Vizio website and immediately went to Amazon when it came out for sale. Our space was limited on the wall but this 39" TV fit in the same space as the old 32" which was a big win for me. Picture is excellent and sound is adequate for a bedroom. This is our second Vizio TV and we are more than satisfied with their quality.  Haven't really delved into the 'smart' aspect yet but that will come with time.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, very disappointing sound
Reviews.Author: Incident51
Reviews.Content: I bought the Vizio E-series E241i-A1 24 inch 1040p LED Smart HTDV.  I see in the other reviews that different size screens are mixed into the same collection.  My comments may only apply to smaller sizes, I don't know. But here goes...Arrived quickly, reasonably well packed, no damage.  Set up very easily.  Great picture (cable TV).  Also found my WiFi and confirmed so far that Netflix comes thru.  Comprehensive user's manual internally loaded and accessible via the remote, very nice!  Decent user interface for all these special functions.But, oh my, what poor sound.  Soup cans and a string poor.  Many controls available - bass/treble, graphic equalizer with presets like Rock, Classical, Jazz, etc.  Surround / standard choices.  Automatic volume leveling option so commercials don't blare.  These controls are all available, I worked thru them all. No joy.  They make the sound different, but they don't make it any better.Oddly, when I listen from the back of the device it sounds better than the front.  Maybe if I had an acoustically tuned bookshelf for it to resonate into it would help a little.  Not going to work on our kitchen peninsula against a tiled backsplash, though.  I see many similar negative reviews for this and other 24 inch brands (geez, now I notice them!).  Seems like this whole generation of device really wants to play thru a separate sound system or "pedestal soundbar."  Not kitchen friendly.

Reviews.Title: Huge Disappointment
Reviews.Author: MattyBoy717
Reviews.Content: I had such high hopes for this TV especially after reading the glowing reviews by so many consumers. But I gotta tell ya, Vizio can't hold a candle to LG or Samsung. The picture is dull and lifeless. Stand ever so slightly to the side and the picture turns gray and grainy. The audio is very bassy and you have to turn the volume way up to hear anything. The apps are sparse. No Amazon cloud, no HBO Go. They have iHeart radio but it doesn't work. Vudu works, but the picture comes off dark and gloomy. I don't blame Vudu because Vudu on my LG is brilliant. I blame Vizio. People, stay away from this TV. Stay far away.

Reviews.Title: Power Problems
Reviews.Author: Travis Smigiel
Reviews.Content: TV turned itself off and would not turn back on for several minutes.I called Vizio and did a reset but the problem persisted soon after.I ended up returning it.

Reviews.Title: DMI
Reviews.Author: susie
Reviews.Content: I am amazed as I learn the features of my smart television. I'm a weather freak and this feature satisfies my anxiety.

Reviews.Title: Quit Looking - Buy this TV !!!
Reviews.Author: Mikey
Reviews.Content: Bought this at Christmas for long-overdue entertainment center upgrade (on a budget), and have been very pleased with it.Lots of bang for the buck....good picture quality and contrast (amazing specs vs non-LED backlit sets), nice big 50" size (couldn't afford the 60", but the 50" is such an improvement from what we used to have, no regrets), ok sound quality (better than I was expecting for flat panel TV) but we are augmenting with a ZVox 555 pedestal sound box so not important regardless.  Built-in WiFi and "smart" stuff are nice extras.Took one star off for the Remote Control....its ok, but Vizio packages this TV with their cheap (non-QWERTY) remote.Do yourself a favor and buy the "Vizio XRT302 Qwerty keyboard Remote".  It works great with this set, and I was able to order a new one online for about $16.50 including free shipping.  Vizio should have included this one with the set.  grrrrRegarding the "smart" stuff (Vizio Internet Apps): I haven't played with other smart TV implementations, but the apps on this set seem slow to load and clunky.  For a set at this price point, I wasn't expecting much, so am not disappointed.  The split panel approach is nice: you can be inputting stuff on the left 1/3 vertical UI panel while watching content on the right 2/3 panel.  Forget using most of the app stuff (except Netflix maybe?) without a QWERTY remote though for anything other casual playing around.Since we already have an iPad2, we ended up buying an AppleTV, so with wireless AirPlay mirroring of the iPad display to the TV set through the AppleTV box, the iPad is acting as our "smart" (more like brilliant) capability.  The Netflix app on the AppleTV (or Roku) is a better implementation than what comes bundled with the TV or our Sony BluRay player. And with the iPad setup, we get what is really useful:  a web browser!!!!  Note that most iPad apps will not utilize the full screen of any TV (think 4:3 aspect ratio picture on 16:9 TV set) -- the app needs to be written to support "full screen mode".  The built-in Safari web browser on the iPad only shows up in non-full screen format, but we found a really good alternative called "Perfect Web Browser" that does, and one of the really cool things about it is that while you are watching a youtube video through the TV (in full screen glory) from one "tab" of the browser on the iPad, you can flip to another browser "tab" on the iPad (visible just the on iPad screen) to do other surfing.Back on the TV, we showed off the TV to a home theater enthusiast friend, and he was satisfied with what he saw, but commented on how the colors seemed a little muted or washed out.  I haven't played with any of the picture or color settings yet, but that's on my (low-priority) to-do list based on his comments and some other feedback recommendations I have seen online for this set.

Reviews.Title: It is OK
Reviews.Author: Lori Tina
Reviews.Content: When got the first one and the sound would not adjust.  We got the replacement and it is fine.  I wish we had waited for black friday and gotten a bigger TV for the same price.

Reviews.Title: Apps don't work
Reviews.Author: Cherie
Reviews.Content: 3/4's of the time Amazon app does not connect and 1/2 the time Netflix app does not work or you have to try to connect several times. The wifi signal test always comes out strong, so it is definately the tv itself. I will be calling VIZIO tomorrow to try to see if there is a way to fix it, if not I will be returning it.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E320i-A0 "Smart" TV!!! A WINNER OUT OF THE BOX!!!
Reviews.Author: HappyUser
Reviews.Content: Needed to replace a 33" SONY Bravia HDTV for a 20' x 25' room, to fit in a 35" shelf space. After reading a boatload of these reviews and other leading consumer electronics rating websites, I chose to evaluate the Vizio E320i-A0 IN PERSON. Had enough of other people's subjective "visual" opinions, so I visited the two largest electronics U.S. retailers to see for myself. These two mega-stores had incredible working displays of just about EVERY brand of 32" to 60+" hdtv's ... and side-by-side.Walked out with the E320i-A0!!! for $249 (price rose to $288 everywhere 5 days later). A bargain for this smart TV!! It had THE BEST picture!! This TV has a max resolution of 720p, but there is NO need to spend an additional $100-or-so for a 1080i or 1080p because according to every website expert (CNet, etc.), the difference between 720p and 1080p cannot be detected by the human eye in a TV that is under 45 inches wide.Got it home, set it up on the included stand, plugged in the power cord, plugged in the HDMI cable from the DirecTV DVR box to the TV, and finally, an HDMI cable from a Dolby 5.1 surround-sound receiver to the second of two HDMI inputs on the TV (it is optical cable and S-Video cable capable too).Set-up was a BREEEEEZE and took literally just minutes!! The onscreen menus are simple and easy to understand for a non-techie like me! The remote acts as a keyboard for choosing options. That being said, the only adjustment necessary was that I liked a little brighter picture, otherwise everything was perfect .. from the nice rich black to the vivid colors!During set-up, the TV picked up my home wireless signal immediately, asked me to give it a name, and to enter the network's wireless password. Netflix worked flawlessly with full surround sound! ... as did my other subscriptions.The remote has dedicated buttons to launch Netflix, Amazon On Demand, and MGo Movies ... but you can add ANY subscription you want to the on-screen menu (called a "VIA Dock"), for instant access (like Hulu, etc.), and put it in any order you wish! Totally convenient when one button away!The only criticisms I have is: 1) The black plastic frame around the screen is shiny (not matte), and it reflects lamps and other light sources. Not a problem, but still - it would be better if it was matte. 2) Can't sit too far to the side, but this is for watching TV in bed anyway. 3) The remote could be a tad larger.If you are looking for a small, smart, led tv with an incredible picture, RUN ... DON'T WALK to where ever you plan to buy - and pull the trigger!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV at a Very Reasonable Price
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV as a gift for my parents and we are very pleased with it so far. Before buying this, I did alot of research on similar 47" LED TV`s. The consensus was that for TV`s this size and price range the Vizio E Series was a safe bet and I couldn`t agree more. The picture is absolutely beautiful. The Smart TV apps are responsive. The set-up was very easy. Others have mentioned issues with the remote in their reviews, but I find that as long as the remote is pointed at the TV it works as it should.I`ve also read other reviews of how people have adjusted their picture settings according to CNET`s preferences. I value CNET`s opinion, so I tried their recommended settings with this TV.  In my case, where the TV is located, this does not benefit from their suggestions. I have this TV in a living room, perpendicular to a large bay window which faces south. During the day there is alot of sunlight in this room and CNET`s picture settings were too dark. In my opinion, the optimal picture is acheived with Vizio`s "Retail" setting in a room with alot of sunlight. There is almost no noticeable glare to speak of. There really is no general "ideal" picture setting. Every application has it`s differences, and it`s nice that this TV has the ability to be adjusted based on what yours are.The other thing I`d like to mention was my hesitation of ordering a TV like this online. I have always bought my electronics in an actual store as opposed to the internet for fear of damage incurred with shipping. This is the first time I`ve ordered something like this online and I`d like to point out that Amazon does a very nice job with the packaging. The TV arrived with not so much as a scratch on the box. I even ordered a 48 month extended warranty with this just in case. I am pleased with my purchase and would recommend it to others.  Thank you for reading this and I hope it helps your decision.

Reviews.Title: Two small details Vizio got cheap on
Reviews.Author: J. Lowe "cyclocross"
Reviews.Content: For the price this is a great set. Out of the box I found the picture be a bit to saturated, even on the normal setting. After a few minutes of adjustments and turning off some of the features I had the set looking the way I wanted it. I'm dinging it a star due to two very small annoyances that Vizio could easily and inexpensively fix:1) The included power cord is only 4 feet long. That's way too short given how many people prefer to wall mount their displays or if your electrical outlet isn't located where you want your set to go. An 8 foot cord wouldn't be that much more expensive to include and it's always better to have a cord that is 2 feet two long than 2 inches too short!2) If you want to wall mount the set you'll need 4 M6x18 bolts as Vizio didn't bother to include them. Vizio also doesn't bother to say what size bolts you need in the included quick start guide. Again, it would cost maybe $.20-.30 to include 4 M6x18 bolts.Both of these problems could easily be fixed by Vizio and it would save customers from having to make an extra run to the hardware store. Otherwise, great set for the money. Picture quality is identical to the more expensive Samsung 42" set I looked at once you adjust the settings (NEVER go with how the sets look in the store!)

Reviews.Title: A Good Inexpensive LED HDTV: A VIZIO E-Series E241i-A1 24-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED Smart HDTV Review
Reviews.Author: L. T. Beasimer "www.LBphoto.net"
Reviews.Content: Grandmother wanted a small TV for her bedroom.  Based on her budget and wants, I found the Vizio E241-A1 24-inch Razor LED HDTV.  After a little more research I decided to add a few extra bucks in myself and get her the Vizio E-Series E241i-A1 24-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED Smart HDTV.Both are 24 inch LED HDTVs with 1080p and 60Hz.  The best that I can tell, the only difference is the ability of the E24li-A1 to connect to the internet to provide additional functionality and viewing options.Once I connected the Vizio LED smart HDTV to her Wi-Fi, I was able to set up her profile, update weather cities, and connect to Hulu.  Everything seems to work fine until I selected a show to watch in Hulu.  Grandmother's DSL based Wi-Fi speed is good enough for her limited use, but isn't fast enough to stream without buffering.  This TV doesn't buffer at all, so watching the show was stop and go to a point of being unwatchable.  I didn't expect buffering capabilities, although it would have been nice to know ahead of time this would be an issue.  Fortunately, watching Hulu isn't a feature grandmother is likely to use.I was able to teach grandmother how to check the weather and look at yahoo news articles.  She isn't internet or technically savvy, so it's clearly a simple to use and understand menuing system which allowed her to pick it up so quickly.  Plus she is happy with the picture quality and sound.  Even watching a little football, I couldn't see any ghosting or artifacts from fast action.If you're looking for an inexpensive internet ready HDTV, the Vizio E-Series E241i-A1 24-Inch LED Smart HDTV is worth considering.  Wi-Fi speed may be an issue for those looking to watch Amazon Prime Videos or Hulu Plus.  Even if Wi-Fi speed is an option today, I would still suggest spending the minor difference for the extra features.PROS:Good picture qualityNo ghosting while watching sportsSimple to use menu systemCONS:No buffering capabilities

Reviews.Title: 47" E470i-A0 product review
Reviews.Author: Adam Wright "Electrical Engineer"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV after looking at other manufacturers with TVs that have similar features.  I've been using it for two weeks.I've owned Vizio products before and I haven't had a single problem with them.There are a lot of the connectors are on the left side of the TV.  This was a little bit of a problem for me because all of the things I want to connect to it are on the right side of the TV.  I just needed to use longer cables, not much of an issue.I connected a coaxial antennae to the TV, scanned the channels and was watching OTA HD in minutes.I connected to the internet through WIFI setup was painless and easy!  Ethernet cable connection is plug and play.The SMART TV functionality is nice. A lot of the same features (Amazon instant video, netflix, etc) can also be done with my XBOX360, but I'd rather only have one device on (instead of two).  This TV is very low power so it doesn't heat up my room as much as my old LCD tv + XBOX360.Now onto the TVs display.Out of the box, the TV didn't need any tuning at first glance.  I was watching a college football game (Georgia bull dogs vs Clemson Tigers)  You could tell the difference easily between the Deep red of Georgia and the deep orange of Clemson.  I was in a sports bar watching a replay of the game and you couldn't tell the difference.  Big points for out of the box tuning.This TV has some really deep blacks.  It's especially noticeable when the screen goes dark between scene transitions in a movie.  If the TV is the only source of light in the room, the room will go pitch dark.All in all, it's a good buy.  Amazon beat the price of my local walmart/best buy/etc.

Reviews.Title: Good picture but buggy TV...
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: This is my second one of these because the first would lock up and not want to power on or off at times. The second one, while better, it will always power off and not lock up, it still has issues when powering up. After you turn it off, if you try to turn it back on too quick, it won't power up. We have to wait several minutes to able to get it to power up. On top of that, sometimes when it powers up, the logo is not display and no picture is displayed for more than a minute. It looks like the the TV is locked up but EVENTUALLY it will come around and finally display video and unfreeze itself. Other times it will display the logo and power up and display video within about 5-10 seconds. The other thing I noticed is the setup menu is completely inaccessible for several minutes after the TV powers on. I press the button or select the smart bar option to open it and nothing happens. Then eventually several minutes later, out of the blue the setup menu will appear. Again, this is my second one, so it has become extremely frustrating.The picture itself is very nice once you get the settings right. I found a CNet post recommending setting for this and they worked well. I do feel the viewing angles aren't all that great. Moving off center, the contrast changes become noticeable. Overall tho, I am happy with the picture.On the smart TV side, I like that they have just about all the major ones, including news apps for a couple of my local stations, which is cool. However, they don't have MLB.TV or NHL Gamecenter. The Amazon app leaves a lot to me desired too since it never starts a full screen app, leaving you to navigate thru pages and pages of movies in a 1 quarter screen sized window. Plus on the Prime side, you do NOT have access to your watchlist. All you get is a list of top movies and top TV shows to browse thru. The Netflix interface is nice but viewing stuff is buggy. We've several occurrences of Netflix just dropping completely out of the smart tv section mid movie.I think I am going to try the LG 39LN5700. This one is just too buggy for me(especially the unreliable on/off function)ProsNice picture once you get it set right120mhz refresh so smooth actionHas most major movie/tv/music appsLike the idea of my local stations having an app for news and closingsCONSBUGGY on/off functionalityNetflix app buggy and drops you out at random timesNo MLB.TV or NHL Gamecenter appsAmazon app needs a Full Screen window and access to your watchlist and categoriesViewing angles aren't that great

Reviews.Title: Good TV, too bad it has no internet browser
Reviews.Author: lric
Reviews.Content: That's a nice TV, easy to setup, the processing time to access the Apps is not bad. Image quality is great, you don't need to spend a lot for a big TV and a nice image. Got mine from a wholesaler almost for the same price Amazon is selling it.CONS:- Has no internet browser (for free navigation).- Has no audio output on the regular headphone P2 plug.- Poor sound, no bass.PROS:- Great image.- Big screen.- Great price.- Sound is good enough if you are "just a regular person" who wants to watch tv.- Lightweight

Reviews.Title: bad stand - leans backwards
Reviews.Author: Tego
Reviews.Content: The stand only allows the tv to lean backwards. I think that is a poor design. I'd like a tv that stands up straight or has an adjustment. Our larger Vizio has such a small plastic stand. Will either have to make a stand or return it - can't find any alternative and Vizio customer support is of no help.

Reviews.Title: restricted viewing angle
Reviews.Author: GRACE COPELAND
Reviews.Content: The viewing angle degrades rapidly. Not as good as my other vizio. Next time I will have to actually see the product before buying.

Reviews.Title: Broken on Arrival
Reviews.Author: Thomas N. Thompson "SciFi 4evR"
Reviews.Content: Item arrived in its undamaged factory box with factory packaging and all protective film in place.  Mounted TV to its stand.  Installed batteries in the remote.  Plugged TV into power outlet.  Unit would not power on.  Rechecked the connections: good.  Checked power outlet for power: good.  Checked power cord for power: good.  Did a closer inspection of TV and found the screen was cracked and bowed out from the frame in the top middle.  Set up a return for replacement with Amazon as I did not believe tech support could solve this problem.Update 7/19/3013: Replacement arrived this evening.  This one powered on and setup went smoothly until the Wi-Fi connection failed.  Spent 1 hour and 9 minutes with Tech Support: very courteous and helpful.  Problem is that I had to go to my wireless router setup page on the internet, change my security protocol and password before the TV would accept it.  Downloading speed is/was 5.5 Mb/s on my wireless router.  I was hoping this one would fail so I could upgrade to a better set.  Time will tell how well this unit performs: more testing tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: Low Priced TV that Delivers Low Quality Viewing.
Reviews.Author: Daniel S
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to replace a broken LG Plasma TV and was so disappointed with the picture quality I returned it.  My wife and son couldn't believe how hazy the picture was on sporting events and how flat the colors were overall.  As they noted, there was no "pop" to it and the screen even after lots if adjusting just was not very bright.  I have a smaller Vizio Razor in a guest bedroom which I liked and thought that this would be just as good.  But it wasn't.  I replaced it with a Panasonic for $50 more and it is worlds above the Vizio.I don't understand all of the good reviews here about it. The only thing I can figure is that a lot of reviewers have bought this as their first HD TV (probably due to its low price) so compared to a tube TV it is excellent. But, compared to just about any other HD TV, it is fair at best.  The small savings isn't worth it for the low quality image.The remote is flimsy and hard to use as well. The only thing that was good about it was the very good sound and thin frame around the TV which was sleek.  But you want a TV for its picture and this Vizio just doesn't deliver. Spend $50-100 more and get an LG, Panasonic or Samsung.  It will be money well spent and provide a much better viewing experience.

Reviews.Title: Great Smart TV for the Price!
Reviews.Author: Be Informed Not Fooled
Reviews.Content: TV worked flawlessly out of the box.  Connected to coaxial cable from the wall (no cable boxes etc.). Scanned the channels all the HD channels are great so are the SD channels. I plugged my sound system  in using the 3.5mm jack  it work quite well. The TV sound is fine by itself however. Connected a bluray player it produced a stunning picture (LOTR bluray). The WIFI works perfectly.  Amazon and Netflix work fine no problems.  All the apps work fine.  I deleted the ones I didn't want and added news.  Its now my favorite TV even though I have 42"  plasma TV's in the bedrooms.  The remote works fine it could have been a little bigger but it has all the features and gets the job done.  You get the 'best bang for the buck' with this TV.

Reviews.Title: We all love it - drop HEFTY Cable Bills.
Reviews.Author: JuliaM
Reviews.Content: We purchased two of TV's for the kids and we are happy we did. We made the decision to do so after deciding to drop the HEFTY cable which only repeats everything on television. Since my kids are Netflix users this is perfect. They can see all their Disney Channel shows on Netflix. without the hefty Cable bill. No to mention if you are an Amazon Prime member you can stream Amazon Videos at no additional cost. Well worth the money...in two months of owning the TV's we will save about $300.00.

Reviews.Title: Amazon App Does Not Connect on this TV
Reviews.Author: Laney "Laney"
Reviews.Content: This SMART Vizio TV is great except it does not connect to the Amazon app so I cannot access my Amazon Prime movies. This is strange because Amazon is offering its Amazon Prime customers a $10.00 discount to buy this TV. I spent an afternoon on the phone with Vizio and Amazon only to discover that this is a known technical problem on Amazon's side. Thank you for admitting that Amazon, but I purchased the TV to watch my Amazon Prime movies! You have been working on this problem two months? I am hoping you get it fixed. Meanwhile, I will have to send this model back to you. But you can't give me back my time. :(****************************UPDATE********************************Amazon accepted my return and delivered a replacement the same day! I set it up with no problems. All the apps loaded and updated and I was able to use the supplied on-screen code to register my Vizio with Amazon to connect with my Amazon Prime membership free movies. Thank you, Amazon. The rating goes from a two to a five for product and service.

Reviews.Title: This 47 inch model really ..really ... disappointed me !
Reviews.Author: colorprint
Reviews.Content: I had this TV for only 5 days and it just broke today. It made some squeaky noise at first and then it won't shut off by the remote or the manual button, unplugged it and plugged it back to the outlet and it never turned it back on. The TV just went dead. I really enjoyed the picture and sound quality for this TV for the last few days. Well, I am so glad I can return it to the store I purchased. I didn't get it from Amazon, it just a waste of my time to make trips to the store.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 24 inch TV
Reviews.Author: christina
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this product. It's the best investment I have made . t v has everything u need and the picture is great. The only thing is that the remote does not work well., I'm verv pleased with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I just got this TV delivered by Amazon yesterday and am loving it. Its picture quality is good, but its the features that I simply love - you could turn power led on/off, won't annoy you anymore. Quick internet connection and I notice that apps run faster on this TV. Setup is a breeze. I would mention though that it does not have wide viewing angle, which I think it similar with most lcd/led tvs. Sound is pretty decent. I would highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Nice wireless TV for the money
Reviews.Author: C. Falconburg
Reviews.Content: This TV is just what I expected.  It's easy to set up.  The stand is very easy to attach with just a phillip's head screwdriver.  The picture quality is good, and there are several settings you can choose, including custom.  The color was very red, but I adjusted it, and it's fine now.  The sound is a bit tinny, and there is no way that I can see to increase the bass.  This isn't really important, since I use wireless headphones with my cable box most of the time anyway.  I'm not sure that this TV is really 1080p, although the specs say it is.  It may be the fact that I am only receiving 720p through my cable box.  I have not tested it with my computer yet, so it may be 1080p.

Reviews.Title: great price
Reviews.Author: IRIS SMITH
Reviews.Content: bought smart tv for my sixteen year old daughter. tv plays perfect. she loves the netflix. surfing the internet slows down when there are too many electronics on at the same time

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Andrew Endicott
Reviews.Content: I have read reviews about this TV. Most I was seeing what might be wrong with it or what people were upset with about this TV. I have to say after using it for a while now, it is a pretty great SmartTV and it's value for the quality is uncomparable!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: K. Heinrich
Reviews.Content: Love this TVPRO - easily connects to my wifiGreat pictureGood SoundCONwish the remote would light uptakes too long for the picture to appear when turned on

Reviews.Title: God value
Reviews.Author: Rtas47
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv after looking at many others.  It is the second Vizio smart tv that i have bought.  Both are providing outstanding service. The color is vivid and the internet features are just right if you are a member of Netflix and Amazon prime which I am.  It is not to difficult to get it set up and running but it does take patience as there are minimal directions that come with the tv.  You have to download the manual from the internet....which I advise you to do so.  All in all a very good buy in the 40" smart tv market.  It does not have many bells and whistles thus the low price for this kind of tv. And....it doesn't hurt that it is made in the USA either.

Reviews.Title: After 25-28 days it has started flickering (Dim to Bright back to Dim).  Needs replacing!
Reviews.Author: KBA
Reviews.Content: Have had great experience with Vizio TVs until this one as it is going from Bright to Dim and back. Initial Easy setup and install to all devices.  Would still recommend Vizio to any one wanting 47 inch tv.I do hope Amazon helps get mine replaced.

Reviews.Title: Nice television set...
Reviews.Author: William Del Pilar
Reviews.Content: I have given this five stars because I ordered it for my spare room where guests stay and it does the job very well. I didn't need anything fancy but an ability for guests to be able to view television while they are in the room. At 32" it's the perfect size and cost I was looking for and would recommend it to anyone looking for a spare television for a room they for guests or a child's playroom, home workout area, etc. I don't use it as my main television and to be frank don't view it myself but when I asked my guests they had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: nativita warner
Reviews.Content: worth every penny, perfect picture wonderful. I would recommend this television i brought it for my mother, she was so pleased.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: DeVan Janssen
Reviews.Content: I'm happy with the TV, it works well and the picture is fine.  I needed a little help getting it set up, but their service department was top notch and guided me through it in just a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Dennis C. Scheifele "OldDen"
Reviews.Content: Picture perfect and a real easy setup, sound is great for a TV at this price ($288). My wife is very happy with the built in WiFi also..

Reviews.Title: 39" Vizio TV
Reviews.Author: Jay Darwin
Reviews.Content: Purchased for Florida Condo unit, very light and easy to set up. TV has nice picture and decent audio. No problems.

Reviews.Title: Love my FREE TV!!
Reviews.Author: Christi E. "Christi E."
Reviews.Content: I got this TV for FREE through Swagbucks...I got Amazon gift cards and got this for my kitchen. I LOVE it. It is a great size for a kitchen counter, if you want a decent size TV. Great picture and even has apps, which we never use, but nice to have them in case we decide to.

Reviews.Title: Shuts off when viewing
Reviews.Author: fern
Reviews.Content: Its your basic smart tv, dont be expecting to surf the web at lightning speeds, I use it to watch netflix and youtube, for some reason it turns off all of the sudden when watching netflix, could be because there is no active signal coming in from "input 1 " or whatever you have it set on.  So I turned off the energy saver timer that would turn off the tv after 10 mins of inactivity, seems to fix it.  the only thing I didnt like about the tv is that I do not have the capability of using my cloud or drive from my router.  Ive tried connecting a usb to the tv and playing movies but it is VERY limited in the file types it can play.

Reviews.Title: Good TV at a Good Price
Reviews.Author: emjlr3
Reviews.Content: For $450, the price was right.  The online functions work fine, but are not a deal maker here as the same functions are easily got from a media player box for $40.Picture quality is fine, some noticeable blooming where the backlighting is dimmed.  Black levels are very good when the backlight is dimmed, otherwise they are not so great.  It can look a bit silly when the letterbox borders are inky black, and the dark scenes of a movie aren't, so you see a stark contrast between the two black levels.  I usually crop the movie to fit my screen most of the time, which eliminates this.With some calibration, the colors will look accurate.Something to note, this tv is not truly 120Hz.  You will not get the "soap opera" effect, which helps most viewing but hurts sports viewing.  I bought this knowing that fact, so it was not a  big deal to me.  Also, this tv does not support 24p playback, if you want that sort of thing.Speakers are ok, but seriously, get a bar or surround sound, it will do you good.At the price, this TV was fine, if you value online functions and don't expect top quality images.  50" was a sweet spot for my viewing distance, and I could not find a better deal on a quality television at the time.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Sondra Metzger "Artist"
Reviews.Content: BOUGHT THIS FOR MY GUEST BEDROOM.  IT'S JUST GREAT.  I ALSO HAVE VIZIO IN MY OFFICE.  A GREAT PRODUCT. THANKS

Reviews.Title: streaming didn't work despite good network connection
Reviews.Author: skatelady
Reviews.Content: So far, I have only tried to stream Netflix on this TV, and for that purpose, it failed miserably.  It connected wirelessly to our network fine, but the streaming didn't really work.  It would work for a minute or so (with varied picture quality), then the picture would freeze but the sound would continue, and then seconds later, the TV would just shut off on its own.  We have very fast internet and the TV showed that we have excellent connection, so I'm not sure what the problem is.  We will return this as streaming Netflix was one of the main reasons for the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Completely satisfied!
Reviews.Author: T. Beyer "tbeyer"
Reviews.Content: Fits the purpose. I use this as desktop and TV.Works perfectly for both. Great value. I would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: wifi wont not connect
Reviews.Author: Friday
Reviews.Content: great customer service  they  called back the same day  no questions about returning sent label within 20 minutes.  would  buy from the company again  really wanted the Wi-Fi  use in room no cable to watch Hulu Netflix

Reviews.Title: Worked fine for a few months
Reviews.Author: MF
Reviews.Content: Shipped quickly and arrived packaged securely. When I removed it from packing and turned it over to install the base it had a disturbing rattle, as if some components or interior parts were loose inside. It worked fine for a few months and then the picture stopped working after powering up. It has sound, but seldom will boot the picture. I hope their warranty support is good.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV!
Reviews.Author: musiclifer55
Reviews.Content: I've had this tv over a month now and am very happy. Crisp bright picture and easy to use. The WiFi was easy to connect and works flawlessly. I purchased a remote with a QWERTY keyboard and it also works flawlessly. I recommend the qwertry remote to anyone with a Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, deductions for the Netflix app
Reviews.Author: Phillip Hagerman
Reviews.Content: This TV is great, and the picture quality and color fidelity is fantastic.Some of the Vizio smart TV features are fairly useless though. I don't really need to play games, or check Yahoo weather on my tv.1 star is deducted though, because the Netflix app will sometimes crash the TV (which causes it to just shut off completely)  After turning the TV back on I have to sign back into the Netflix app which is annoying.  It isn't a deal breaker because it doesn't happen very often.1 star deducted because the TV will not play content from my DLNA certified Cisco Linksys EA4500 Router.  Spoke with Vizio Tech Support and they informed me there was nothing they could do about it.  Was very unappy about that, because now if I want to watch content from my existing digital library, I have to put it on a USB thumb drive and plug it into the TV.

Reviews.Title: Not factory packaged
Reviews.Author: Nancy R. Welch
Reviews.Content: This TV was labeled as NEW.  It was shipped in a plain box. When we opened the box the TV was bubble wrapped. No manufacturers box. The instruction manual was a copy.  When we plugged it in, it had already been previously set up.The TV works well, arrived when promised but appears to have been used.If it was a store demo it should have been made clear in the item description.

Reviews.Title: Looks great.
Reviews.Author: Ben M
Reviews.Content: Purchased this as a bedroom television. Picture quality is nice, remote is responsive. Menu interface is easy to understand and set up takes only about 2-5 minutes.The only thing I didn't like was trying to find the power button on the television, as it was hidden under the bottom in a corner with no indication anywhere on the monitor.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: John Michael Kieffer
Reviews.Content: When we first ordered this television, it was during a holiday sale on Amazon and we were kind of nonplussed because we had wanted to get the Samsung Smart TV, but the TV we wanted had run out of stock. To us this television seemed kind of like a distant second.Luckily, we were quite incorrect in our assumption. This television has been an all around great Smart TV. The menu's are quite a bit different from Samsung's, but they are still about as easy to navigate as one can expect a Smart TV's menus to be. The remote for the television is small, and that is the only real detriment I see to the television; however, I don't need reading glasses to navigate the remote yet, so it doesn't really bother me.

Reviews.Title: Was surprised no Bluetooth.
Reviews.Author: Mary F Prada
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small flat screen for  my living room, got this "smart tv". Had a hard time setting it up had to by HD wires etc, and probably it said all of that when i bought it, but still took me some days of adding a wireless bose speaker, now wired because no Bluetooth, again probably my fault for not reading the fine details. But I expected a tv that has netflix and hulu and is wireless might have Bluetooth. I'm very happy with it now, that I finally, hooked it up right. I might not choose it again if given the chance, I'd do more homework, but it's working and I like it.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E420i-A0 42-Inch 1080p 120Hz Smart LED HDTV (2013 Model) IS AWESOME!!!!! NT ONE PROBLEM YET, NOT EVEN A MINOR ONE!!!
Reviews.Author: Javed Arain
Reviews.Content: VIZIO E420i-A0 42-Inch 1080p 120Hz Smart LED HDTV (2013 Model) IS AWESOME!!!!! NT ONE PROBLEM YET, NOT EVEN A MINOR ONE!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my kitchen
Reviews.Author: Kibble "kibble"
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV on a whim because I kept missing things I wanted to see when I was in the kitchen.  Amazon Prime is true to its word--the TV arrived quickly, was simple to set up and works great!

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: E. Wagman "Sinbad"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for the kitchen at our vacation house, using free over the air antenna reception.  Great picture, good sound, the smart feature worked well with Amazon prime via my cell phone hot spot. Like many new digital TV's, it takes a moment to come on and change a channel.  The remote seems fine. My only complaint is the tuner is a bit less sensitive than my tried and true Zenith digital tuner converter box for those fringe stations.

Reviews.Title: Great set for the Money
Reviews.Author: ERIC N
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the quality and price of this Television.  Easy set up, and using the calibration on Cnet, I get an excellent picture.  I won't rate it any higher or lower until I have had it longer.  Although I have it hooked up to a sound system, I did not think the sound on it was as bad as a lot of people reviewed it.

Reviews.Title: Good TV but not for wireless streaming.
Reviews.Author: JoeFromGA "User Friendly"
Reviews.Content: Great little TV. Wireless pairing is useless as with many tvs.  The signal goes in and out no matter the distance. But wired is fine. Lots of features and good quality.

Reviews.Title: Thumbs up for this brand of TV
Reviews.Author: Andrew Mcbean
Reviews.Content: I would recommend any series of VIZIO to anyone....they've been proven to be durable and has good quality. This is a very good buy and I have no regrets.

Reviews.Title: its perfect
Reviews.Author: grim reaper
Reviews.Content: this tv works great 100% perfect if you buy this tv be sure to leave the sides away from anything or you will have trouble with the remote

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E-Series E241i-A1 24-inch 1080p 60Hz LED Smart HDTV (tilted...) Review
Reviews.Author: Dwranny "Dwranny"
Reviews.Content: This littel guy is wonderful. It was purchased as a gift and is dearly loved! The pictures are clear and bright, the sound is strong, the size is right for a small room, and the wifi is amazing! This was a perfect gift for a college student or young person who need the convenience of internet-ready viewing, HDTV, and on a budget. Pricing was right, delivery was fast, and packaging was secure.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed with this TV
Reviews.Author: Feline Lover "feline lover"
Reviews.Content: The remote did not respond in sync with the TV.  Picture was nice to look at.  But what good is it to have a TV that does not respond when buttons are pushed on its remote and this happened to two different Vizio TV's?  My review is for this TV though and this merchant.  TV was advertised as brand new and it was not!  It was used and I could see that as I started unwrapping it.  I thought about returning it, but what a hassle and had to think about it again for a few days.  But the more I used it the more I didn't like it and seeing that the remote had scrathces on it and so did the TV has a scuff mark on the front of it that I could only see, in the light of day.  I had waited several weeks for this TV to be delievered because the seller said they did not have the color I ordered and would have to order it, I said " Ok, because I want the black color I had ordered."  What a sham!  Since they sent me a used TV, anyway!  When I got another Vizio, just like the first one.  I could see the difference in quality of the second remote.  Very shinny and prestine right out of its wrappings and so was the second TV very prestine condition and shinny.  So my observations wer correct.  However, both remotes needed to be pressed many times to get them to respond and sometimes the screen froze up.  So I decided to return both of them.  The first one back to the seller at Amazon and the second TV that I had purchased locally, in my area.  I had no problem returning either of them and received my refund w/o a hassle.  But I will never buy from that seller at Amazon, again.  I believe, they must have thought that I would not return their TV, since I had waited so long for it to arrived.  But they were so wrong.  If for not anything else,...it was for the principle of the whole situation. I do not like being made out to be a foolish consumer, because I am not.  I pay close attention to details.  I always have done this and I do not know of anyone who likes to be thought of as a fool. This seller should be ashamed of themselves!!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Donald  and Sandra Kohn
Reviews.Content: Couldn't be happier with this television.  Excellent picture, easy to operate.  The remote isn't over-whelming with a multitude of buttons.  Excellent product.  I would highly recommend this item.Sandra Kohn

Reviews.Title: a very nice little TV
Reviews.Author: richard kirkpatrick
Reviews.Content: Just wanted a small TV for the kitchen with a few Wi-Fi apps. This TV works great for what I wanted it for.

Reviews.Title: great qulity and shipping!
Reviews.Author: M. Weigle "mad mike"
Reviews.Content: got them for my children they are very lite and thin so if they would fall off their dresser they would have less chance of hurting my kids.great quality highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: So far, works great!
Reviews.Author: Sharonda Clarke
Reviews.Content: Just received the TV after a loong wait. The set up was fairly easy. Everything seems to be working fine. I used the brackets from my old tv to put this one on the wall. It looks better on my wall.

Reviews.Title: Looks great
Reviews.Author: Thomas A. Redinger
Reviews.Content: After playing with the settings recommended from multiple sources, ie. cnet and others, I really like this picture.  For the money I paid, I couldn't ask for more.  Smart tv with all the apps I want/need..  Computer monitor.  Even the ability to control ps3 with the tv remote after turning on some setting that allows control thru hdmi or something like that.  Remote itself is a little lacking but I just need the basics so it's fine for me.  Sd channels could be displayed a little clearer but pretty typical.  Hd channels just as expected.

Reviews.Title: Tv
Reviews.Author: cat
Reviews.Content: I love it.I can watch netflix or watch youtube.I highly recommend it.The picture quality is good.Vizio is a good brand.

Reviews.Title: Good deal for an average tv
Reviews.Author: Chandni
Reviews.Content: Its good for the price, but it often has a lag when switching between netflix and tv. The picture quality is also not as good as I had expected.

Reviews.Title: Good with some reservations
Reviews.Author: Thomas J Kielick
Reviews.Content: Our son picked this out for us as a Christmas present. We have a traditional colonial style house with period furniture and it needed to fit into a wooden cabinet with doors. The 29" was a perfect fit with just a 1/2 clearance on each side. We use it to watch Over the Air Broadcast TV and the receiver pulls in all the stations we ever got on our old analog TV with Digital convertor box. The image is bright and sharp although I had to select Gaming Mode to get the level of brightness and contrast that looked good. But here are the pitfalls:1) The stand is cheap and makes the TV lean backwards at an awful angle. It just does not look good tipped back that way. What were the designers thinking of? I thought I could simply prop up the stand on a couple of boards (you can't see them in the cabinet) but then the whole thing was tippy and risked falling forward out of the furniture. I ended up using wire zip ties stapled to the boards and clinched around the base to hold the whole thing in line.2) The TV Guide function for Broadcast TV is terrible. You can only see the current show. This means you can't sit down in the evening and peruse all the upcoming shows and plan your entertainment for the night. Since this information is being broadcast anyway I simply don't understand why the programming for the set did not allow you to see the entire nights line up! The only solution is to move to another TV, check out all the listing and then return to this one. Hardly a good work around. C'mon Vizio!3) The USB port and headphone/audio out jacks are on the back side. When the TV is in the cabinet they are inaccessible. I like to use a nice set of headphones to listen to my favorite shows or movies that my wife is not interested in. I thought I could work around the headphone jack issue by buying an extender cable but learned to my dismay that as soon as it was plugged into the back of the TV the speakers were cut off. No work around for that one either. I use the USB port on my Blue Ray player to connect up and show photos etc.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: karen winslow
Reviews.Content: I am extremely satisfied so far with this television. I hope I will enjoy this TV for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, Crappy Sound
Reviews.Author: Honest Susan "-Susan"
Reviews.Content: No matter how I adjust the settings for the sound, the speakers suck.  My older Emerson 32" sounded way better than this thing does.But the picture is good, and the Netflix feature is really neat.Buttons on the remote are pretty tiny, kind of annoying too.Like other reviewers say, it does take a while to start up for some reason.  Can be annoying when you're just wanting to watch TV for 10 mins while you eat your cereal or whatever.

Reviews.Title: as advertized!
Reviews.Author: Cornelia A. Foster
Reviews.Content: the tv met all my expectations in terms of picture and features.  very good for price.  nice, light, streamlined and easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: WARNING!  Wi-Fi range is 30 ft!
Reviews.Author: Dynamo Dude "Dynamo Fan"
Reviews.Content: Bought this with the intent of connecting to our Wi-Fi router (why else buy a smart TV?).  TV is in master bedroom, router is in den on other side of house (~60 ft away).  TV would not read wireless signal from router (although my laptop computer and smartphones do).  Called Vizio Customer Support and was told that Wi-Fi card on TV has a 30 ft range.  Now I have to buy a Roku in order to get the "smarts" I bought this TV for in the first place.  BTW - Multiple customer reviews of Roku state that they have extensive Wi-Fi range (e.g., Roku on second floor connects to a router on first floor on the other side of house).  Not sure why this TV can't have the same range.  Considered returning the TV, but there is not a "dumb" TV on the market with comparable resolution and refresh spec's (i.e., 1080p, 120 Hz) that is cheaper than this one.  As for the TV itself, I am pleased with the picture and sound quality.

Reviews.Title: Great budget TV but flimsy optical audio connector
Reviews.Author: Rob L
Reviews.Content: I recently bought the 50-inch E500-A1 and hooked it up to a Vizio soundbar via the optical audio connector. None of the reviews I read mentioned this, but the optical port on the back of the TV is very flimsy, and it completely broke off when I tried to remove the optical port to test something out (was having trouble with the soundbar).The port was only connected to the TV with three small (like the soldered kind) connections that were probably also used to transmit data. Optical audio cables have a little wide part so you have to push until it clicks in place. When I pulled (gently) to remove it, the whole housing came out, breaking at the three connection points.I'm upset because everything else about the TV is great. I am in total agreement with the rest of the reviews. The picture quality is awesome for this price TV.

Reviews.Title: It Is OK
Reviews.Author: TSA-ORD
Reviews.Content: When we bought this during Christmas 2012, it was one of the few Smart HDTVs in the market for this size.  The price was reasonable also. One thing I don't like too much is the remote control:  it is small and the buttons are small also. The color of the TV is not as good as Samsung and Sony. It does not have a wide angle view.  If you step away from the center view area to the side, you would see a big change in viewing quality.  My 23" Samsung has a "Magic" angle which is much better than this VIZIO model.  I will give a 3 Star in quality.

Reviews.Title: Volume Glitch
Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture. But I see other reviewers have the same issue as we do, the volume. I'd estimate every five or six times you turn it on, the sound is muted and the only way to correct it is to power it off, and then power it back on. Our set isn't in a main room, so the viewing hours are relatively low compared to another set we bought at the same time. And the TV with higher use is still going strong. I know it's not the biggest deal, which is one of the reasons we didn't return it, but for anyone purchasing the Vizio with plans for daily use: you may want to continue looking.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: coconutman
Reviews.Content: I wasn't looking for a smart tv when I bought this, it just had the best price tag for the size, but I have to say I really enjoy the smart aspects of it, and I don't know that you can find them at a better size and price point than on the vizio.The only bad aspects of this tv would be that the screen is not tight in the frame (it can just rock, it will not fall out) and the remote can be a little tricky to hit the sensor, but I have had it in odd positions, straight on it is fine. These are very small flaws and haven't affected it's performance at all.As for some nice points, it's very pretty, with very dark blacks and bright colors. I don't have the opportunity to use the HD ability very often, but when I do, it looks very nice, and is certainly the way to enjoy it. I game on it with no reponse time issues. It has a glossy finish, so pointing it towards a window will result in reflections, but it makes the picture prettier. The viewing angle is nearly 180 degrees, and even then it's only limited by your ability to see it, not by the screen. There are no dead pixels, which I was concerned about buying a bargain tv. The four HDMI connections, along with component, audio, optical and cable hookups make it very attractive to a device-heavy user.I love this tv and would recommend it to anyone (in fact I'm trying to convince my father-in-law right now).

Reviews.Title: Nice picture, promising features, good value
Reviews.Author: John L. Borowicz "JLB"
Reviews.Content: The overall item is great. I am a bit disappointed with the WiFi implementation which does not behave well with low-to-moderate strength signal.

Reviews.Title: Decent television for the money.
Reviews.Author: Ben Baker
Reviews.Content: For starter I only use this tv for my spare room.  This tv is great for the money and the size.  It compares nothing to my 65" Plasma Samsung, but didn't want to spend that much money on a spare tv.The tv is great for hooking up to cable, to even running internet apps like Netflix.  The sound from the tv is moderate at best.  I have external speakers that I hooked this up to for better sound.If you are a heavy gamer like me, this tv might get you by for the time being, but should not be considered for main use.  There is a noticeable difference in quality because this is only 720p.

Reviews.Title: Already failing
Reviews.Author: Kele
Reviews.Content: I'd give this 4 stars for picture quality and ease of use -- unfortunately -- after only 8 months the electronics on this unit are starting to go bad -- I'll get glitches in the picture -- generally powering off and back on will clear up -- but it gives me indications that it is probably not long for this world... very disappointed because I have enjoyed the size and features of this unit.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: Rina Infantino
Reviews.Content: works great with good sound and clear picture. Perfect for the kitchen. I would buy this again in a  heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: I really enjoy this TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy this TV.  It does not have all of the apps I'd like to enjoy on it such as HBOGo and SHO.  Maybe in the future the apps store will have more.  Netfilix, Amazon and HuluPlus are there along with Facebook (I can't imagine why, but I'm sure some will like this option) Twitter YouTube...a good variety are available

Reviews.Title: Worth the money
Reviews.Author: Yariel Mendez
Reviews.Content: Had the tv for months now and I love it. I definitely recommend using it with a ethernet, Wifi sometimes can be a problem

Reviews.Title: Needed a TV for bedroom
Reviews.Author: Ron S
Reviews.Content: Needed a small TV for bedroom this one is just right for a small room. Sound is fair and was easy to setup on the WiFi.

Reviews.Title: LEANS BACK JUST A LITTLE TOO FAR WHEN USING THE PROP ARM WITH IT.
Reviews.Author: troddx007 "toddx007"
Reviews.Content: We like this television. Works great and the graphics when using the PS3 or Wii are fantastic. The audio needs a bit of tuning, but overall the rating for this small tv is very high.

Reviews.Title: good comparatively inexpensive TV
Reviews.Author: Arindale Trotman
Reviews.Content: very good comparatively inexpensive TV. very pleased and would recommend it to any one who needs a fairly good inexpensive TV. could use a better control

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy
Reviews.Author: Ben J
Reviews.Content: The TV looks great, when its turned off. A black line appeared across the middle of the screen a few weeks after purchase. Buy a different brand.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Joseph Favorito
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal on this TV, great picture, great sound, lots of great features. I use this in conjunction with my Google Chromecast HDMI Streaming Media Player.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at Great Price
Reviews.Author: Rodney Flickinger
Reviews.Content: Since the Human Eye can hardly tell the difference between 1080P and 720 P.  And my vision is not 20/20 as it is I decided that this 720P 29 Inch Television would do a great Job as a second television. It is working out great with out a problem. I wish I could find a Larger one to use as my Full Size Television.

Reviews.Title: great TV at great price!
Reviews.Author: Pat Mallett
Reviews.Content: The only for thing keeping this from five stars is the fact that for some reasdon , no matter how strong my WiFi signal is, I cannot get Netflix to work right, keeps losing the connection.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture
Reviews.Author: Kristine M. Cook "bass player"
Reviews.Content: When our other tv died, I quickly purchased this one because I had heard good things about Vizio.  We were not disappointed.
