Would I buy this exact tv again not sure would have to think about it and do more comparison shopping. The one thing that did turn me off right out of the box was the extremely cheap looking remote!!! I expected a much better remote considering this was a big fancy smart tv, not sure if you would consider that nit picking a little, but this is my review.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Gourniak
Reviews.Content: The tv is awesome.  It is just what I was looking for.  I love the Pandora app and learning more about the capabilities everyday.

Reviews.Title: Closed Caption missing for apps
Reviews.Author: just basic terminology
Reviews.Content: VIZIO Tvs ARE NOT compatible with Amazon video and Netflix for CC. I found out after being bounced around between Amazon and Vizio. Finally a rep. from Amazon got to the bottom of the problem and emailed me a list w/ the TVs that are compatible.The remote is also a piece of crap. I have to push an app button until my hand gets numb to access it.Customer service has limited hours and after more than an hour I did not get any solution for my problem.Will return.

Reviews.Title: Worst video compression I've ever seen in a TV set.
Reviews.Author: Ted C.
Reviews.Content: If you look closely at any image, it's mottled with bad image compression.  During footage of last February's Super bowl, the field is "moving" every few seconds even when the camera isn't, because the compression keeps re-smudging.  Also, the image is stretched slightly horizontally so everything looks wider and shorter than it should.  There's no way to make this stretching go away.  If you cycle through the different display modes it just magnifies or demagnifies the stretched image.  We returned this TV after less than 24 hours.  For major TV purchase I'm going back to Panasonic, even if boards tend to burn out and you only get a few years out of each TV.  It's worth it to have a better image.

Reviews.Title: Not pleased :(
Reviews.Author: Andra Miller
Reviews.Content: Does not play netflix properly. Half the time it won't connect. When it does work, it plays for a minute and then says it can't play the title or cannot connect. I have great internet and no other devise or tv has this issue. I won't be getting this tv again sadly.

Reviews.Title: Broken Vizio TV
Reviews.Author: Georgetmjr
Reviews.Content: It's never worked right. It's taken over 3 weeks to get Vizio to respond to my requests for a replacement. Now that I have them responding, it's still going to be 8 to 10 days for a replacement. Totally unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: Amazon Prime App is GARBAGE
Reviews.Author: papajuan
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my first smart TV until I tried the Amazon Prime App.  It must have been designed by the same people that designed the Obama-care wed site, or by someone that has never accessed Prime movies on a computer.The Vizio 29" (e291i-A1) is a five star TV for the price. I'm thinking the $80 per year for Prime prepaid (free?) streaming video is not a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Decent Picture - Horrible Sound
Reviews.Author: boknows
Reviews.Content: The TV works and the price was decent - The sound is horrible - Its almost annoying how poor the sound is - It bothers me to listen to it so I use the surround sound system to watch TV - Also the TV freezes sometimes when using the smart tv features and takes a moment to come back - For the same money Id get a different TV if I had the chance

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV
Reviews.Author: Ralph Bagwell
Reviews.Content: This tv is so far ahead of the cr model I had.  Using Netflix & Amazon movies is as easy as a regular channel.

Reviews.Title: terrible design flaw
Reviews.Author: Steve B.
Reviews.Content: the tv cant be above your eyes or top of tv or colors are washed out has to be below your eyesight colors are subpar at best. my 3 year old vizio in other room is way better. how can they keep making this tv. should be recalled.worse tv ever

Reviews.Title: This tv is great but i woulnt buy it from amazon.
Reviews.Author: marc heys
Reviews.Content: I'll start out by saying that this tv is amazing. It has bright colors and deep blacks. I bought it because my wife and I play a lot of Xbox and we watch a lot of movies together. But you should buy it elsewhere. The first one that can,e was shipped in its own box, which UPS dented and in turn, when I pulled it out, the TV was broken. So I called amazon and the person I talked to was very courteous and arranged for me to have a new TV overnighted to me. Which was great. The next TV was dropped off while I was at work. I left s note on the door stating to put it in my shed lock the padlock and leave the shipper in my mailbox. I arrived home to a larger box on its side in the snow. They double boxed my second Tv. The outside box was wet and full of holes, and the inner TV box had a hole in it also. I feared the worst had happened and I had gotten a second broken television. So I got the box inside, opened it and imspected the TV for cracks. Thankfully there was none and so I got it set up and connected to my internet in about ten minutes. It works fine, which, given the circumstances, I got lucky.So its not Amazon's fault that UPS and FedEx messed up. But I'm giving amazon 3 stars because they should have double boxed the first TV amd I wouldn't have had to deal with the head ache.

Reviews.Title: Cheaper at Walmart!!!!
Reviews.Author: Tara
Reviews.Content: $10 cheaper at walmart for the same TV with FREE shipping!!!  You can even go pick it up the same day !Also the 3 year service plan is only $39.00....

Reviews.Title: No Instructions
Reviews.Author: D. McCormick "Chief Mac"
Reviews.Content: Vizio needs to understand that we do need instructions in setting up TV's of this nature. All the Menu for the users guide is on the TV. But it still does not address some items that are needed to set it up. Sound using earphone on variable is not satisfactory. I'll keep the product beause I can deal with the low sound. But, they need to address that. I had the same problem with the 55 incha and another 32 inch. Plus there is not way to just turn the speakers off when using the headphones. You have to into the menu where as it used to be if you pluygged they in it cut off the speakers.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't Hold WiFi Signal
Reviews.Author: 2kings
Reviews.Content: The whole reason I purchased this TV was for it's "smart" features.  I can't get through 1 hour of Netflix or any other ap on the TV without it losing the signal.  I have to turn the TV off, then on, then select the ap, the show, and then in another 15 minutes repeat the process.  Sometimes the quick launch buttons on the remote for the aps work, and sometimes they don't.  I've also noticed that the audio fades in and out.  I read a lot of reviews before deciding to purchase this TV, and most of them were great.  Only now when I google my specific problems do I see A LOT of others are having or have had the same issues.  If you purchase this TV, do so at a local store in case you need to return it.  Very disappointed with this product.

Reviews.Title: Met mostly my expectations.
Reviews.Author: Roger Sarathy
Reviews.Content: Met mostly my expectations. Not Smart enough to connect to Internet. Need an extra device such as Costar/Apple TV ($100) to browse the internet.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work well with Amazon instant video
Reviews.Author: Spinger
Reviews.Content: My watchlist doesn't show up and it also doesn't organize things well. If Vizio and amazon can get together on this to make this app work seamlessly, it would be much better.

Reviews.Title: Struggles with connecting
Reviews.Author: Andrea Rose
Reviews.Content: I have been having trouble connecting to Netflix on this TV ever since we got it. All other tv's in the house connect to Netflix immediately so I know it's not an Internet problem or a Netflix problem... I have a feeling it's the wireless portion in the Vizio TZv itself...

Reviews.Title: Brilliant!
Reviews.Author: Sunderpea
Reviews.Content: I guess this was a major upgrade for us, but the size is perfect without being ridiculously huge. Love watching Netflix on the screen. Good colour & sound.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: K. Cummings
Reviews.Content: bought this tv for my son to go in his room. excellent picture,sound, ect. hooking up to the internet was a breeze. My son loves the tv.

Reviews.Title: AMazin Tv
Reviews.Author: Antonio J. Gonzalez "AJG"
Reviews.Content: Love this tv Only had one flat screen before and it was a cheap toshiba Lcd tv, once i Plugged this bad boy to my xbox my eyes lit up. Man those Led really make everything pop.Sound wise I give it a 2.5 stars but hey to be honest if your looking to buy a 120hz tv 1080p led with amazing sound built in, well then you shouldn't be looking at cheap tv's. But if your like me live on a budget and want great picture quality than this tv is Perfect. I suppliment my sound with a suround sound that I bought years ago so i have no sound issues what so ever. But sound can also be fixed with a sound bar.

Reviews.Title: looks like a waste of money
Reviews.Author: edson
Reviews.Content: after a couple of months the display went upside down all of a sudden...the HDMI port number 2 stopped working...the tv tuner got irresponsive while scanning for analog tv channels and the menu doesnt stay on....vizio support advised to power cycle the tv which i did to no avail....replied to them that it didnt work and was wondering wether it would be main board related but no answer .....had to buy a hdmi switch to still be able to watch my security cams and sat receiver through the only hdmi port available now and had to turn my tv upside down to be able to watch it....if they dont come up with an answer i might as well rate this tv zero stars....i took the tv back home in south america and as you could understand it is not likely to be returned to the US without additional costs...before these problems it was a excellent tv at theprice but now????

Reviews.Title: Volume on remote and physical buttons on tv stopped working
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: After three days the tv broke. We couldn't control the volume from the remote and the buttons on the side of the tv didn't work. We had to turn the tv off and turn it back on again just to adjust volume. We had to unplug the tv to shut it off.Vizio was no help. They told us to take batteries out of remote and replace them. We tried telling them it wasn't just the remote, the tv buttons didn't work but they wouldn't listen and said they couldn't help if changing the batteries didn't work.Calibrating the picture quality and sound was a hassle. We finally got the picture to look ok after much playing around, the sound was only fair at best.Amazon was great with working with us to get a new tv. Being this was the second vizio in 5 wks we got from them with the same issue we were afraid to get another vizio. We are going with a lg this time. Amazon was great on both returns with shipping out our new tvs right away and arranging pick up of the broken ones.

Reviews.Title: Only rates 1 so far,...
Reviews.Author: Kent B.
Reviews.Content: I bought the tv new for Christmas and it froze up shortly after turning on, not working. I have contacted Visio and they are leaning towards sending a tech to install parts only. I'm sure this is a wonderful tv, but I will continue my review after the results that take place. Hopefully I can rate at a 4 or higher as it looks great. I will finish later, good or bad.

Reviews.Title: Vizio Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Judy B
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd Vizio TV and second smart TV...this one is even smarter than our last one.  Very happy with it and of course amazon had the best price and best delivery!

Reviews.Title: Not the picture of a budget flat screen tv!
Reviews.Author: bizgoody1
Reviews.Content: I received my TV two days ago, and set it up quickly, I went from out of the box and fully connected in about 20 minutes, and even with the factory settings I could tell that I was going to be pleased with the picture quality...  Special thanks to "digitalis" whose review I read prior to my purchase, and I used the settings recommended in that review to calibrate my picture settings...  The picture quality is excellent, especially given the price point!  Most notably, the deep blacks are impressive, as is the incredible level of brightness..(My living room gets a great deal of light if all of my blinds are open, and the VIZIO E500 had no trouble keeping the picture bright enough for very comfortable viewing)I was hesitant about some of things prior reviewers had posted regarding viewing angles, but I have found that no matter where I am seated in my living room the quality looks just as good, except for extreme angles to the side the picture looks very very slightly washed out... (Honestly if you have a room so large, or so many people over to watch your television that this is an issue, you probably have the wrong size anyway... I have the 50 inch and it's perfect.All of the settings are very easy to access, and if you follow the previous recommendations for settings, you should find the quality of the picture quite pleasing.  I made minor tweaks to a couple of the settings for my own preferences as any picture quality on a television is subject to personal tastes.I previously had a 47 inch LCD from VIZIO in my living room, so I was already familiar with VIZIO internet apps, and I have always found them to work quite well, the response to opening and navigating apps is quick, and easy to connect to my wireless router.If you're not a total tv snob, and want an excellent bargain, without sacrificing quality in viewing and a 50 inch tv is the right size for you, I would have no trouble in recommending this unit!

Reviews.Title: Sucks
Reviews.Author: akash
Reviews.Content: I have this one almost for one year, hardly watched 2-3 hrs/month...Its so slow " I can't believe". Lately, it hangs a lot, I have to take the power cord out and turn on again...Seriously I want to get rid of this junk.

Reviews.Title: Board died
Reviews.Author: Lawrence McCain
Reviews.Content: At first I was in love with the tv size and price was perfect for the spare bedroom. Then about 8 months in the tv turned itself off. Turned it back on and the VIZIO logo appeared on the screen and just sat there. Apparently this happens when the board dies, so do I replace the board or get a new tv. Should have gotten the extended warranty with this product, or went to Costco.

Reviews.Title: A Really Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Rosemary A. Prie
Reviews.Content: This TV has great style, wonderful picture color and clarity.  Also, the access for apps, u tube, music, etc. has it competing with my computer for shopping convenience.

Reviews.Title: Missing Parts, Cracked Part
Reviews.Author: Eric J rue
Reviews.Content: Open box, used very good rating. The last party to have it left a cough drop wrapper insider and there were no screws for the stand. The cellophane for the screen was missing, but no noticeable scratches. I had to run all over on the day of our Christmas party with my bro to find screws as this was a gift for the parents. The base of the stand was also cracked. The TV still stands up fine, but it the inspection on returned items needs to get better. I have had similar experience in the past.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't come on.
Reviews.Author: Otto Olson
Reviews.Content: I contacted Vizio and they asked me if I plugged it in to an outlet with power. Duh....yupyup. So much for tech support. They refered me to a repair facility in my state that had a voice recording. I left the case # and all the pertinent info but they never contacted me in the time frame the recording stated. Very pissed. I emailed Amazon about the situation but haven't heard from them either. This is supposed to be a Christmas present for my wife along with a subscription to Amazon Prime which we can't use now either. Will it be in use by Christmas????? So much for the A-Z guarantee. I'll have a lot of trouble recommending Amazon to my friends and family from now on. So long.

Reviews.Title: OK TV
Reviews.Author: Christon Dyer
Reviews.Content: Not the best tv ever... apps dont work great all the time.  remote is super small and sometimes doesnt work.  picture quality is good and I normally really like vizio, probably wont choose this again.

Reviews.Title: Great 24" SmartTV, but a crappy remote
Reviews.Author: Lycanthropy "G.v.P"
Reviews.Content: Pros: Matte screen (limited reflection), front LED light goes off during use so no annoying lights, perfect trim around screen so you can hold the TV while moving it without smudging the screen, lightweight design (10 lbs.), small footprint (easy snap on, screw in, base), Wi-Fi for price point is unbeatable, quick and easy setup and registration.Cons: Power cord is very short, remote buttons all have a plastic click feel to it (will give your hand a workout if you use Netflix or the like), audio isn't great (but pretty decent for price point).After reading the reviews for the Samsung UN22F5000 22-Inch 1080p 60Hz Slim LED HDTV I decided to go with the VIZIO E-Series E241i-A1 24-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED Smart HDTV (tilted base).  I was eying the Samsung 22" at a price point of about $177 (definitely don't buy it for over $200 if you're in the market) and I felt the reviews for the Vizio hit me harder, especially when I read about the matte screen.Some might not mind about reflection/glare off a TV set, especially for the bigger sets if you are well far away from the screen.  For smaller screens, I prefer not to see my face while I watch DVDs and the like!  If you stare into the Vizio 24" screen you see kind of like a shadow of yourself, which is a lot more appealing to me.  The snap/screw on stand makes it so you can fit the TV just about anywhere, the sound quality is decent for its price point, and--one of my favorite things--the LED indicator light on the front turns OFF during use, which leaves nothing but you, the darkness, and the picture!One thing I want to throw out there for first time users, when you go to setup your TV and you get to the network password, press the OK button on your remote to get access to different characters like letters.  I had to search for that on the Internet because I was a bit puzzled at first.  The remote itself feels very cheap, but there are a lot of handy shortcut buttons despite the cheap, clicky feel (amazon, netflix, and m-go button on top).I have not and won't use this as an actual TV (a 55-incher is doing that job) but instead planned to use it as an optional computer monitor (HDMI), Netflix, and to play console video games (A/V input).  The TV has a VGA (the blue computer port) and HDMI input, and I'm waiting on the HDMI cord (the TV didn't come with any cords outside the power cord).  For the price point, this cord by Amazon seems to be the best: AmazonBasics High-Speed HDMI Cable  (25 feet/7.62 Meters)-Supports Ethernet, 3D, and Audio Return [Newest Standard].  I also decided to buy this remote per a comment on the reviews for the Vizio line: New! Original VIZIO XRV1TV Qwerty keyboard remote for M420SV M470SV M550SV M420SL M470SL M550SL M420SV M470SV M550SV M370SR M420SR M420KD E551VA internet TV---30 days warranty!.  I'm really glad I did, because using the left/right keys is a chore, and I am looking forward to a QWERTY.So far all I have done has been Netflix (Nosferatu) and Anchorman (DVD using A/V).  Sound/video wise--for the price point--I'm very happy with the TV!Update 12/2013: Have the HDMI cord now and the TV works great as optional computer monitor.  The WiFi on the TV gives me up to 720 HD via Netflix, but my computer's network adapter is a bit more stable.  After some more use, everything seems to run fairly well.  Waiting on the QWERTY control now.Update #2 12/2013: Have the QWERTY now, as described earlier.  This remote is SO much better than the stock remote that comes with the 24" Vizio!  The buttons do not click, everything is smooth, and the QWERTY on the back is great.  The only thing that is kind of tricky is opening the battery compartment, but you won't have to do that too often.  If you get the 24" VIZIO I highly recommend you spend a little extra and get the New! Original VIZIO XRV1TV Qwerty keyboard remote for M420SV M470SV M550SV M420SL M470SL M550SL M420SV M470SV M550SV M370SR M420SR M420KD E551VA internet TV---30 days warranty!.

Reviews.Title: Very Very Happy
Reviews.Author: James Lincoln
Reviews.Content: So far so good. I love this TV. The picture quality is great.... and setting it up was simple. I bought a 42inch plasma about 4 years ago for 4x what I paid for this TV. I feel much better about this purchase than I did back then. An awesome value. The only thing missing is Bluetooth. :(

Reviews.Title: nice tv
Reviews.Author: dennis fisher
Reviews.Content: took a little while to get here.it did arrive in great shape & it is a fantastic unit.picture is better than expected...

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Jordan
Reviews.Content: Little disappointed it isn't true 120hz refresh. I got it for 450 so I can't really complain though. After a few tweaks the picture looks great.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal and Great Quality
Reviews.Author: Jas Sangha
Reviews.Content: Awesome product! Great picture and even better price! Couldn't beat the quality that Vizio offers. Smart TV function is really convienent and fun to use. 2,000,000:1 Contrast Ratio FYI.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Salazar
Reviews.Content: I have now had this TV for a few months and absolutely love it! I don't know a lot about TVs so if you are super interested in the specs I can't help you out but I can tell you that I got a great price and was able to set up the whole TV and SMART capabilities in about 15min and haven't had a problem since. The picture and sound are great and I love the options to stream netflix and pandora! I read in a few previous comments that it takes a few second to start but its 2-3second so it has never bothered me. The light comes on right away so you can see it has turned on and the picture is just after that. Overall I have been extremely satisfied with this purchase it was more than worth the $$$

Reviews.Title: Good TV, Better Price
Reviews.Author: Meegus
Reviews.Content: The Vizio 39" smart TV was a perfect give for a great price.  It is very light & easy to put together.  The picture is great and the Netflix app is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: Not a Bad TV
Reviews.Author: mfrazier
Reviews.Content: I got this for $449 the week of Black Friday. It's well worth the price that I paid for it. However, at it's current price ($648), I would probably buy the Vizio M Series for around the same price. I never bought a Vizio product before. I thought that they were junk. I was pleasantly surprised by this tv. I bought the $50 Squaretrade warranty as well just in case.  Out of the box, the picture isn't horrible, but if you do a quick search online you can find sites that tell you the best settings for this particular model. That made the picture a lot better.  Overall, I'll give it a thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: Blacks: A, Color A-, Sharpness: B+, Motion blur: C, Backlight and diffuser F, Sound, C+.  Needs calibration out of the box.
Reviews.Author: Kitty Purry
Reviews.Content: Picked this up from a local store, was VERY disappointed.  I'm coming from a 5 yr. old high end Samsung CCFL LCD for comparison.  The BF price was low but not worth the poor picture so I returned it.Out of the box, the calibration was way off.  Skin looked pink and green.  After some calibration, good blacks and colors vs. the old Samsung.  I wanted a new TV to get better blacks and this had it.  Turn off those horrible coloring and contrast shifting options - they change the picture consistency too much.  Colors: A-, Blacks: AThe Vizio looked slightly softer side by side - the old TV appeared to be a tiny bit sharper when pixel peeping.  Nothing too noticeable in casual viewing so not a big deal, I don't know why.  Appearance of sharpness: B+The bad: Backlight: F.  It was reasonably bright but it had some major issues: major vignetting, (dark shadows in the 4 corners) - if you go to the local big box store, you will see vignetting on some displays.  This effect can be fun on your instagram selfie, horrible on a TV.  This should be an auto F but there was more.This display also had a very inconsistent backlight.  I don't know how they make something so simple so bad.  My old TV has very consistent diffusing of the backlight and it uses old school CCFL lamps.  Backlit LED are supposed to have local dimming and no "flashlight" or clouding effect that some edge lit LED have.  It wasn't too noticeable during the day but during night, there was clearly a thin white glow at the very top, lighter vertical bands on the right side, and lighter cloudy areas on the left side.  On a black screen like credits, between commercials, or dark scenes, this was clearly visible.Motion blur: C.  Noticeable but it seems like most LCD at this price point are about the same.The base mount does not swivel but was sturdy enough.  No real problems there or with overall build quality.  It was a plastic shell-I judge on picture not the case.Sound is better than expected but not anything special, C+.  My old TV's speakers sounded like voices were coming out of a tin can.  These sounded way better but obviously not close to a soundbar.  Don't buy a flat screen expecting good sound so C is average for these.  After a few minutes I shut them off and only used the soundbar anyways.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing.
Reviews.Author: ktk
Reviews.Content: It's a very high quality T.V. Excellent picture and a nice size. The problem with it is that the wifi card has a range of 30 feet. That means we can use none of the smart T.V. aps that we bought it for. It is disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV
Reviews.Author: Ennis Trimble
Reviews.Content: More features than I had anticipated.  It was an great buy, especially being WiFi capable. Quality of the hardware is excellent and very easy to setup out of the box.  It has plugs for every extended purpose built-in.

Reviews.Title: BUY
Reviews.Author: thrasher
Reviews.Content: Perfect buy, the apps are a bit slow buy I've been able to watch some awesome hd movies off of amazon prime and was able to set up the wifi very easily. Definitely recommend buying for the price.

Reviews.Title: Good tv
Reviews.Author: Andrew Lee
Reviews.Content: the reason i purchased this TV was just for my PS3.  the size of screen about bigger then i thought.While i am playing PS3 such as GT5, Call of duty, Battle Filed 3.  It works smooth and so legs at all.120Hz is good idea to buy for gaming TV.  The specs of TV is very competitive with other competitor TVs but when lower price.I line the shipment, it came 2 day earlier  then estimate of delivery date.

Reviews.Title: thumbs up
Reviews.Author: melanie walker
Reviews.Content: this tv is a really good value, I like it a lot I would really recommend this tv..worth the price

Reviews.Title: TV went out first 24 hours.
Reviews.Author: K. Stephens
Reviews.Content: Back light on TV went out the first day.  Can only hear the sound and 99% of picture is blacked out.  Can barely see what is going on.  Don't have the enormous box to send it back to Amazon.  Vizio is sending a replacement in 8 - 12 days.  Not worth the money saved on the basic TV.

Reviews.Title: Amazing quality at this price point.
Reviews.Author: Brian Y
Reviews.Content: Great price, and amazing quality at that price. Just got it Monday, but I'm loving it already. It was super easy to setup, Netflix and Hulu Plus work like a charm, and the dedicated Netflix button on the remote was a nice touch IMO. I like all the preset picture settings, and can't wait to see how I really like Game Mode when I hookup the PS4 tomorrow. So far no complaints, not having the remote issue some people are talking about with some models. All in all, I'm elated with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Well worth the price!
Reviews.Author: K. Binder "BookInhaler"
Reviews.Content: Everything we expected...picture quality and sound are excellent and the connection to the internet was easily accomplished.  Now we watch streaming video in high quality whenever we have the time.  For the price it seems far and away the best value for a midsize LED HDTV.

Reviews.Title: Nice Flat Screen
Reviews.Author: Dixie Cote
Reviews.Content: I don't have alot to compare it to but, this is really quite a television. I wanted a smart TV and it has some nice features that perform well. The picture is sharp and crisp and appears bigger than its 32 inch screen. I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Very Good TV
Reviews.Author: alohabear
Reviews.Content: The last thing I had in mind was buying a TV since the LG that I owned was less than 4 years old.  Once the screen acted up it was time to search for a new one.  I started with the typical brand names like Samsung until I came across Vizio.  I was aware that they're known for their computer monitors.  They seem to have a good reputation so I decided to go with their 47" smart TV.  The installation was easy and and so far so good.  It's only been a few days but I'm hoping to get around to playing with the smart feature soon and see how easy and accessible it is to stream Netflix and Hulu.

Reviews.Title: 92 year old great aunt
Reviews.Author: Robyn
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 92 year old great aunt.  She loves it.  Very good clear screen.  She requested a new TV that was made in the USA.  This was the only one I could find.  Shes also very hard of hearing and the sound gets loud enough for her.  Great product.  Not overwhelming for her to use which is great.  Very simple.

Reviews.Title: OVERVIEW
Reviews.Author: Cynthia R.
Reviews.Content: Great quality, very impressed with how clear the pictures come in . One dislike is the remote could be a little bit bigger

Reviews.Title: Great with a few tweaks
Reviews.Author: Nova
Reviews.Content: This TV has great images and solid sound; it's also got pretty much all the main features that you need in a smart tv such as streaming services and local digital file playback through USB. There were two issues that I had with the unit that I was able to fix pretty easily. First was that, as some reviewers have noted, the picture out of the box would get brighter and dimmer pretty often that it was distracting. So I went into the picture settings and changed them: I think, if I remember correctly, that i turned off the "adaptive luma" setting to get rid of the brightening and dimming effect. The other issue I had was that the device played back avi and mp4 files through usb  but not mkv files. So, like another reviewer suggested, i just changed the names of the mkv files to mp4 and boom, they played great. So, all in all I really am quite pleased with the machine and its value.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: G. Gieschen
Reviews.Content: I love the picture quality and the price was very competitive. I would strongly recommend this TV.  It is a great product.

Reviews.Title: An excellent TV at a bargain price
Reviews.Author: mark two "Douggie" "darwinist"
Reviews.Content: I set this TV up with advice from a previous reviewer and it was picture and sound perfect (I incorporated a Bose 2.1 system which gives great depth to the overall sound). It gives an enhanced field of view and has a non reflective screen surface. This TV is a major bargain and will stand up against any 1080P machine. This is the second Visio LED TV I have installed and cannot fault either.

Reviews.Title: picture went to vertical lines in first day
Reviews.Author: blank_by_design
Reviews.Content: Nice picture.  While it lasted.Now working with tech support under 90 day warranty.  Getting ready to call Amazon.Amazon replaced the TV and it was painless.  I have a UPS storefront nearby.  Good experience.  New TV working fine.Interestingly: when you buy stuff online, you may or may not void the warranty.  Depends on whether the seller and the fulfiller are not the same company.  It's a whole new level of caveat emptor.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E470I-AO
Reviews.Author: catchemall447
Reviews.Content: Wow!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!FANTASTIC!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  PREVIOUS REVIEWS VERY HELPFUL,  WHEN FIRST TURNED ON THEIR WAS A WHITEOUT OF PART OF THE SCREEN,  THEN I REMEMBERED SOMEONE SAYING TO DISABLE THE AUTO BRIGHTNESS FEATURE,  WHAM PICTURE IS EXCELLENT.  TRIED SOME OF THE SETTINGS OTHERS HAD POSTED THEY WERE RIGHT ON  VERY CLOSE TO THE FACTORY SETTINGS.  SOUND---  YOU DONT NEED A SOUND BAR , VOLUME IS EXCELLENT  WITH LG HAD TO RUN SOUNDBAR TO HEAR THE AUDIO,  NOT SO WITH THIS SET.  IN FACT I ORDERED THE LG FIRST UNTIL I DISCOVERED IT ONLY HAD PROVISIONS FOR OPTICAL AUDIO, CANCELED ORDER AND PURCHASED THIS VIZIO,  MAN DID I DO THE RIGHT THING.  VIDEO IS OUTSTANDING. VOLUME WILL RUN YOU OUT OF THE ROOM.  VERY EASY TO CONNECT,  NO PROBLEM AT ALL WITH MY NETGEAR ROUTER.  SO,SO VERY PLEASED WITH THIS SET.Cant wait until they increase memory, add web browser, bluetooth keyboard and mouse. POW.Wont it be nice then.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Jonas Desrosiers
Reviews.Content: It is pretty great.  Love that it automatically connects to the internet.  Netflix, etc.  Just wonderful.  I love it a lot.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: eranie
Reviews.Content: Replaced another flat screen that is installed in a cabinet in our kitchen.  The old TV had side and/or rear speakers and the sound was awful because it was contained on 5 sides - this TV has front speakers and solved our sound problems for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Mosty good
Reviews.Author: M. Stephens "estephe928"
Reviews.Content: The only thing I don't like about this tv is that every so often it makes me "reboot".  Never had that problem with my other set.  Otherwise, I love the picture quality.  Sound is not 100%, but for the money I have no complaints on that end.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E470i-A0 47-inch 1080p 120Hz LED Smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: Mark in TN
Reviews.Content: Great TV all around! Went to a local store to compare picture quality, and this TV had the best. The sound is sufficient, but I have a surround system ready to hook up. Has all of the features I wanted in a Smart TV. Couldn't beat the price. Very satisfied with this TV and thinking about buying a Vizio 55"!!! (Note: Vizio is made in the USA!)

Reviews.Title: VIZIO Smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: DeAnna Livingston
Reviews.Content: We love the VIZIO Smart TV we ordered from Amazon.  We were impressed how quickly Amazon delivered it to our home.  It was very easy to install!  We are enjoying the TV very much!  We recommend buying through Amazon to all our friends!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the TV, great picture quality, shipped very fast and it looks cool on my wall. The menu is a bit funky and the remote could be nicer. I use it for my main PC monitor for gaming and movies so I added a set of speakers but the TV speakers work just fine and sound good. I would recommend this TV to anyone looking for a mid-range TV

Reviews.Title: Not a very good quality product
Reviews.Author: Mauricio Toledo
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV thinking that it would have a good picture quality, but it was disappointing to see that it does not have a good quality picture. Also, there is no way for me to use a bluetooth keyboard or other type keyboard and it does not come with a keyboard on its remote control. So, entering information over the internet browsers is really painful through the screen keyboard by using the remote control that comes with the TV. Very frustrating...

Reviews.Title: DOA
Reviews.Author: bjordan61
Reviews.Content: This product was almost DOA when delivered...could not connect to my wireless network, then DIED completely after about three hours.  I was able to set it up with my cable box, BluRay player, and get everything working together other than the wireless, but it DIED after only being plugged in and working for about three hours or so.  Called Vizio customer service and after troubleshooting they confirmed it was DEAD and suggested an exchange.  Called Amazon and reported the issues...Long story short, let Amazon deal with it.  Customer Service is great; they issued a refund and I'll trust the bad reports I've heard about Vizio products more before I order again.

Reviews.Title: Defective, doesn't even turn on!!!!
Reviews.Author: Michel Eissa
Reviews.Content: After assembling it, tried for an HOUR to turn on. Called the customer support and the tech guy from VIZIO didn't help much ended up for replacement but I will return it today to Amazon and get my my money back. It was a bad experience as I was very hopeful about this TV, maybe it is just my bad luck...

Reviews.Title: Great value!
Reviews.Author: john wathen
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased with this purchase for our Daughter's room.  Easy to setup, lightweight, user friendly.  Picture quality is fabulous along with all of the wifi options.  The only thing is it leans back just a little bit so we put something under the stand to make it more upright for her height (view). The other bonus in our opinion (we own 3 other larger Vizio TVs) is that on this one the speakers are on the bottom front.  Hope to get another one for the guest room.

Reviews.Title: Great TV but it is not the one I am looking for.
Reviews.Author: LA Wings Inc. "LA Wings"
Reviews.Content: It is a great TV but it is too small for PC use within 1024x768. Very light and great quailty. No DVI support.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price. Choose mount carefully
Reviews.Author: Roby
Reviews.Content: Good value TV.The only thing I really want to talk about is the mount. Most flat screen TVs are VESA compatible. Since this TV isnt that big, it has the same mounting holes as a computer monitor (holes in a small square pattern about 7" wide). I bought a mount that was designed for a 40"+ TV, so it was a pain to mount. I managed, but it took a little bit of finagling. If you are planning on mounting this TV, make sure you buy a mount like this:VideoSecu Articulating Motion Monitor ML12Binstead of this:B0012S4APKThe mount is the same size as the TV and you can see it sticking out of the side a little bit. not terrible, but not beautiful either.Basically, be mindful of the mount that you buy.**Edit**The sound was periodically increasing and decreasing in volume, seemingly at random intervals. I toggled the "smart sound" setting off and that fixed the problem.

Reviews.Title: Excellence
Reviews.Author: R. Rorie
Reviews.Content: That's what I've come to expect from Amazon.  This tv is just what I needed for my bedroom, it's not too large nor is it too small.  I needed help from a vizio technician, which only took a few minutes, and it was up and running.  I'd highly recommend this television to the bargain hunters of the world.  Charge on!

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, but streaming apps need work
Reviews.Author: T. Romanowski
Reviews.Content: Amazon Prime Streaming is not good on this TV, the "watchlist" option is not on this TV so you have to manually search every time you want to watch something you already added to your watchlist queue.  I have another Sony that has the watchlist and works great.The option to stream from a device on the same network to this TV also does not work, but works on another SmartTV I have with no problem.  Bought this TV for my bedroom, but ended up returning because of these issues.  If you're looking for a lower price TV with great picture, this is a good buy.  If you are looking for streaming options, I would keep looking....

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted!!
Reviews.Author: Margaret Arnold
Reviews.Content: It was really easy to set up and is easy to use :) I love how easy it is to use Netflix and Amazon and then switch back to regular t.v. I absolutely love it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Jan A "Jan A"
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV. The picture is very nice, sound quality is decent. I really like that Netflix is a key on the remote, and that the TV is wi-fi enabled with the built in 802.11. Only took about 5 minutes to setup and maybe another ten to get all of the on-air digital channels loaded (about 70 in my area). I'm pretty happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Cannot get Wifi connection
Reviews.Author: K. Baker "Southernmost Shef"
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for a few months now and it is about 20 feet from my modem/router. There is only a thin half wall separating it from the box, yet is does not pick up the signal. I can dit in the same area with my laptop and get a very strong signal, but the TV has one small red bar, not enough to generate a connection. I have tried calling Vizio but there does not seem to be a number for tech support. I basically, have a very fancy looking, but otherwise very ordinary, flatscreen. :(Quick update. After several very frustrating days, I finally solved this issue by unplugging the TV from the outlet. Then pressing and holding down the power button for about 30 seconds, while the TV is unplugged. On start up, after a slow start, it seemed to pick up the signal, and for the last 2 days has worked fine.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Great Value!!!!!
Reviews.Author: k_tree
Reviews.Content: This TV was SO easy to setup and get everything running.  The Instruction Manual is clear and easy to follow.  It connected to my WiFi network without any problem and is working fine.  I haven't fully explored the VIA (Smart TV) functions yet, but the ones I have tried work beautifully.  The picture is clear and the sound is as good as any TV (I plan to add speakers soon).  It connected to my Roku 2 without any problem, and to my antenna system.  I do not use cable, so cannot comment on that.I am completely satisfied and highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: pugly
Reviews.Content: I own a 49 inch vizio that i bought last year and i have not had any problems, so i bought this one for my cabin and was not disappointed.  Great picture and easy to set up and use.  When i need another tv, i will first look at vizio, attractively priced and excellent quality, so keep up the good work vizio and dont blow it because once the quality goes down, your customers go away, sometimes for good!

Reviews.Title: Great purchase!
Reviews.Author: jedimom3109
Reviews.Content: I love this tv!  It is a little small for a living room, but it still does the trick...Thanks to a wireless router, Hulu-plus and Netflix, I am not missing a thing. The internet apps allow me to watch most shows in clear HD. My daughter had just bought a 32" tv from Wal-Mart and stated that she wishes she had got this one instead. BTW Wal-Mart didn't have this model in stock at my store, so I looked on Amazon and got a cheaper price to boot! Yea!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: J. Patterson
Reviews.Content: Great TV.. I dont know why there are any bad reviews here.We bought this because we needed something for the baby's room for when my wife is nursing and I am trying to sleep... it keeps her awake early in the morning and late at night.  We did a lot of research and checked out a lot of TVs and settled on this one mainly because of the size for the price (not to mention we have two older and bigger Vizios).Here is what I know...1) The software works flawlessly and set-up was simple.2) The picture looks great.  I dont know about all these things people are talking about (specs on the TV)... I just know what I see.. and it looks great.  That is all I care about.The sound is great, too.  Sure, it isn't like my more expensive TVs - but it certainly does the job and is more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: Weak Wifi
Reviews.Author: Joi
Reviews.Content: I wanted a smart tv for my bedroom and this one was the perfect size for my space.  It does not do a good job of picking up the wifi signal (I have the best wifi that AT&T; offers).  The router is less than thirty feet from the tv on the other side of a half wall.  I was told by Vizio technical support the LAN mechanism that picks up wifi is not very strong in the TV.  I explanined that my lap top, and tablet pick up the signal in that room.  The technical support guy said the mechanism in the TV is not as good as the one found in tablets and lap tops.  So, if you purchase this TV, be sure the router is located close to it.

Reviews.Title: Meets the needs
Reviews.Author: Queen Mary "Queen Mary"
Reviews.Content: I like Vizios because they are reasonably priced, especially when you consider that TVs are little more than large monitors.  Some visio models take too much time to turn on and find the signal, but that's the worse thing I can say about them.  They do what they're supposed to do and they don't cost a fortune.

Reviews.Title: Pefect spare tv
Reviews.Author: Papa Robert
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for the bedroom and as a spare in case my cable goes out (it's connected to the rooftop antenna). Wi-Fi consideration was also given as I subscribe to Netflix. Other than the slow start-up time the tv works just fine. It doesn't get much use. I've watched it probably a total of 4 times.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous value
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth E. Casper
Reviews.Content: Super fast shipping, easy set up and unbelievable picture.  I can see detail I never expected to see from a small tv.  Perfect for my small craft room.  Have recommended to all my friends!!

Reviews.Title: tv with internet capibility
Reviews.Author: Bill England
Reviews.Content: I like the tv  everything fine except the mute button on remote doesn't work  which I use a lot  I would prefer the word mute instead of the symbol

Reviews.Title: Takes some getting used to
Reviews.Author: mishy
Reviews.Content: Im not sure if its because it is HD or ifits simply glare off the windows or whatthe deal is - but the picture quality forsome movies on Netflix when we first gotthis was horrible.I have always liked LCD because of howclear and crisp it is, that is what I thoughtthis would be like.Great value, but you really do get what youpay for in the end.Its a good temp tv - but im certainly goingto spend the additional 500 bucks next timefor extreme picture quality and FULL wifi.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Peter W.
Reviews.Content: The wifi set up was great. The tv found y network immediately.The rest of the setup was easy.The picture is very good.I would recommend this tv.It has a narrower frame than some other TVA this size, so it is mostly tv. You get a lot of tv in a small space.I ordered it here at Amazon, really great price: http://amzn.to/11bJPBu

Reviews.Title: Need a narrow 32" set?
Reviews.Author: TSPORT "TSPORT"
Reviews.Content: I needed to find a flat screen TV to fit inside the doors of our existing entertainment center and still let us close the doors if need be (wife's preference). I wanted a "smart" TV to eliminate multiple remote controls laying around (Roku & TV & Digital Conveter Box, old TV was a tube job). After much research, this Vizio is the only 32" smart TV that would fit (barely). I prefer Samsung but their 32" set is about an inch wider and would not fit the space. The only 32" TV I found that is narrower is the JVC EMT32 and that is only about an eighth of an inch narrower and is not a smart TV. Dropping to a 29" set would have been too small. We have had for several weeks now. Good picture quality. The speakers sound very tinny and annoying. Played with the audio settings several times, still can not get a decent sound from them. Too little bass and too much treble. Have wired into home stereo system with the RCA jacks and can play TV audio through that if we want and it sounds much better. The 720p picture is fine for this size set. I do not feel we are compromising there. As others state, the remote is small but I don't mind the size. What I do mind is that the buttons "click" when you push them. If you are channel surfing,this gets old. No need for an audible confirmation that I pushed the button. The wireless feature was not working well for us due to router about 30 feet away on a different floor in our home. Roku box had no issue at same distance. I have since run an ethernet cable from router through walls/ceiling to the TV directly and the Netflix streaming is fine now (no different than with the Roku wirelessly). Have added a few extra channels through the app store and they are fine (Mostly use Netflix but also Crackle).  I fired Verizon pay TV and we use antenna and streaming. The free TV via antenna is broadcast in hi-def 720 and 1080 by the major stations and looks great on this set.  Summary: Crappy speakers, noisy remote and weak wireless, everything else is fine. If flawless wireless performance is important to you, you might want to pass. Smart Apps working fine with a wired connection for us.I will update the review in a few months.*** 6 month update 12-7-2013 ***Nothing much to add since the original review. Daily use since purchased. I need to get a soundbar or external speakers. The tinny built in ones are lame. One other nitpick is that I feel this TV takes too long to come on. After you turn it on, it takes about 15-20 seconds or more before you have picture and sound.  Overall, still very happy with purchase and would buy again knowing what I know now. Very good value for a 32" Smart TV (I bought it at a warehouse club for $279.95).

Reviews.Title: Defective Product Line - AVOID
Reviews.Author: Paul Bismarck
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV and originally was very satisfied.....for the first few days.  However, then the TV started to randomly dim during streaming, or got completely black when watching cable if not completely shut off.  As I began to investigate the potential issues I discovered that while Amazon still had the product in stock for shipping they halted the sale of this product because of customer complaints.  Additionally, a friend, to whom I recommended purchasing a 42" version of the same TV is experiencing the same issues (however, it was purchased from a different retailer and not Amazon).  Vizio's support was extremely unhelpful, and while yes, Amazon it sending a replacement - which means I'll just have to see if the same issues occur - I still have no answers if this line of Visio's Smart TVs is defective or if these 2 incidences are somehow a very strange coincidence.  I would recommend avoiding this brand and look at the other leading manufacturers of smart/internet-ready TVs.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Leslie
Reviews.Content: Just what we expected and just as advertised.  We love the picture and it is easy to adjust to fit individual tastes.  No complaint so far except that if you plan to do a lot of searching on the internet apps I would suggest you purchase the qwerty equipped remote.  They should just include that really...

Reviews.Title: Sorry I Bought It!!!
Reviews.Author: Beach Writer "Cookie"
Reviews.Content: I love the smaller Vizio I had, but this 50" has poor color quality and takes quite a while to start up.I've had it long enough now that if the color needed to be brighter and crisper it would have done so by now.I've changed the color options and it sharpened the color somewhat, but still not as nice as the 39 inch I had.I think I probably just got a less than stellar unit, but it still is disappointing. Wish I had my other one back.

Reviews.Title: Up on the wall
Reviews.Author: cam
Reviews.Content: We reviewed our options and waited to but this tv. Glad we finally got it! We mounted it to the wall (I recommend cheetah mounts) and the picture is fantastic. Complements our living room big time! I love that you can go online so easily;, netflix, etc. are right on the remote!As other reviewers mentioned, the remote is a bit hollow feeling for such a pricy tv. But I'm glad we purchased this and would do it again. JUST GET IT!! ;)

Reviews.Title: Poor internet connectivity
Reviews.Author: Matt K.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this solely for the internet apps. I wanted to watch Netflix / Amazon Instant while working out. This TV does not do that well at all. It would constantly lose connectivity or would need to rebuffer all the time when it did load a video. At first I thought that the TV was possibly too far away from my wireless router so I tested it by sitting it right next to the router. The problems persisted. Vizio tech support tried to tell me that it was my AT&T; Uverse router. And that very well could be the case, but that router works fine with my other devices in house that connect via wireless (desktop PC, two laptops, two iphones, kindle, nook). Then Vizio told me I was out of luck once I told them I'm not going buy a new router and/or switch ISPs just because their TV doesn't work with the one I have. Long story short, I would not recommend this TV. Even if you don't think you'll use the Smart apps, there are other TV's out there without those features that cost less and are made by more reliable companies.

Reviews.Title: It just OK
Reviews.Author: Bruce
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is just fair. My 42" is far better. I find the "smart" tv element is nothing more than a sales channel to sell you more. ThinkingI could access my HBO GO,  I was in for a big surprise. The facebook app sucks.

Reviews.Title: its a nice  enough tv
Reviews.Author: yvette  freeman
Reviews.Content: it a nice tv as far as the picture quality goes but the sturdiness is questionable picture this....it fells like one of those fake display tv that you touch and its real light cause there is nothing in it ...yet its fully functional the first one i order  arrived DAMAGE  it did not have any visible damage but when i set it up it was damage  they packing quality is very poor just the 4 corner form which doesn't really protect it if the driver doesn't pack it correctly  my second one arrive without any hitch i will add that my laptop is heavier and feels more sturdy...i purchased this item because i was having visitor ...i currently own the Sony bravo 46in 3d tv which i purcased over 2yrs ago and there is no comparison ..nest time if i make a purchase i will go in store to get a better look and feel then i will come back to amazon to purchase

Reviews.Title: Great TV if you don't want to use the Netflix feature!
Reviews.Author: Miles Miller "Miles"
Reviews.Content: This TV was delivered January 15, 2013 and although it was easy enough to set up it no longer works very well using the built in Netflix function. In the beginning it would load fine, but now it takes longer and when you select a program to watch it stops during the program and tries to reload the program, which it sometimes does.  Other times it tells us to try later or check with Netflix.com.  It's NOT Netflix that's the problem!  When we go to our other TV, which doesn't have the built in Netflix feature, the program load and we're able to watch it through without interruption!  This TV is apparently too SMART for it's own good!  I just ordered a Roku LT through Amazon so we can use this Vizio family room TV to watch Netflix again!THESE ADDITIONAL REVIEW COMMENTS ARE BEING WRITTEN ON JUNE 7. 2013. After the Roku arrived I set it up and Netflix plays beautifully, without an issue, so our problem is with the Vizio SMART TV and definitely NOT Netflix. I also purchased from Amazon, in addition to the RoKu LT Streaming Player ($49.95), a Portta PET0301S 3x1 HDMI Switcher ($6.75), so we can easily switch between Comcast cable, our RoKu, and a DVD player and it WORKS FLAWLESSLY! Please keep in mind we are satisfied with the Vizio TV's picture and hook-up feathers, but not the SMART TV aspect, and would not purchase it again.

Reviews.Title: Best TV yet!
Reviews.Author: Cynthia McDonald "mccindy"
Reviews.Content: This TV is fabulous.  Same price as cheaper TVs without smart functions.  The picture quality is great, no blurring with fast action.  I also really like that there are four HDMI inputs on the back so I can connect all my gadgets and get the best possible picture quality.  Xbox gaming looks great! Sound is plenty loud enough for the family room.  It does take a while to turn on, but it's really only a few more seconds than other TVs.  Love it!

Reviews.Title: Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Bridgett James
Reviews.Content: The unit is small but for a Smart TV the price is pretty good and it meets my needs for the moment.

Reviews.Title: Average quality for Vizio
Reviews.Author: Dave V.
Reviews.Content: This unit arrived with a cracked frame. Not terribly noticeable, but frustrating nonetheless. Amazon customer service credited my account for $50, which was a good compromise. Picture quality is fine, better with HDMI cable and HD signal. I like Vizio, have 3 Vizio TVs, but nothing spectacular about this unit.

Reviews.Title: Nothing special
Reviews.Author: Kathryn Archie
Reviews.Content: The tv was not all I expected it to be. The tv would be better with a browser, just seems like an ordinary tv. Too limited with the apps you can have on the tv. Need more variety.

Reviews.Title: Big dissapointment
Reviews.Author: C. Marriott
Reviews.Content: This tv has a good picture. The wireless functionality is almost useless. With five bars and a 300 Mbps router 5 feet in clear view, the wireless keeps dropping. When it drops the tv locks up and you have to cycle power to it to reconnect. All of my other devices of different manufacture; two different cells phones, a wireless printer, a laptop, all work with each other at the same time, on this router flawlessly (and yes my router has the latest firmware). However this tv does not. I talked to Vizio tech support and they want to blame my router that has worked flawlessly for the past two years. The vizio tech support suggested that I drop my network encryption and see if that helps. If I cannot have my wireless network protected and use this tv on it, then the tv is worthless to me. Returned.Also something else to think about: the "Vizio apps" are Yahoo apps. Consider the current financial situation at Yahoo Inc. They have been on shaky ground for years, and now they are scaling back support for many of their services. I would not be surprised if these apps are useless in a year because they make Yahoo no money and they are no longer supported.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality picture
Reviews.Author: jayss
Reviews.Content: Hello I bought this tv for a bedroom which I figured picture quality wasn't a big deal.  After the tv was set up I Initially was not impressed with the picture quality.  After attempting to use the smart tv to watch Netflix, I was very upset with the tv...  The tv would connect to my wifi stream maybe 2 minute of movie then stop streaming..  Wifi was connected but not Internet..  Signal showed full strength but nothing...  Turn tv off then back on and the same thing.  2 minutes then nothing...  I toke tv off the wall and sent back!!!!  Bought a Samsung and the picture is great...  Not a smart tv but gave up on the idea..

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this TV. I have had it about a month and wouldn't change it. Perfect size too!

Reviews.Title: loyal Vizio customer, but this is just OK
Reviews.Author: Kirby34
Reviews.Content: have three vizio tv's in my house and this is the latest.  typical easy setup just like other vizio's.  numerous inputs which are fine for my folks, audiophiles probably wish it had more.  They aren't very accessible, that's always bugged me about vizio's.  The weird thing is the color/tint - the remote makes it very easy to change to different types of video settings (sports, movie, gaming, etc), but it's just not super crisp.  And it's a nit, but it takes forever for the TV to pull up the cable content, like I'm listening to a TV show for 15-20 seconds before I actually see it.  All in all, for the price you can't beat Vizio, but have to have reasonable standards when buying this one.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture, love the internet apps, TERRIBLE sound
Reviews.Author: Goldengate "Goldengate"
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this TV - a great price and loaded with features.  The Internet Apps work great - I was able to not only watch Netflix and Amazon with no problems, but also was able to access movies on my computer network.  Yes, Vizio is DLNA compliant!  I had a hard time finding that information online and in fact found conflicting info so I just ordered the TV knowing I could return it to Amazon if it weren't DLNA compliant.  Very happy.I am used a wired ethernet connection so can't speak to the wireless concerns expressed in other reviews.The picture is amazingly bright and clear.... really puts my older Sonia Bravia to shame.  And I love the minimal frame... all you see is the picture, not the TV.  I watched a Star Trek episode with fast action and stars streaking by and I didn't see any pixelation or other issues... just a wonderful picture.Now THE SOUND... wow... Really, Vizio?  From the reviews I expected the sound to be average but wasn't prepared for this... the sound is actually TERRIBLE... think AM radio 1975.  Whenever anyone on TV says an "S" it's like they have a lisp when you listen on this TV.  I didn't expect to listen to music on this TV but thought that at least dialogue should/would be clear.  Wrong.  They used cheap speakers and it shows.  So now I am looking into a Vizio sound bar.... so if you don't have external speakers, this TV is about $100 more than you see it here as you will need some sort of sound solution.  All in all then the price begins to compare to the Samsungs so I'm wondering if I should have just bought one of those since they are top of the line and all the reviews laud their sound.The remote is your typical cheap remote... not very well laid out and not very intuitive.Overall with this TV they invested on a great picture and the internet capability...the rest they didn't and rightly so - some will use their own sound systems and their own universal remotes, so why make everyone pay for upgraded features.Aside from the sound, I am very happy with this TV.UPDATE 4/11: after some more use, I decided i couldn't stand the sound anymore... and also the TV was freezing up and had to be unplugged a couple of times to "reboot"... I decided to go with the new Samsung 32" Samsung UN32F5500 32-Inch 1080p 60Hz Slim Smart LED HDTV and am VERY happy with it!

Reviews.Title: This is a great TV!
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: I am using this TV with a digital antenna and the picture is beautiful.  It connected with the wifi easily, and the apps work well.  Sound is good for a TV, if you really want a home theatre experience then you are going to connect external speakers anyway.  Also Vizio is the most energy efficient brand.  Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Poor picture
Reviews.Author: Jon Bjornson MD
Reviews.Content: Picture poor with poor resolution, color and clarity.  Settings  to adjust picture are too numerous to make sense. I tried to refine picture with "menu" setup---not helpful and time consuming.  I would advise avoiding this TV set.

Reviews.Title: Networked apps useless
Reviews.Author: David Rader
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived on time and was a breeze to set up for cable.  Used HDMI connection to Xfinity's HD cable box.  The cable box took about 15 min to download the channel selections.  Picture on the Vizio is great.  Very happy.Problem is the flaky WiFi connection.  The network connection tests fine from the setup pane.  But the Vizio apps report only intermittent connectivity.  Further, there is no way to delete the bloatware, freemium apps (free trials for 30 days).  Tried for two days to download Pandora with no success.  Will continue with the Macintosh and PC access to Pandora.Vizio's Yahoo apps insist on a Yahoo sign in.  Other apps have their own sign in. Not worth the bother.Bottom line:  I wouldn't pay the premium for the apps and network connection.  Basically unusable.  Would recommend the Roku box with connection to the TV

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Tad
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this TV. The picture is great, as is the wifi and internet apps. I didnt know how to change the backlighting settings and after talking to a technical service person (By the way, their customer service is excellent over the phone, and based in the U.S.!!!) I figured it out. The only thing that could be improved, and this is true of all Vizio smart TVs including my 32 in one, is the speed of loading the apps. I feel like they really could improve the processor speed or whatever they are using for the internet apps.Overall, I would recommend this TV!

Reviews.Title: Great TV! Hi-Quality-Very clear picture!
Reviews.Author: David P. Simpson
Reviews.Content: I Love my TV! It was very easy to set up and begin watching all my favorite shows! The Quick Start Guide that came with the TV was helpful, but I would have been more comfortable with an owners manual. You have to go online and print it. That was very inconvinent for me since I have a very old and SLOW! computer and printer. I watch a lot of TV and have had my set for about one month now and it has performed to my expectations. I am very pleased. By the way This TV replaced a 35 year old 25 inch RCA console TV. Also I am recieving my brocast signal with a digital antena and do not have cable service. The local stations for the most part brodcast in HD and I am very pleased with the picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Works great and looks good right out of the box
Reviews.Author: Lawrence Chapman
Reviews.Content: This TV is just as good as I was hoping it would be. It was easy to get it up and working and the picture looks great right out of the box. I have made some minor adjustments to some of the menu items. The TV sound was much better than my old TV. I did purchase a Vizio VS B-202 sound bar. It sounds great in our small living room. I do not think that a sub woofer is needed in our small room.

Reviews.Title: cannot go wrong for the price.
Reviews.Author: Parsram Surujdeen
Reviews.Content: Clear picture,good built in sound system. Not bad for the price. The only problem it has is, it takes about 30 to 35 seconds to turn on. Other than this, it works just great.

Reviews.Title: It's okay.
Reviews.Author: L. Yates
Reviews.Content: Picture is not perfect, maybe because its led but it looks washed out, not a deep color. The remote is not back lit....cheap. And I thought it was going to be a full web browser but it wasn't . My fault I guess.  Tv not bad for the price

Reviews.Title: Love it so far
Reviews.Author: CJ
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to this from a nearly 20 year old CRT TV, so I can't really compare it to other flatscreen LCD/LED TVs, but I really love it so far.I thought since it's my first 'modern' TV that I might have problems figuring out how to use all the menu options and such, but it is incredibly easy to use. The size is nice, the stand is sturdy, and the picture is great.The main thing I wanted was a TV with the ability to play videos directly from a USB thumb drive, and this does that perfectly. For the price, I expected the sound to be sub-par at best, but I'm actually very satisfied with it. An audiophile might prefer an external sound system, but the sound is perfect for my purposes.I can't comment on the smart TV features because I haven't used them and don't really plan on using them. I only went with this one over cheaper non-"smart" models because of the aforementioned video from USB feature.In short, if you're looking to upgrade from an older TV to something more modern without spending an arm and a leg, this is a great deal.UPDATE: I have found one feature that I wish it had... I wish there was a way to select the exact spot you want to start from in a movie/TV show, because it seems like the only way right now is to fast forward until you get to the spot you want, which can take a very long time with a movie.Maybe there's a way to do that and I just haven't figured it out yet, but it would be incredibly helpful.

Reviews.Title: Good size TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Shane H.
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for the bedroom. It looks great and was easy to set up. For the money, I would buy one again.I bought this mounting bracket:VideoSecu Cantilever TV Wall Mount Bracket Fits 26"-58" LCD LED Plasma Display with VESA 400X400 400x300 400x200 300X300 200X200 200x100, Heavy Duty 24" Long Arm Bracket Removable Mount Adaptor Plate (black) ML550B A47Which is very heavy duty and I had the whole thing mounted and working in under an hour.+Amazon Prime app built in+Great picture+Great price-none yet. works great so far.

Reviews.Title: An ok TV.
Reviews.Author: RDUGUY
Reviews.Content: I was quite surprised out how much smaller the frame was on this tv versus my existing 32 inch.  The CNET product review was excellent.  I find that turning on the TV takes a very long time (25 seconds).  I also used to have a VGA port for linking up my laptop, now I understand this is a smart tv, but the smart tv doesn't come with a browser so it limits you to what you can watch.  I've also noticed the sounds is a bit tinty.Overall the picture quality is good, I do agree the remote and the options on the screen are small.  So for picture quality I'd probably give a 4, but based on the other items above, I lowered to 3.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: Picture is beautiful, setup is beyond easy, the interface well thought out and intuitive.  I only wish for a sleep button on the remote itself, not within the menu, and that the unit would turn on more quickly.No problems and great price.

Reviews.Title: Great product by Vizio!!!
Reviews.Author: GCerda "Salmod89"
Reviews.Content: We're really pleased with this Vizio TV. We already owned three Vizio products: two TVs and 1 Blue-ray player and haven't had any problem with any of them yet. It takes a little to load the apps but not as much as a Sony TV with full web access my brother owns. This TV is easy to setup and operate and have very good picture quality; not excellent as some Sharp models I've watched but at this lower price there's no complain. I openly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: changed my life
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: I love this tv. It's not hard to love a tv when you are finally upgrading from an old analog boob tube though. My only complaint is the remote definitely is not user friendly. And on very rare occassion, upon powering up the audio hasn't come on. A shut down and restart has always fixed it, but I admit that it makes me nervous for a new tv.

Reviews.Title: Easy installation and setup
Reviews.Author: Marshal Dillon
Reviews.Content: I bought this along with the recommended VideoSecu LCD LED TV Wall Mount. It was easy to install and setup, if you know all of your existing wireless info as well as Netflix and Hulu for example. I use the built-in wireless, with the router on the first floor, with the TV located on the second floor. The signal is strong.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: jandalton
Reviews.Content: I wanted a second tv for the bedroom. It has been wonderful. Great picture and sound. Amazon ordering and delivery were perfect. I am still trying to figure out, using basic cable, why only certain channels come in HD and others don't. I am assuming that is a Charter problem and not Vizio. My only complaint is the remote: the buttons are horizontal and narrow and you have to use a fingernail to operate them, which will probably wear out the plastic pads. Otherwise, it is a nice tv that I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: excellent value- plus 6 months update
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey H. Mcnamara "kuraki user"
Reviews.Content: Easy hook up.  Connected easily to my network.  You wont be disappointed with this purchase.  If you aren't happy with the picture out of the box, there are so many picture settings, you will surely be able to find a setting that will suit your viewing situation.  Great buy!!UPDATE 4/28/2013 - When I first turn TV on SOMETIMES there is no volume, started about 2.5 months after I received TV. I have to either have to go to settings and turn sound off the on again OR turn the TV off then on to get the sound back.  So far one reset is enough to get the sound back. The TV went from box to wall mount, so no trauma to the TV on my end. Hope it's not a sign of things to come.  I wonder if anybody else experienced this problem or I have defective unit?  Lowering my rating to 4 stars due to this condition.

Reviews.Title: Very nice tv
Reviews.Author: Puglover
Reviews.Content: Excellent led Tv for the price. Easy to set up but when the on-screen instructions were a little confusing I called Visio customer service and was impressed with their responsiveness and expertise.  I now have a Visio case number which gets me fast access to a Rep.  Connection to my home network was fast.  Love the remote button which connects directly to Amazon prime free movies.  Couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Picture, Fantastic Value!
Reviews.Author: DWitzel
Reviews.Content: I just got this TV, actually the model without the smart features but the same size and picture quality and it's awesome! I absolutely love the picture quality and the brightness of the TV picture, it's such a sharp image and a beautifully thin screen frame which I love! The setup is quick and easy! The only thing I would say that's a bit lacking are the built-in speakers, it's a little quiet when watching some images, I find myself turning it up to 85 out of 100 in order to hear from movies, however, you can always add external speakers or a speaker system to go along with this TV, it's a fantastic value and TV, I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: I URGE YOU TO PLEASE NOT BUY THIS MODEL LINE because of "great price"(HDMI PORTS DEFECTIVE)
Reviews.Author: AMERICAN RIFLE
Reviews.Content: As stated above the HDMI ports on this VIZIO 50" inch model as well as the 60" inch and 70" inch are defective. THE E-SERIES IS INHERENTLY DEFECTIVE. When you are watching anything using the HDMI ports, the HDMI ports lose the signal for a few seconds and then the picture returns. In my experience it was HDMI ports 3 and 4.I decided I was going to figure out if it was the television or my "electronic devices"or possibly the HDMI cables. I decided to do this by connecting all my devices to HDMI ports 3 and 4 of the VIZIO tv as well as a 46" inch SHARP television I already had in my house. I connected everything I had in my house that used an HDMI port with 4 different brands of HDMI cables that I had purchased just for this test as well as the 2 HDMI cables I already had.It was a very long day of testing, BUT THERE WAS ONLY ONE RESULT EVERY TIME!!! 11 ELECTRONIC DEVICES, EACH DEVICE TESTED WAS CONNECTED WITH 6 DIFFERENT HDMI CABLES, EVERY TIME THE VIZIO TELEVISION LOST THE SIGNAL, THEREFORE IT NOT BEING THE ELECTRONIC DEVICES OR THE HDMI CABLES BECAUSE NOT ONE SINGLE TIME, I REPEAT, NOT ONE SINGLE TIME DID THE SHARP TELEVISION LOSE THE SIGNAL.So I decided to send the VIZIO television back to AMAZON for a "new replacement". Guess what happened??? Guess what was defective again??? Guess why I am going to send the "new replacement" back to AMAZON but this time for a refund???THAT'S RIGHT BECAUSE ONCE AGAIN THE EXACT SAME HDMI PORTS WERE DEFECTIVE ON THE VIZIO!!! BTW THE WIFI SIGNAL IS ATROCIOUS DON'T DREAM OF TRYING TO STREAM WIRELESS using WIFI. ONLY USE an ETHERNET CABLE IF YOU MUST. I would recommend using a ROKU or any other dedicated streaming box. Also superb alternatives can be found in the XBOX and PlayStation platforms.

Reviews.Title: Not that smart
Reviews.Author: Lenny433
Reviews.Content: It isn't a true smart TV in the sense that can't "learn" anything. It comes with its own apps and you can't upgrade them. Most of them you've never heard of or are basically worthless. ShowTime app is nothing more then an advertisement app, even if you have Showtime subscription. Only app that's useful is Netflix, Youtube. No Web Browser, no Downloads

Reviews.Title: Vizio dosn't stand behind thier products.
Reviews.Author: AW "aw"
Reviews.Content: When I plugged in a coaxial cable I found that the connector had not been attached to the TV properly. I had bought the TV less than three months prior so I called Vizio but was told that the coaxial nipple was not covered under the warranty. I pointed out that the warranty does not exclude any connectors and since it was obviously faulty manufacturing it should be covered. I was then told the part was not supposed to break so it wasn't covered. Huh? Isn't that what a warranty is there for? When I pointed this out the tech. he responded by accusing me of breaking the TV. I went through three levels of customer support and got pretty much the same attitude from everyone at Vizio. Finally they offered to sell me a new TV for more than it costs on Amazon. Buy your TV from another company or hope nothing ever goes wrong with it. Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: Phenominal
Reviews.Author: J. Nichols "PianoMan"
Reviews.Content: Vizio has really taken up the gauntlet to compete with other major brands like LG, Samsung, Sony, and the like... and they are just as amazing. This model is crisp, with 120 hz refresh rate (great for blu-ray, HDTV, and Video Games). For the price and customizability, you really cannot beat it.It does everything an advanced LG with the same specs would do, only at half the price! I would honestly choose VIzio over LG because I know I am getting quality, but I'm not paying for a name, a brand, a sticker that someone can use to mark-up the price. Don't compare this "Walmart" brand of TV with Emerson or the like, they are completely different. When you buy Vizio, you are supporting technology and integration that easily competes with the big boys.The most important thing I would remind the curious buyer is to ask these questions:- Who makes it (and how does that affect the price)?- What kind of refresh rate does it have (30hz, 60hz, 120hz, >120hz)? Will this be suitable for the type of use I will want to give it (such as hardcore gamer vs. Bedroom local-channel surfer)- What is the best resolution that it supports? What do I have that matches/demands such resolution (such as 1080p, 1080i, 720p)?- Is it LED, LCD, or Plasma (LED lasting the longest and having fewer side-effects such as "image burning," "Pixelational-glitches," and color fatigue)?- How big is the space that I will be using this television for?

Reviews.Title: Very Good TV
Reviews.Author: Phillip Reyna
Reviews.Content: Only have had it 2 weeks-so far so good-great picture.  Yet to explore the "smart features" so far I am satisfied!

Reviews.Title: If I could give it Zero stars, I would!
Reviews.Author: Computerguy
Reviews.Content: So I bought this television primarily due to the price.  It seemed like a really great value.  It has four HDMI inputs, Ethernet, optical out, ARC, and apps, just to name a few features.  The 1080p and 120hz was exactly what I was looking for, and all for under five hundred dollars.  How did things turn out you may be asking…Not well.  Not well at all.I thought I did my due diligence and researched this television thoroughly beforehand, but that was not the case.
