Technician replaced WiFi card but it still did not work.  Centurylink adjusted modem setting but it still did not work.  I like the TV  but wish I had not spent the extra $50 for the smart TV. I am unable to connect to Netflix and Amazon for streaming.

Reviews.Title: Excellent inexpensive TV!
Reviews.Author: Mark Jacobs
Reviews.Content: Love the integrated wireless which works with Netflix, Amazon, etc.  The remote is friendly to use with Amazon and Netflix buttons.  The blacks are also quite black.  I recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Seller
Reviews.Author: Margaret Labadie
Reviews.Content: This seller is very reliable and professional.  He was able to replace the first TV I purchased from him because of damage due to shipping without any problems.  I love this television, it is not too big or too small for my bedroom and the picture is very clean and crisp.  I will do business again with this seller and for that I give him and this television six stars.

Reviews.Title: Works great for netflik
Reviews.Author: abid
Reviews.Content: The reason that I wrote this review its because people are telling that the Netflix don't work on this tv , but that's not true. It's because they have slow Internet power. If you have high speed Internet, then their will be no problem for you .

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the money
Reviews.Author: rpm
Reviews.Content: The VIZIO E320i-A0 works just as advertised. It's picture is good and is easily adjusted. The internet functions are a big plus. We mostly use Netflix, and there is a special purpose button on  the remote that navigates there with one button push. Entering text for searches is a bit clunky (arrowing across a letter grid on the screen), but that isn't any big deal. We mostly use the TV for DVD use and Netflix streaming, and it has performed very well for that. We use an attic antenna to get local TV broadcasts. The receiver seems to be about as good as another off-air receiver that we used with a different TV.Connections in the rear of the set are well labeled and easy to access. The stand is a bit flimsy, but after three weeks the set, which is reasonably light weight, is still standing.Given the price, this is a great deal for a 32" TV.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: tprice5
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised this didn't have the wireless problems that plagued the 37" inch that I have.  Great picture. Good amount of input ports. I only wish it would've shipped with the qwerty keyboard remote but I had to order that separate. If this TV holds up it will be a great value buy. If for some reason it stops working or I experience any issues I will update this review.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: C. D. Girtz "animal lover"
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for a month and am thrilled w/ my TV. Great Picture!! Can't comment on Audio- have it hooked to a Bose Soundwave. Very easy to set up and operate. Got it for at least $100 less than comparable Samsung, $200 less than Panasonic or Sony. Also used the free Vizio  techsupport to help w/ Wi-Fi hookup- they were very friendly and knowledgeable- though I was surprised when they told me they could not guarantee Wi-Fi networking beyond 30 ft. Turned out I needed to upgrade my router-old one wouldn't have been fast enough to stream movies even if it had connected. I really enjoy watching movies at home again with this quality TV and it's smart features.

Reviews.Title: I'm glad that I bought one with "internet apps".
Reviews.Author: Croft  McCready
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with the price and performance of this HDTV. Generally, it has excellent picture quality, though I've discovered a miniature white-spot in the screen which I barely notice...I don't know if it's worth complaining about, but mostly I don't want to be without my new TV, because I'm enjoying it so much.

Reviews.Title: This a great TV
Reviews.Author: Edward J Chuhta
Reviews.Content: Great.  This TV is fantastic and works as advertised.  I would recommend this to a friend.  The price is good too.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: SteelRain81
Reviews.Content: The TV is amazing for the price.  Picture is excellent and the TV looks amazing.  The only negatives are that the remote sometimes take a long time to register with the tv requiring me to press the same button over and over until the TV responds.  Additionally, I had difficulty having the TV connect to my wireless router.  After about an hour of going through troubleshooting I had to connect my TV with an ethernet cable.  The apps also did not work on the TV right out of the box.  It took another 30 minutes to totroubleshoot them as well.  Once I was done troubleshooting I had no further issues.  Overall, a great TV for the price.

Reviews.Title: Like it....
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: I ordered this HDTV after ordering and returning the Vizio 42" model from Woot....while refurbished I expected it to be fine, was not and return was painless. I realized I could fit the 47" model and placed the order; I also ordered the Amazon HDMI cables to replace all my composite video ; they are a great value.I continue to amazed by Amazon delivery....all items were ordered mid day Wednesday and with Prime 2 day delivery expected Friday delivery; cables came on Thursday morning about 9:00; the HDTV Thursday evening about 8:00 PM!Installation was easy with the HDMI cables, set up even simpler. Since the cable router was so close I chose the Ethernet cable connection rather than wireless. The HDTV is connected to an Onkyo tuner and it really felt good disconnecting all those other cables and be all connected with three.Picture quality is great, no issues and am hoping it stays that way!

Reviews.Title: Satisfied with my Vizio
Reviews.Author: Bernell Bishaw
Reviews.Content: I bought a 20" Vizio for my bedroom 5 yrs ago and it is outstanding. I decided to upgrade my livingroom with a flat screen so I bought the 47" Vizio. set up was so easy, from unpacking to programming. picture quality is great. The remote on the 47" is smaller than my 20" but both are compatible with each other. As far as sounds, I will hook up my bose system which will inhance it for sure. But all TV brands cannot have quality sounds without an additional system.I started out with Zenith in the 70's to Sony in the 90's but now sold on Vizio in 2013.

Reviews.Title: technical service leaves something to be desired
Reviews.Author: jerry
Reviews.Content: Once set up the TV is everything I expected - with the exception of my inability to get wireless internet reception without first having to hard wire the set to a router.technical support appears unable to address problems with set up beyond a series of impossible requests, which ultimately appeared to be unnecessary because easier solutions to basic set up problems were available.disappointed with support - the set is now fine

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Ken of SWFL
Reviews.Content: Great TV......set up only took a few minutes....setting up wireless connection was simple ( I am not a tech person)Picture clarity is very nice ...watching Amazon or Netflix on this TV is a wonderful experience

Reviews.Title: Disappointed in the off angle picture
Reviews.Author: M. Hitchcock
Reviews.Content: Set up was very easy, but the picture quality is very dependent on viewing angle and degrades pretty quickly as you move away from the center.  I have an older Sony flat screen that didnt have this problem at all.Update 22 June:  I decided to return this TV.  I couldn't live with the picture quality.  The Amazon return process is as easy as the ordering process --> thankful for that.As a recommendation, if you are using this in a narrow room, or a location where you will always be straight on to the television, it is great.  Otherwise look into a Sony (what I replaced this with), Samsung or LG.

Reviews.Title: Excellent valve and performance.
Reviews.Author: James Zampino "jimmy zamp"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my vacation home in colorado where we only have internet and no Tv service so the smart function was important. The internet service is not the fastest at 15mbs and I thought I would have to run a hard wire for the Ethernet .Not so as the Wi Fi function is working great for streaming Net Flix and U tube.I wish it came with a key pad remote like the 47 inch visio I have in my home .I am also sup-prized how good the sound is  with the rear speakers.It is in a small room and the sound seems to bounce of the wall behind the TV and fills the small room nicely.Picture quality is excellent and rivals much more expensive brands.

Reviews.Title: Really great TV.
Reviews.Author: margaret
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for a summer home , and wish that I had it in my year round place.Crisp picture. Very easy to use remote. Great sound.I may have to purchase a second one!

Reviews.Title: Great quality, Excellent price
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Haneline "Misplaced Chicagoan"
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews prior to deciding on this new purchase.  Because I have Amazon Prime - I am making the most of it and this purchase was a long-time coming. As other reviews state, this television is a Smart TV and that enables me to connect to Amazon Prime streaming video, You Tube, Facebook, and a few other online sites.  Ultimately I chose this TV over a few others because the others did not have the Amazon access.Set up was SUPER EASY.  I did it myself and needed little more than a box cutter (to open the box) and a phillips head screwdriver. It took two minutes to connect the base to the bottom of the television. I already had my HDMI cables (but if you do not have any - these are a must for any new TV you purchase).  I hooked up my blue ray player, cable and ethernet and that was it.As is my style, I do not read instructions, but that is okay because this Smart TV was pretty easy to figure out.  We have been able to watch our You Tube playlists and favorites, take a look at Facebook, access Amazon Prime streaming video, access other web media and videos and watch TV (of course!).We had a 720 dpi LED/LCD Sony Television that we purchased a few years ago and that was our only main screen TV in the house.  The quality was fine for our needs but we wanted to put a TV in the playroom for the kids so we were due for a new one.  This TV is amazing in picture quality.  There is a noticeable difference in the picture when we access HD stations.  It is so crystal clear and sharp.  I find myself watching not so interesting shows just because the picture is so good!  The cool thing too is that the footprint of this TV is no bigger than our 31" was... it just has a smaller frame around the screen.  It almost looks smaller than our 31" Sony (or maybe 32").I am extremely happy with my purchase and would definitely recommend this TV to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Vizio's low-tech model
Reviews.Author: Lucien "Luke" Tarderon "Luke Tarderon"
Reviews.Content: This is sa decent model. We used it as a bedroom tv. Low tech, not for viewing te big game due to 6o Hz refresh, not for state of the art screening rooms duw to the 720p limitation. But hey, the family likes it and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: Excellent HD TV
Reviews.Author: MKhan
Reviews.Content: Excellent quality considering the price. 40 inch is a good size for a mid size living room. Also the whole WiFi thing makes for less wiring.

Reviews.Title: Received it Broken
Reviews.Author: Rajkumar Goenka
Reviews.Content: As soon i removed the TV from the box, i saw some scratches and cracks on tv, but i thought they are minor, so i just switched it on, to find out, it was cracked all over the TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Espinosa
Reviews.Content: I think purchasing this TV was a great deal, and I am very happy with it. 50" LED Smart TV for under 500 dollars, you can't go wrong!The picture quality is great, even in my living room which gets a lof of sunlight. The Smart features are convenient for playing movies, and even videos off a USB drive. The sound quality is ok, but I am looking forward to getting a sound bar or 2.1 system.I would use the smart tv features more if I had a full qwerty keyboard on the remote, but they do sell the upgraded remote for around $30 dollars.In conclusion the picture, functionality, and price make this 5 stars for anyone that is a normal tv viewer.

Reviews.Title: A little difficult to set up, but this TV is great!
Reviews.Author: Ross Bagne
Reviews.Content: I got this television yesterday. I had some problems setting it, but this Television is great. I am very happy.Yesterday, I received it via FedEx. I had no problem connecting it to my cable connection via HDMI. It came on just fine. At first I was a little disappointed with the screen image. But what I soon realized on the second day, is that you have to let the electronic components "burn in." It takes some time, but I found today that the screen image is really great. ALSO, I was disappointed with the speakers, they are not very good, BUT, I was anticipating that anyway. I wasn't too surprised.THEN the second problem I had was getting all my devices connected. I had to connect an Onkyo amplified, Marantz speakers, a Sony DVD recorder, and a Harmon/Kardon DVD playback machine. These are old devices, but I didn't want to buy new ones.Then, I had to get the WiFI to connect to my Cisco Router.ACTUALLY, the process wasn't too bad at all. I think it took me 4 or 5 hours. I am a "Prime Member" at Amazon. It was very easy to set up the connection. I had no problem.So, I am really happy with this television. I have absolutely no complaints in spite of the problems (which you always have setting up computer devices). It goes with the territory. There is still some tweaking and adjusting I can do, but I am sure it won't be a problem

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: kellynivey
Reviews.Content: This tv set up quickly with little fuss. It is half the weight of our older 42-inch gallevia vizio tv with a larger crisper screen. The wi-fi connected easy and the apps feature is very fun and easy to navigate. I'm not sure what others are complaining about with the sound. Considering what can be done with a chassis this size at this price point, it is better than I expected. If you want premium sound in a small package, buy something made by Bose or connect an external solution. The set-up was a little time-consuming simply because the remote has no keypad, but since I only had to do it once, it's not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Nell Gibson
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this television. Great price and lots for the money. Good picture and sound is good. Intended to buy wifi speakers but found that its not necessary.

Reviews.Title: Good "entry level" smart t.v.
Reviews.Author: Chaoscowboy
Reviews.Content: Arrived on time with no damage...very easy set-up...only disappointment is the rather cheap remote that came with it. Still a good purchase.

Reviews.Title: SMART TV NOT So Smart
Reviews.Author: FRANK
Reviews.Content: Unable to get internet functions to work(will not download streaming functions)even with a 3 bar signal strength.Obsolete firmware version installed & VIZIO says I have to wait for up to 3 weeks for update.Vizio customer service useless & rude.If TV is located to area in home with 5 bars sgnal strength function works with download speed of 17.5 mbs .All other wireless equipment in my home works in same area(3 bar signal) but not the Vizio TV.Too bad it was purchased as a bedroom TV,but does not work where it is to be used.Amazon tech support tried to help but unable to get VIZIO to provide the firmware update sooner & offered a 10 % discount on the purchase price.Will not do purchase any other VIZIO products or service due to poor customer service(Rude & unhelpful !)

Reviews.Title: VISIO is the best!
Reviews.Author: Army Aviation1 "Army Aviation 1"
Reviews.Content: This is our third VISIO Flat screen and we have been very pleased with all of them. This Smart TV gives you the window to Netflix that is a great alternative to today's regular cable programming with the many reality TV programs and other garbage being broadcast. The picture quality is outstanding and the sound needs little enhancement to give you the surround effect you crave while watching your favorite sport or action movie. I recommend this TV for any mid size applications in your home, I know you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: TV has potential but not so great
Reviews.Author: LaShawndra Thornton
Reviews.Content: Although there were less expensive tvs to purchase, CNET gave this tv decent ratings and I thought the extra money spent was worth the "smart" capabilities and the energy star certification. If I would have opened and install this tv within the 30 days of receiving it, I would have returned it. Now, I'm just stuck with it. So, my issues are as follows:1. There is a static line across the top of the tv. You can never see it when it's on a HD channel but, it's there for SD channels. It gets really annoying when trying to focus on a move or tv show2. It takes about 5-7 seconds for the tv to turn on. When you're trying to catch a show and are in a rush, those extra couple seconds are crucial3. Sometimes, when turning on the tv, the volume isn't present. I have to turn the tv on and off 2-3 times before the volume reappears.So, I just wonder when the tv is going to completely stop working because its demise is on its way. If only I would have installed in when I first received it....

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: D H AZ
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these TVs for the house... They are great, easy to setup... The ONLY thing I have found wrong is that the TV freezes up once and a while..Then after they reset they have a loud bang from the speakers... I have a 60 in from the same company and it does the same thing. Its not a big deal but still happens... The HDMI spots and cable connect spots are in a bad spot in a way... The power cord is on the other side of the TV making it look really bad if you place the TV's on the wall... The APPS on the TV are awesome and love them... You have Amazon, Netflix, VuDu movie apps. You tube, Yahoo, twitter, facebook. You are able to connect to your computer via blue tooth and settings on your computer need to be set up for this... All the TVs I have great sound as well...

Reviews.Title: Sorry I didnt but 2
Reviews.Author: Mr. Blue
Reviews.Content: This Smart TV has been a pleasant surprise. Sturdy and easy to setup. I have it attached to my HTPC in the bedroom as a monitor but I don't turn on the PC that regular now since hooking this up to my WI-Fi network and setting up Netflix.It is not glossy and fancy looking but lets face it you won't but this to admire it but to watch television.So far it has been mainly set it and forget but mine has few quirks but not major problems.Occasionally the Wi-fi connection would freeze or drop out, simply disconnecting and reconnecting to the network fixes this anyone familiar with wifi devices will know that sometimes you may have IP address conflicts when devices reconnect to your router.The main quirk is that some times there is no sound. I solved this by just going to the menu and turning off the internal speakers and then turning them off.Overall this TV performs, I can easily say this TV spends more time on than off in my house. If I had a second one I would not have to negotiate with the wife and kids about watching Netfilx.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: KingofHearts
Reviews.Content: Like: Inexpensive, Internet connected, picture quality great, mounted easily with a cantilever swing arm.Dislike: cheaply made base - unsteady - but as noted above, I mounted it on an arm; audio does not sync precisely with video when viewing HD channel - I guess I can live with it for the priceI bought the extra warranty.

Reviews.Title: s'good
Reviews.Author: WarrenT. "WarrenT."
Reviews.Content: 1st HDTV/Flat Screen - whaddadifference! -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --------------

Reviews.Title: Great TV (and even better for the price)
Reviews.Author: KT
Reviews.Content: Just received the TV, perfect condition, nice to have it delivered to the front door.  At ~55lbs, it's actually pretty easy to maneuver.  Assembly was pretty easy, although I did have a problem with one of the screws (its washer was funky) but took about 20 minutes total to get it right.Set-up was a piece of cake-- seriously, couldn't be easier.  They have a set-up wizard that walks you through the process, and you are up and watching in no time.  It attached to my wireless network pretty much automatically.The sound is just OK.  I'm not too fussy, so I will leave it as-is, but I can definitely see why people recommend investing in the sound bar.The turn-on time is a bit long (compared to my last TV, I guess), but not really a big deal.  Changing channels also incurs a delay, although I'm not sure how much my cable box contributes to this.Summary-- this is a really great TV, huge and nice picture, with minimal drama in setup (both physically and electronically/wirelessly.)  I wish I had bought one long ago!

Reviews.Title: Extraordinary TV
Reviews.Author: Reem Alnefaie
Reviews.Content: This tv is a great tv. It has a nice view and I  really like it. Believe me there is nothing to worry about. Every thing as I expected even the shipping was on time. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, OK Smart TV Functions, OK Picture, Marginal Remote
Reviews.Author: Pignutr
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to go into Master Bedroom, to this end it is a great product.Size - the size is perfect and it looks nice.  It is very lightweight, which can be problem with tipping if it is grabbed by a toddler or small child (pet perhaps).  An adult will have no problem setting up and moving around.Picture - the picture is OK, you can it is muddled a little, but for the price it is pretty darn good.  Off angle viewing is ok.  Overall, it's not as crisp as some of the more expensive versions, but works exceptionally well for the bedroom.Smart TV - this is one of the key reasons I bought the TV, to this end it is just OK.  I like the functionality of the banner method, but don't expect to be doing much surfing.  It works excellent for Amazon Prime, Pandora, Yahoo Weather, and other simple interfaces.  Overall, I'm pleased with this function but I'm not inspired to learn more about it based on the current method.Remote - basically the remote is marginal at best.  It has no lighting and it's easy to get the remote the wrong way in the dark.  It fails the bedroom test because of no lighting!  Sometimes it's a little hard to get the response from the remote, not sure if that is aiming problem or operator error, but still, it's a remote, it shouldn't be complicated.General - the TV is very, very, very, very, very, slow to turn on/boot up.  It's about like watching paint dry!  Of all the most annoying things, this one tops my wife's list of what she hates about this TV!  The TV is much more energy efficient than what it replaced and it can handle a couple HDMI's, 1 component, and a few other inputs.Overall, I really like the TV with all it's little shortcomings.Update after 3 months ownership!  It still takes a lifetime to turn TV on, my wife wants to throw it out!  Starting to accumulate dead pixels, nice.  Audio is noticeably bad.  Remote is quirky, TV may not respond even when pointed directly at it from 15 ft.  Orginal review 4 stars, updated to 3, starting to get disappointed.Update 2/4/2014 - This TV has been moved to the deck, could no longer stand the amount of time it took to boot up/turn on.  Works ok outside, probably the best use as it is cheap enough you can buy a new one every couple years vs buying a true outdoor TV.  On the whole, I would not recommend this TV to anyone looking for even just an average quality TV, I recommend staying completely away from it.

Reviews.Title: Zero Support
Reviews.Author: Steve Butler
Reviews.Content: I am sorry I bought this Vizio after I found out they have ZERO support for their products. I had a 26" Vizio I sent in for repair. They do not have a repair facility but instead send you to some company called ITI. ITI makes you pay up front & what they do is just take in your TV, throw it on the shelf for a few days, then call you & say they don't have the parts & ask if you would like $25 or your TV back. There was one circuit board in that TV. They should have never taken it in when they KNEW they did not have parts for it.I am sure their warranty repairs are not any better because they DON'T do them.

Reviews.Title: Terrible product if you are looking for a TV to watch Netflix.
Reviews.Author: lindz
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely terrible product, I can't say enough bad things about it.I bought this TV almost exclusively for Netflix. Of course once we set it up we discovered Netflix would not work and we got "Can't connect to Netflix" error. We searched online and tried every fix we could find. Nothing worked. The next day I called tech support, we ran through all the fixes again (all the ones I had already done) plus they reset it from their end. Netflix worked for one sitting then back to the error. Called tech support again the next day after trying all the fixes again and some serious scouring of the internet.On the second call I gave them my theory, that it was a faulty wireless adapter as the connection speeds I was getting was terrible (< 1000kb/sec) at times and Netflix needs at least 3000kb/s to stream. We concluded my internet connection itself was fine as no other devices were having problems and we tested the speeds. Under that assumption the sent me a new TV.Vizio had excellent shipping speeds, getting it to me in 2 business days. I set up the new TV and tried Netflix. It worked! Thank goodness, it was indeed just a wireless adapter problem. Then the next morning, it no longer works. Once again, I tried all the fixes and once again I could not get the darn thing to work. The internet connection was sketchy, sometimes getting <1000kb/s, sometimes getting > 6000kb/s.So no, it was not a faulty wireless adapter, it is something else and I give up. The TV just does not work the way it should. I want this TV for my kids to be able to watch Netflix on and I'm not interested in a TV that works 1 in 5 times. From what I have read on the internet, I am not alone in this and it is happening with a HUGE number of their smart tvs in every size. Vizio needs to do some major work and figure out what is going on with their faulty smart tvs.

Reviews.Title: Like
Reviews.Author: zoltan horvath
Reviews.Content: Nice and easy set up, beautiful picture, easy online, I will buy another one when I need one more. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: unbelievable. Amazon is advertised on the remote but can't be accessed on the tv.
Reviews.Author: bellkcamp
Reviews.Content: I bought the tv specifically because I have amazon prime which I was told could be accessed through the tv.Vizio or Amazon decided to drop the amazon feature from the tv. I feel like I was duped into paying extra for this 'smart' tv. The unreal part about it is that the remote has a button that says "amazon" on it. The button does nothing when pressed. nothing. could be the silliest purchase i have ever made. I hope I can return it or get a refund for the extra money I spent on it.

Reviews.Title: Have owned over 3 years
Reviews.Author: Bri
Reviews.Content: We purchased the tv when it first came out. Spent over $1100 on it and at the time did not include 3D glasses and now cost over $50 for a pair of glasses. The TV's quality is good. Is great for gaming and great for those that have Netflix or hulu plus. And having Pandora on there is a plus. But there are times the vizio symbol blinks and won't turn on or off and must be unplugged for a period of time. Didn't start doing this until about a year after purchasing. And now has problems with volume from time to time and weird noises the speakers make. We purchased it in 2011 and are already looking to buy a new tv to replace it.

Reviews.Title: So,so performance
Reviews.Author: C. D. Harbert
Reviews.Content: Mediocre picture, about what I expect in this price range. Netflix and Pandora work well. Doesn't compare to my 7 year old Panasonic plasma, but I did not expect it to.

Reviews.Title: The Netflix app is HORRIBLE for this TV
Reviews.Author: Pam K Thompson
Reviews.Content: I bought this"Smart TV" to be able to watch Netflix.  So far every movie we watch loads and loads and loads over and over again.  A 2 hour movie lasts 3 hours!

Reviews.Title: Ok for the price except for internet access
Reviews.Author: DG
Reviews.Content: Unacceptable contractural requirements to get internet access. Rather than legally bind ourselves to their whims in perpetuity we just use our blu-ray player or computer.  The remote is too small, has the internet access buttton where the enter button should be and has few options for viewing size.  Picture is good but screen is very reflective so not made for bright rooms.

Reviews.Title: Looks Cheap, Feels Cheap But it is not Cheap, price wise !
Reviews.Author: Juan
Reviews.Content: I currently own a 32" Vizio TV set, it is about 6 years old, I had no issues except for the remote that broke shortly after I bought it, I bought this new 32" VIZIO E320i-A0 720, and I never thought that VIZIO will produce such a piece of no good plastic, it looks cheap, it feels cheap but the price is not exactly cheap $288.00, the image is the worst I have ever seen, the WiFi lacks power and drops very easy it does not have the option call MTS for channels that broadcast in different languages, I am returning it to Amazon, what a waist of my time,I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS TV FROM VIZIO, it does not even  make a good computer monitor, useless. "DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME WITH THIS TV"

Reviews.Title: just what I expected
Reviews.Author: Beth A Hartman
Reviews.Content: Holy Smokes! I did not think this would be delivered all in one piece and during the winter.  I'm not sure what I was thinking, but I am glad I did.  There were so many ways this delivery could've gone wrong, but instead it was packed with extra care and was delivered later in the day when I was arriving home so wasn't out in the freezing cold very long.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality
Reviews.Author: joewyo
Reviews.Content: Ordered this in November and it wouldn't power on after about 3 weeks. Amazon replaced it and the 2nd one arrived with something rattling around inside even though the packaging showed no signs of damage. Not going to take a chance on a 3rd so getting a refund for the 2nd one.

Reviews.Title: buggy
Reviews.Author: milen dimitrov
Reviews.Content: one day works, next day don't want to power on. need to unplug it for 2 minutes, and plug it again. and this every week 1 or 2 times

Reviews.Title: Smart TV review
Reviews.Author: Abigail Pope Spurrell
Reviews.Content: Although labeled a smart TV, you have to have a very fast Internet connection or it will be very choppy and constantly reset streaming videos.  On bad days, it stops every 10 seconds.  We ordered a cable to go along with it for the days it doesn't work but probably shouldn't have wasted our money on a "smart" TV...

Reviews.Title: THUMBDRIVE also required for photo viewing, in fullscreen.
Reviews.Author: Cazzy
Reviews.Content: Not possible to get a full screen shot (of your pictures) unless you are using a thumbdrive (formatted/fat38).  Small view only when using card reader or camera cable.

Reviews.Title: Mediocre at best
Reviews.Author: Tommy
Reviews.Content: The 39 in. is a mediocre TV. The max viewing angle is very small. The entire screen is too dark, even at maximum brightness. Otherwise the picture quality is decent.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase for the money
Reviews.Author: DLayna
Reviews.Content: This television was delivered right on schedule to the door.  It was easy to hook up and put together.  Any questions regarding the remote can easily be found on the internet if you have a unusual cable company and want the remote to work effectively.  the picture resolution is very good and had adequate HDMI hook up for the usual DVd, home theater and XBox capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Great TV Great Price
Reviews.Author: Bob S
Reviews.Content: This is nice TV Vizio has come along way in their quality. The only thing I do not like about it is it takes awhile to start when you turn it on.

Reviews.Title: Good 32 inch LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Donzee
Reviews.Content: The TV works well and with the picture set up per a reviews it look realty good. I always use a proven picture setup as they are much better than what comes from the Mfg. I also installed a Vizio sound bar with wired sub woofer. The streaming is fantastic as it comes in in higher resolution than the TV is connect to, It is on just cable no hi def but it is when on a streaming movies.

Reviews.Title: Good but no Internet xp
Reviews.Author: Ndeye
Reviews.Content: The lack of browser makes this model a little frustrating when it comes to online experience. Too bad because the picture is real nice.

Reviews.Title: Mom's new toy
Reviews.Author: Ralph Molina
Reviews.Content: Features are excellent for the price, but I noticed that HD picture is not neat in all channels. Even adjusting colors, they look too flashy

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I expected and wanted
Reviews.Author: JH
Reviews.Content: Great tv for the price.  Easy to use.  Perfect for bedroom and for watching Netflix movies directly without a Roku or XBox.  I've had it for a few weeks and the only downside I have noticed is that it takes several seconds to turn on.  Otherwise, I really have no issues with it and would give it a higher rating.

Reviews.Title: Love it and it was delivered in less then 3-days from purchase!
Reviews.Author: InFlowCEOMOM
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality, sound and access to the wi-fi components. would definitely recommend. It was delivered even 3-days from purchase which was phenomenal timing considering we live in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: Smarter than I gave credit
Reviews.Author: J. Tilley "PS3 seeker"
Reviews.Content: I am bumping this up to 4 stars from my previous, scathing review about the poor quality of Hulu playback. Apparently, I just needed to change my wifi router from channel 1 to 11 because of interference. Hulu playback is still not a 100% flawless, but it works quite well now. Great picture. Biggest drawback is the OS seems a bit slow, but for the price I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: S. Terpstra
Reviews.Content: The price was good. It looks as good as a new set. I received it quickly. It was easy to set up. Had it working quickly. Great picture and sound. WiFi works good. It will buy another Vizio when my old 35" tube set gives up.

Reviews.Title: 5 star TV but - No Internet Browser!
Reviews.Author: Chris from Ohio
Reviews.Content: So, it DOES have an internal WiFi connection which connected right up to my Wireless-N router no problems. Was kinda neat just plugging it into the wall and having Amazon Instant Video, Netflix, and Pandora right there ready to go. Took some time to enter all the required login/account information using the remote and onscreen keyboard, but that' wasn't really surprising.WHAT WAS SURPRISING is that the TV does not have a standard web browser OF ANY KIND. I'm not the only one who has complained about this. The TV's apps are provided through the Yahoo Connected TV Store. Yahoo claims that because using the onscreen keyboard and remote is such a lousy experience for surfing the web, they did not build a browser app. They apparently have no intention of ever doing so. Yeah, I understand their reasoning, I just disagree. I personally would have bought a different TV if I had known it didn't have a browser. I know I must be living the past here, but THAT WAS A BIG FEATURE I REALLY EXPECTED and I am VERY DISAPPOINTED it doesn't have it. Of course, in my case I had specific plans to use the TV for general web content in a business setting. A simple bookmark feature in the browser would have solved any usability issues for me. The worst part to me is that it could still /easily/ have one, if Yahoo simply allowed me the choice to decide how lousy of an experience I was willing to endure to use a browser myself. My guess is that a general web browser doesn't fit with the marketing vision they have for their app store. That's just selfish.Otherwise, the TV's great. It has every type of connection *I* can imagine. The picture is sharp, the sound is good, the onscreen controls complete. It works just fine for a piece of entertainment equipment at home. I'm still looking for the TV I need for the office, but at least now I know to dig a little deeper into where the apps come from, and that Yahoo is a giant red flag. I assume that this affects all Vizio TVs, but I am no authority there. If they change their position and begin offering a web browser, I'll update this review as soon as I become aware of that.

Reviews.Title: good for the price
Reviews.Author: Linda L Valdez
Reviews.Content: I am satisfied with the TV but , apparently low-end TVs do not have two hdmi outputs.  I had to purchase an hdmi switch and two additional hdmi cables which added $60 to cost...might have bought different TV if I had known.

Reviews.Title: Problem with remote
Reviews.Author: c080331
Reviews.Content: There doesnt seem to be a problem when it is being used as just a television. I bought it so that I can monitor the stock market and watch my shows too.  However, in order to watch any of the apps, the remote must be utilized. There doesn't appear to be any way around it. I have called twice about the remote, which worked after I did as instructed. But it is again not working. I am not happy.

Reviews.Title: Great display with Incredible sound
Reviews.Author: Don Smith "Donny"
Reviews.Content: 1. Excellent picture2. Good sound from 2x10 watt speakers3.Decent apps4.Good looking tv with thin bezel5.No regrets6.Would buy again7.Go for it

Reviews.Title: Nice pic, No surfing
Reviews.Author: William A. Vickers
Reviews.Content: Nice picture and the apps work great, but there is no way to surf the internet (no Browser capability).  Was a little disappointed in that.

Reviews.Title: WoW!!!
Reviews.Author: Howard Berry
Reviews.Content: This TV is unreal!! The picture is out of this world! I have a Vizio already and it's good but this smart TV is very, very well put together.

Reviews.Title: vizio tv 32-inch  smart tv
Reviews.Author: linda gibney
Reviews.Content: I really like it so far the picture is nice and clear I had to hook up a converter box since I didn't notice tuner wasn't built in,  but over the air pic is clear the shipping was fast next day, but I do live close to a amazon warehouse. it hooked to the internet fast I would recommend this smart tv to anyone

Reviews.Title: ok i guess
Reviews.Author: Dennis M. Banks "Overjoyed"
Reviews.Content: led back-light seems to flicker a lot (maybe I don't have it set-up right - not sure if there is a way to set-up tho)very long turn-on time (3 times the length of most other units)picture quality is no where near what I was led to believe, nor as good as even my LCD models (I just sold a Toshiba and a Sony and believe I may have made a mistake)currently I have a Samsung, Emerson and a LG besides the  2 new Vizio 42" and this one and as for all the items I have spoke of they all out-shine the Vizio'sOnly good thing I could come up with was the Internet stuff and the fact there are quick buttons to that on the remoteI will not be recommending this or the 42" to anyone, as a matter of fact these have caused me to probably stay away from Vizio in the future

Reviews.Title: As described.
Reviews.Author: K.H.
Reviews.Content: I am not a super high-tech junkie, but this TV seems pretty nice to me.  The picture is beautiful and bright.  The cost is lower than I have seen elsewhere, and it arrived quickly.  It is very light and easily to slide around to set up.  The interface is easy and I had no problem setting up my Netflix and Amazon Prime accounts. I did take one star off because there is only one AVI connection.  I know that things are moving to HDMI(there are five of those), but I still have old gaming systems that only use AVI. Also, it seems like the remote control is a bit picky. You have to point it at the exact left corner to get it to work. I would use a universal remote, but this one has Netflix and Amazon access buttons.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: tara burnside
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv because of its wifi capability.  However, during the setting up process the tv was never able to connect to my wireless Internet.  When I called vizio techical support I was told that a "co-star" device was needed to access my wifi and that without this device (that can only be purchased from vizio) I could only access the Internet via a local connection.How dsappointing!The wifi single band feature described in the techncical specifcaions for this tv means nothing without the co-star, apparently.

Reviews.Title: 3rd Vizio for the house.
Reviews.Author: J. Maehl
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd vizio that I've bought for my house. The main reason I think most people buy this tv brand is the cost. The picture has always looked good. The sound a little sketchy when turned over normal levels. The one thing I don't like on all 3 vizios that we own is that hulu works very slowly. Once it finally loads up you can go to most popular shows and get to a show that way. But when you search for a show and try to access it that way it fails 85% of the time. Also a bummer that the remote buttons don't light up.

Reviews.Title: UNABLE to play television.
Reviews.Author: Faye Cook
Reviews.Content: Major problem - we are both over 70 yrs, so have almost no knowledge of any technology. Subsequently we have not been able to start this television. I would really like to return it and replace with a normal teoevision that plays DVD's. I really am not able to rank it fairly because of our lack of tecnical knowledge.It is siting on our dining room table gathering dust.. (not needed expense for just gathering dust.)

Reviews.Title: Smart Part worked for awhile then it quit.
Reviews.Author: rmr
Reviews.Content: Wished I'd not purchased it. Worked fine for several weeks then the Amazon app would not work. Tech had me follow a script to erase memory and have not gotten it to work again.. cannot load app again.. I'm frustrated to have to spend hours to try and get this thing to work again.  I think I'm through buying any new tech electronics till they can make them work correctly.UPDATEI'm editing my review. I did work several hours fooling with the smart part of the TV. It truely was frustrating but after downloading the manual from Vizo Website I did get the Amaxon app back on to the TV itself. I then had to get on to Amazon.com and go to help and find a link to reregister my TV. After this was done I was in business again.It has been working ok for the last two days now. The people at Vizo do have some fairly quick help when needed but it's hard to hold a cell phone in one hand and type on the computer and chat too as well as work the remote too. I was asked for the serial number of the TV and it's hard to see it on the back of the TV when it's mounted upon the wall.The TV I deem now as "OKay", just due to the frustration. At times the thing will just say "Loading" and never load the app or program. There is a "Network" option in "Settings" on the TV and you can see your wifi signal strength. This may be part of their problems as my Kindle can stream a movie just fine in the same room.One other problem. My digital reception was ok untill I hooked up a blu-ray player and my reception went to pot. I finally just unhooked the hdmi cable and cleared up my reception. Is that not frustrating?I've ordered another TV antenna so I'll see if I can get a better signal with it. Then I'll try the Blu Ray player again and see what happens.

Reviews.Title: Sucks!
Reviews.Author: Bora Ozturk
Reviews.Content: I am unsure how this Tv can get more than one star. It is terrible. Remote simply doesn't work! When I called customer service they asked me to do a power reset. I did it. There is still a lot of latency; you press a button and sometimes it executes the order right away and sometimes in three seconds. I keep on getting cryptic error messages. I had to call customer service twice and write them once. I bought two smart tv vizios and would love to return them both. Over the years I owned pretty much any brand tv. ANYTHING is better than this.I bought these in late march. They don't work properly. Customer service says I cannot return them. Never again!

Reviews.Title: Vizio is a terrible company to deal with.
Reviews.Author: donald boatman
Reviews.Content: I bought the TV and it worked great for 2 months, then it quit working.  Unfortunately, Amazon has a 30 day return policy, so they were no help.  Lesson learned: Don't buy big electronic items from Amazon.  I called Vizio about the TV and they were very helpful, at first.  They talked me through a diagnostic process on the TV and told me they would get me a new TV.  We emailed the purchase receipt, and a few days later, Vizio called to set up an appointment to bring out a new TV and take the broken one.  About a week later, Vizio called to tell us they were canceling the appointment and we would not be getting a new TV.  So here we sit with a broken TV.  Vizio's customer service is terrible.  I will never buy another Vizio product.

Reviews.Title: a bit too greedy
Reviews.Author: Jim Beard
Reviews.Content: TV is OK, not as good as the first one I bought. Hate the way the new Netflex app works but that is minor. What is major is customer support. It is non existent. I might as well have bought it off the back of a truck at midnight in an alley.Their help number will send you in a continuous loop. No one will answer because it keeps sending you to the same place no matter which numbers you push. I have emailed but I think of the many people who can not email on the spot, have to borrow some ones phone to email and It makes my blood boil. Kick sand in the poor peoples face why don't you. I judge you on how you treat your fellow human and you failed.

Reviews.Title: This TV is not good at all.
Reviews.Author: snowflake2312
Reviews.Content: 1. The picture is grainy... even on HD cable channels.2. On the menu there is a Lip Sync for Audio. I have an $80 HDMI cable cord hooked up and when I was watching an HD channel the voices were still off! It was worse for non HD channels. The kicker is that the Lip Sync choices make it  worse and even faster than the people speaking... My Samsung never had lip sync issues.3. I upon returning this TV I was informed that Vizio is going through an economic crisis so they are cutting corners to make new products. The plastic that covers the entire back of the TV smells awful. One time I had an oil plug in radiator that overheated and shorted out... It sparked and the knobs burned and melted. That is what this TV smelled like right out of the box before it was plugged in. The casing will always smell. And when the TV is on it will always heat it up to enhance it.So those were my 3 reasons I had to return this. I don't want to support a bad company. I suspect this quality could also cause health issues for me.

Reviews.Title: Audio & Video is good. But wifi ???
Reviews.Author: Ravikumar Sundaram
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV few days ago. The Amazon  delivered it a day  earlier than expected.* The TV's audio and video is really good.* It is not connecting to wiki properly. When  it connected couple of time, It received low signal and the bandwidth < 1mbs. The apps were not working. I thought  there is a issue with my wifi connectivity. i verified the connectivity in laptop and PC, they are really good. i called Vizio support to get some help, they were not able to fix it and they said there could be a problem with my internet. My laptop and PC's broadband speed test showed more than 20mbs.  Then, i called my internet provider, he confirmed that there is no issue with my connectivity. i decided that there is a problem with my TV wifi receiver. i will return this TV to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: DUD
Reviews.Author: Richard Philips "foot doc"
Reviews.Content: Sent back to Amazon. No sound . Read online that others had same problem because Vizio uses cheap capacitors in products. I would not buy again.

Reviews.Title: Horrible!!
Reviews.Author: Immanuel P.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product in time for NAB All-star weekend to host a party. The TV looked refurbished, and used..the screen wasn't attached to the frame..and the frame was loose. The remote had scratches and the picture quality was blurry even with my HDMI connection !! By far the worst product I ever bought from Amazon. Yet I don't blame Amazon, it was "electronic101Deals" who is a seller on Amazon. This is suppose to be a 2013 model and looks nothing new, and suppose to be a Smart TV ..but when I would press the power button, it would take the TV like 60seconds to turn off ?? And the TV would freeze when I would go to Netflix

Reviews.Title: TV never worked properly so I returned it
Reviews.Author: Robert M. Priest
Reviews.Content: TV  would boot up and then work for 20 or 30 seconds before it stopped responding to any commands from the remote or controls on the TV. This behavior continued for 2 days before I returned it.

Reviews.Title: Damaged
Reviews.Author: innervoices
Reviews.Content: I can't rate the quality of the television because the unit arrived with internal damage to the screen.  The box was also missing the remote control.  That being said, the return and refund process appears to be working nicely.

Reviews.Title: tv does not stand straight up with stand .it leans back.
Reviews.Author: heath
Reviews.Content: i didn't even get to hook it up and check the quality of this tv, because I took it out of the box, put the stand on ,and it leans back. I don't understand this . why would anyone want there tv angled back. it makes no sende to me.especially because I was trying to set it up higher then eye level. needless to say , I packed it up and shipped it back. I definatly would not recommend this tv.

Reviews.Title: What a piece of Junk
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Went through 3 of these TV's before I said skip it, send me old faithful Samsung for a little more. Word on the street was Vizio was making a good name for themselves with customer service and better products. Well Customer service  ...maybe... but TV WAS JUNK. Smart Tv, froze over and over.. had to unplug from wall to restart.. THANKFULLY AMAZON RULES! they sent me new Tvs each within days of problems with these. Im Positive had I bought this at a Big Box strore, id be screwed.. and stuck with a broken tv.. DO NOT BUY THIS TV

Reviews.Title: PICTURE IS NOT GOOD
Reviews.Author: Jmhorner
Reviews.Content: This was a good price but the picture on it is terrible!! It is blurry and not sharp by any means. Thankfully it was for my 4 year old birthday she doesn't complain but if I had to watch this as my main television I would be disappointed. I purchased a Vizio before and the picture was great compared to this.

Reviews.Title: Beware Electronics101deals is NOT an authorized seller for Vizio
Reviews.Author: Sonia M. Teran
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv and a 42inch tv from this company and 5months later I had to return the 42inch because of picture problems. Well the manufacturer warranty is no good because electronics101deals is not an authorized seller of their product. I also found out the serial number attached to my tv was originally sold to Walmart and was returned. So not only did the company sell me a used tv advertised as new it was defective and the manufacturer warranty is void and now I have to ship the tv back to them, which is still in the process so I will update once I see if the company follows through with a replacement tv. I hope the other tv I bought from them lasts longer because then I'll be in the same boat.

Reviews.Title: Screwed by Vizio and Amazon on 50" LED TV Repair
Reviews.Author: Free Run Juice "Love Tiny Bubbles!"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this on January 14th, 2013 from Warehouse Deals, Inc. (a division of Amazon).  While they called it "used-like new" (I believe to get around not being an authorized Vizio dealer)it was in unopened OEM packaging with all OEM cling film attached.  In other words, brand new! At the time of purchase this TV was new to the market and hard to find, I had done my research and made the purchase.The picture quality and features of this LED Smart HDTV are fantastic!  Very high on the PQR (Price Quality Ratio) scale, nice job Vizio.  However, this is where it all falls apart, no support!  On July 8th, 2013 the TV quit working (nothing, blank screen).  This TV is in a MIL unit above our garage and has less than 200 hours of use.  I contacted Vizio support and walked through the reset procedure with the tech on the phone to no avail.  I was given a case number and told to email in my sales receipt (which I promptly did).  This is the email I got back from Vizio yesterday:Dear Valued Customer,Thank you for your recent submission to VIZIO.Your attachments are on file. To help expedite your case, please contact Vizio at 877-878-4946 Monday-Friday 7:00AM to 9:00PM CST and Saturday/Sunday 10:00AM to 6:00PM CST, please have your case number or serial number ready when calling.We will also attempt to contact you to move forward with your case if we have not heard from you.Thanks for choosing VIZIO and have a great day!Follow Up TeamVIZIOO 877.878.4946  STEVENS PORT DR, STE DD750,  DAKOTA DUNES SD 57049Innocent enough, except when I called to help expedite (as suggested above), I was told that there wouldn't be any warranty coverage because I had purchased from a non-authorized dealer!  What a crock, Amazon has it's own Vizio store (no matter what corporate shell it's under, it came out of the same damn warehouse)!  This thing is less than six months old with less than 200 hours of use and they won't stand behind it?!  Okay, well at least Amazon will step up for a valuable "Prime" customer, NOT!  What gives in this world?  Past the 30 day exchange/refund window, end of story.  Well, not quite.  You see I purchased the TV with an American Express card that has Extended Warranty on purchases.  This saga isn't over yet, but, one thing is for sure, I won't be buying any more Vizio products or anything from Amazon Warehouse Deals!  Sorry guys, you need to step up and do the right thing here, please fix it!In the end my TV will get repaired or replaced, but, the amount of my wasted time and effort has been amazing (not to mention not having a TV for 2-3 weeks).  It will be interesting to see how this American Express Extended Warranty Claim program works, as this is a first for me.

Reviews.Title: Not a true Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Dawgstar
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV because the description indicated that it was a Smart TV, i.e. that it has internet access. I don't have cable TV at my house, but a lot of the shows I watch are available on the show's website on the internet, such as Modern Family. Well, you can access the internet, but only the sites available are the ones that Vizio has a contract with - the Amazon streaming video site, Hulu plus (you can't access the free Hulu site), Rhapsody, etc. I wanted a TV with internet access so that I could access TV shows for free on their internet web sites. That can't be done with this TV - you can't access google or any search engine, and the only websites available are those that are available in the Store Apps. Most of them are free downloads, but then you have to pay to view any TV shows or videos. Definitely not real internet access.

Reviews.Title: Want to put a 3 1/3 star rating
Reviews.Author: Austin Duerfeldt
Reviews.Content: If you want a budget led smart tv this is a good one.  I am just disappointed with it due to the picture quality.  I did have a 42" Vizio XVT model and I loved it the moment I plugged it in.  After an unfortunate moving incident the screen got cracked.  I bought this tv to replace my XVT, but in my book it was a down grade.  The tv remote is cheap.  It does not have the slide out keyboard nor is it bluetooth.  The picture quality is ok, but is no where near what my XVT was.  I am looking into finding someone to repair my XVT, but everyone tells me it will cost too much.  So, if this is your first LED tv I think you will like it, but for me it was a let down.

Reviews.Title: SmartTV Glitch
Reviews.Author: tipstir "My Professional Review"
Reviews.Content: I had purchased this set this past week from BJS Wholesale. I had VIZIO 22-inch 2012 model in white no issues with that one. But let me tell you this one I didn't know it's their top of the line model for 24-inch LED/LCD HDTV with Smart TV.Getting this home and this was for the outdoor patio I have roof so it won't get wet. Mounted this on the masonry block using the stand sold here called: VideoSecu TV Wall Mount Articulating Arm Bracket for VESA 100 LCD LED Flat Panel Screen TV and Monitor ML10B 1E9.Now taking this out of the box and mounting using the 4x screws from VideoSecu works out just find. You have up to 30lbs weight of a HDTV that can be mounted. So techically speaking I could install the VIZIO 29-inch LED HDTV (this one is not 1080p) it's the old 720p which you don't want because when it comes to modern computers it will not display 1920x1080p. It will do 1080i @60hz but you can't do blue-ray and games that requires full HD.But just to let you know this set does, but quality of the image is poor, along the edges of the image being shown.Also I don't use CATV anymore so I have everything connected via two 40-mile HD-ANT (80-miles with two of them plus the ant joiner) also purchased here from Amazon called: RCA ANT751R Outdoor Antenna Optimized for Digital Reception.First scan of 70 channels and yes I have 70 channels they keep on adding more channels that you get from CATV non-premium ones. VIZIO does scan all the channels but it failed on two and added them as live stations. Those are analog and are not used. Compared this set to SONY, Element Electronics and Toshiba which don't add no working channels to the line-up.Once you get through loop, you have to setup the VIZIO WiFi is what I could only use because of where it was going. The set does have Ethernet port on the rear. You can't miss it huge impact on the box.What I've learned from VIZIO Customer Service Tech in SD, is the WiFi ANT used inside this HDTV is weak not as strong as it suppose to be. This is another reason why I had so much issues. My WiFi here I use the ESR600H sold on Amazon also. Strong signal WiFi Router used as AP (access point). It has 4x 5dBi ANT two external SMA removiable and two of them internally.  Plus this unit has high amp.VIZIO telling me the HDTV is not getting enough signal. The but the set is showing 5 bars and in the system info report shows the signal is 100%. The issue is the way the HDTV was first designed. They don't want you to use WPA2 they want you to leave it open, which doesn't make sense.Networking on this suppose to be easy for those who don't understand how everything works. But setting the set to DCHP by default where you should use Static IP address instead so it doesn't keep changing in the main router the IP address. Even if I do the correct way it still doesn't allow Amazon Prime Instant Videos to display or even load.The other issue is with Netflix after all the tweaking and clearing of memory and resets to factory defaults doesn't do really anything than it did prior.So if you hoping that WiFi going to work, you better search about this model before you decide to buy it or not.Final outcome from Netflix Customer Service Tech was that the VIZIO will not talk to our servers. He was right it will not and when it tries to I get that ERROR TVP-805. Always.Sound on this set sound like the first VIZIO Razor LED I had back in 2007/2008 was a nightmare. Last year was the first time trying them again on the Kitchen HDTV 22-inch. That one works. Why can't this VIZIO 24-inch do the same with Smart TV.Smart TV is based on Yahoo, so best you have that account. Your going to need it. Otherwise you'll be in Guest mode always.Of course you can remove the apps from the list, and just keep what you want. So many of them.  about 23 apps that needs to load. That's nothing I had updated the HDTV via internet yes, that works on this but only on certain apps via WiFi. Now how is that possible when I just said Amazon Prime Instant Videos and Netflix app didn't function right?I know, but again certain features work and some are not ready. Yes I have the latest firmware for 7/13. But let me tell you out of the box the update only was 18 apps. The set only did up to 23 apps after I had to reset it 4x times.I've tested a few apps to see how they work with my WiFi network setup. Vudu works, in HDX so this is real odd how some apps works and some don't. To watch Vudu in HDX you need a strong internet which I do have.Downloads 132 mbps and uploads 22 mbps. I own 8x SONY SMP (N100 and N200) these are network Media players which offers the features of what you have in a Smart TV but they allow you tap into your Windows 7/8 shared folders for Music, Pictures and Video. Where the VIZIO HDTV Smart TV doesn't give you that option. It's just are Internet Smart TV that's it!Youtube works also just to let you know, the quality in the imaging on this HDTV is not smooth  with the edges of the subject or object on the screen. That's now how it suppose to be unless the set is using Compressing to send smaller packets (data) through.What you get from the set is very sparse on inputs: 1 HDMI, 1 Component plus L/R Audio, 1 Composite L/R Audio, 1 Ethernet Port,  1 RF Coax - CATV/DTV, 1 15-pin VGA port PC, 1 Optical OutLast year VIZIO HDTV 22-inch White you get 2 HDMI all of the above except for the Ethernet port.The VIZIO 2013 this model the remote has all the features you need to control the set, but there is another remote for with more keys sold here on Amazon for $11 bucks. E241i-A1 - VIZIO XRV1TV Qwerty keyboard.Instead the box the PSU power code is very different you don't really see those types in a TV more in radio or small PSU. Also the cord is short too. Two AAA batteries, the stand (cheap plastic type) This was use in the VIZIO 22-inch had one just like it. The design of the 2012 model is better up front. Has curve at the bottom for the speakers. Thus this allowed me to mount it over my Microwave.This model doesn't give me that option to do that, it's larger, but again the size of the VIS = visual image size is smaller. VIZIO unless stated true 24-inch edge to edge. This model VIZIO E241i-A1 really 23.56" and my VIZIO E220VA White 22-inch was 21.53".Do be warn that the front of the set is busy with ID brand tags in grey over glossy black. White is also available seems more pure white than the E220VA White model I have in the kitchen right now seems off-white a bit, but the box read white on it.Also one more thing these sets are not high contrast using coated panel that gives off a shine to it or also called Ultra Bright Panel. Gives you the appearance of glass but not really glass. Without this features colors and dark areas won't be at their best.Need to go into a store that carries this model and test it out. Then get it off Amazon to save on the purchase.After all what was said I had returned this set for Toshiba 23L1350U which has 23/23-inch display so it's true 23-inch. E241i-A1 gives you 23.56 so you get .56-inch more.23L1350U, not a SmartTV Toshiba calls that CloudTV on certain models it offers it. I don't need that feature and already have 8x SONY SMP-N100/N200 here which doesn't give me the trouble with WiFi on the apps included Netflix, Amazon Instant Video an etc.. all play 100%.Yes E-Series 241i-A1 takes 8 seconds depends on your model but even in the store it didn't start up so quickly after the logo "V". Toshiba start quick after "Toshiba" red logo started. Both models are new built in 2013.Toshiba has 3-HDMI ports, 1080p LED Slim, full DTV Info Guide and Special Audio System EQ for more detail to sound quality really loud.I have it paired up with: Philips 5.1 Home theater 3D Blu-ray player HTS3541/F7 also sold here on Amazon. The audio sync up with the Toshiba meaning you turn up the volume and it points to the Philips when the Philips is managing audio surround.Again do test out what you buy first, if you can. If you don't need a (Smart TV (does require internet access) Wired or Wireless Router too. Cable or DSL modem. Smart TV features add more to the HDTV package, If that features doesn't work 100% then you'll end up like me returning it for a model that doesn't offer it.Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware - Sound Quit After 20 Days Out of the Box!!!
Reviews.Author: BayGirl
Reviews.Content: Update:  My initial review was that this was an all right TV.  I've since changed my mind as it's not even been 3 weeks of VERY LIGHT use and the sound on my TV has stopped working.  All I have now is a wonderful clicking noise that I can turn the volume up or down to listen to, or can turn off the TV entirely and listen to it click.  To say I'm disappointed would be a gross understatement.  Vizio themselves were also a huge disappointment in that it's going to take at least 5 days for anyone to just *call* me to set up a time to get this repaired.Amazon has been great in standing behind their product offering either a refund or a replacement, but with this TV out of stock I'm looking at another month.  I am torn with getting this replaced as I've no confidence in their product whatsoever to actually be functional for any amount of time.Original review: So, I think this is a pretty decent TV. Reviews.Title: Can't compare to Sony LCD from 4yrs ago!
Reviews.Author: Kat "Reviewer @ Shivers Of Horror"
Reviews.Content: I've had a Sony BRAVIA S-Series KDL-46S5100 46-Inch 1080p LCD HDTV, Black for about 4 years. But from day 1 the sound was messed up. I recently attempted to get it fixed through my Walmart warranty and the company deemed it unrepairable after a few repairs. So they gave me a reimbursement check for $700 and I purchased this TV.The reason I went with this tv over others was because I only had the $700 to spend and I needed a 3/4yr warranty plus I HAD to have streaming capabilities since my BluRay players capabilities were all messed up and I no longer subscribed to Xbox Gold. I had to have access to Netflix and Amazon.We originally purchased this off Walmart's website but it only had 14 reviews at the time. We unpacked it and plugged it in and set up couldn't have been easier. But right away we noticed that the colors were way off. Tried every different combo they had preinstalled and all looked like garbage. It was either too red or too dark. I fiddled with a ton of settings, finding different combos online for other Vizio TV's and nothing looked quite right.On top of that issue I noticed that the HD aspect of it wasn't as clear and "soft" as my Sony. I remember when I first plugged in my first HDTV (the Sony) and was blown away by how "soft" people's faces looked in HD. This TV does not have that. In fact, it almost looked grainy and pixely.I attempted to change the TV settings to that of my old TV. And it was almost impossible since they had completely different areas to adjust. But what I could do I tried and it looked horrible.What is amazing is our old tv was a 60hz LCD, and this is a 120hz LED and the old one was much better!Because of these issues, my husband is on his way to return the TV right now and exchange it for Vizio Vizio 47' LED 1080p 120Hz HDTV | M470VSE I really hope that one looks better!UPDATE 4/2/13: Returned this and got the new TV. The new one is a LOT better (although, sometimes the audio is out of sync). No major color issues like this one, and I was able to tweak it enough to my liking. The pixels don't look all screwy either. While I'm no professional TV person, I know what should be right with TVs, and this one was all wrong. Maybe I just got a bad one out of the bunch. But I stick by my review.

Reviews.Title: unHappy
Reviews.Author: ChrisH
Reviews.Content: I bought the Vizio E470i-A0 because I thought it would be a good quality for the price.Had this model since Nov. 2013.From the beginning, this Vizio model has had a bug/defect.When you turn it on about half the time, the brightness is not working properly. Picture is dim.Often I must turn the TV on & off, between 2 to 5 times, to get the brightness to work properly.I have tried changing remote batteries, using the TV power button itself, and doing a factory 'reset', which is all the help Vizio tech support offered.Also, the remote has a poor response.You often need to hit which button control 2 or 3 times before the set responds.You must aim the remote very carefully.They should place the sensor in the middle, or have 2 sensors, on each end of the TV.The remote itself has a cheap feel, and the battery lid easily pops off, with the slightest drop.It is also difficult to use the various settings to adjust the picture, and the Manual is not very helpful.The picture tends to be overly blue or purple, no matter how I try to adjust it.The picture is not all that bright and clear.The Power on light is difficult to see. I wish they had used a red or bright blue LED.Cable is difficult to screw on in the back of the TV.I'd like to find a Firmware update for this model, but Vizio has apparently not put out one.On the plus side, the HDTV was well packaged and arrived fast.And I do love that you can play Videos from a USB drive, directly on the Vizio.It is just an 'OK' HDTV, but I doubt I will buy another Vizio product again.

Reviews.Content: we like the tv...the picture quality is great, the reception of over the air channels is very good...unfortunately the wifi connection is pretty much useless...it could not recognize our router, although it did recognize one from a neighbor (our router is less than 75 feet from the tv set and every other wireless device we own receives the signal in every room of the house)...our samsung BluRay player receives signals from our router and six other neighbors, our iPad also recognizes several other routers in the neighborhood (the houses are on half acre lots, so there is quite a bit of distance between the houses)  our iPad can receive the signal almost anywhere on our lot and iPads have notoriously weak wifi capability)we would have sent the tv back because of the wifi issue, but the price difference for non-smart sets was not enough for the hassle this would have entailed.so, three days later, we ordered a roku3...it is installed and working fine...the setup is a bit tedious, but once that pain is behind you, you'll love it

Reviews.Title: Would be perfect.. If it worked?

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: michelle cruz
Reviews.Content: The Vizio E500I-A1 I purchased this TV on the 8th of May and received the TV on the 16th the TV was returned on the 20th of May. The Vizio is a decent starter smart TV that has mediocre picture quality. At first look the TV looks like a Winner the design is great. If you want to design a room buy the vizio just dont turn it on. The sound is average and The smart Apps are okay but nothing to brag about. I purchased this TV at Dell for $599 to replace my 2yr old Sony EX700 and thought i was getting a great deal BIG MISTAKE.  The TV has a WIFI that has no on or off switch which means it will take up bandwidth in your house when the TV is on. I called Vizio and asked if there was a on off switch and the agent told me the only way i could turn off the WIFI was to reset to factory settings That was the first turn off. Next the picture clarity on the TV is average at best for a LED. The blacks are not dark and true and there is a constant blurr when watching. If i had to rate this TV on a scale of 1-10 my rating would be a 5. Bottom line if you do not want to spend alot of money on a TV the vizio is the way to go. If you are like me and you want quality, performance and durability spend the extra money and buy a Samsung or a Sony. There is an Old saying you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: You will not be able to look up anything on the Web besides the few lame apps installed.

It had full internet browsing capability through the Google app.  Anything you could look up on a computer, you could look up on the TV.
